loans.name: Gloria Elena

texts.es:
Gloria Elena con 55 años de edad, es conviviente, vive con su esposo, en casa propia, en una comunidad pequeña en la zona rural del anexo Sipan-Saña y goza con buenas referencias personales y laborales de parte de sus vecinos, dicha comunidad esta ubicada en el distrtio de Saña, provincia de Chiclayo, región de Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Gloria Elena se dedica a la actividad de crianza y venta de cerdos, con más de 10 años de antiguedad en el negocio, en su propio domicilio. Gloria Elena solicita préstamo para la compra de alimento para sus cerdos, para poder venderlos a un mejor precio y asi poder obtener más ingresos y poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Gloria Elena is 55 years old. She lives with her husband in a house of their own. Gloria Elena’s neighbors can provide good personal and professional references of her. They live in a small rural community located in the region of Sipan-Saña, district of Saña, in the Chiclayo district, which belongs to Lambayeque, a region located on the northern coast of Peru.

Gloria Elena raises and sells pigs. She has been doing this at home for more than ten years. She is requesting a loan to buy feed for her pigs. She will sell them at a better price which will result in more profits and thus better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed for the pigs she raises.

loans.name: Mirsulton

texts.ru: Мирсултон поступил в Таджикский Государственный Университет Коммерции 2 года назад. Данное время он учится на втором курсе по специальности экономика и управление в предприятиях. Он учится успешно и получает только отличные и хорошие оценки. Его преподаватели гордятся им. Мирсултон старается получить хорошее образование и после окончания университета работать и развевать экономику страны. Он запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Mirsulton enrolled in Tajik State University of Commerce two years ago. He is currently a second-year student majoring in economics and management. He does very well at university and receives only the top grades. His professors are proud of him. Mirsulton strives to receive good grades and after graduation, he wants to work and develop the country's economy. He is requesting a loan to pay for his tuition. He awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to pay for his university tuition.

loans.name: Roselda

texts.en:
Roselda is 45 years old and married with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Roselda has a fishing business in the Philippines. Roselda requested a loan of 24,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Roselda has been in this business for twenty-seven years. In the future, Roselda would like to save enough money to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Bardhok

texts.en:
Bardhok wants to add ten more goats to the existing herd of six goats and six sheep and he needs your financial help; the amount he’s requesting to achieve this goal is 100,000 Albanian Lek (ALL). He is seen in the photograph taking his animals for grazing in the mountains around the town where he is resident. 

Here is what he said during the interview: “I wake up early in the morning to take my animals to graze in the areas around; I do this every day and never get bored; I love looking after them. I sell baby goats and dairy to the locals and I make a good earning, but I wanted to make more money and this is the reason I requested this loan that will be the first one for me.”  

Bardhok is a villager in his early 60's with three children who lives in the suburbs of a town in the northern part of the country.

loans.use: to add ten more goats to his herd

loans.name: Daysi Suyapa

texts.es: Daysi, tiene 42 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos y vive en un sector del municipio de San Pedro Sula, Cortes. Ella siempre se ha dedicado al negocio, antes vendía tortillas y topogigios, hace un año estableció una pequeña pulpería en su casa donde vende productos alimenticios. Vende arroz, frijoles, sal, café, pan, huevos, churros, harina, azúcar, manteca, productos de higiene  y otros.  Ha solicitado un préstamo para mejorar su negocio. El préstamo es por 8,000 lempiras y comprara un frízer y carnes para la venta. Su plan es seguir creciendo, piensa ahorrar para comprar una vitrina y vender pollo frito con tajadas también.
texts.en:
Daysi, who is 42 years old, is a single mother with two children and lives in a sector of the San Pedro Sula municipality of the department of Cortes. She has always been a saleswoman. In the past she sold tortillas and topogigios (popsicle-like treats) and one year ago established a small grocery store in her home where she sells food products. She sells rice, beans, salt, coffee, bread, eggs, churros, flour, sugar, butter and hygiene products among other things. 
She is requesting a loan to improve her business. The loan is for 8,000 lempiras and will allow her to purchase a freezer and meats for sale. Her plan is to continue growing, she is considering saving up to buy a glass display case and sell fried chicken with plantain slices.

loans.use: purchase a freezer and meats for sale

loans.name: Serman

texts.en:
Serman is 27 years old and is married, with two children aged between 1 and 3, not yet going to school. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy more fertilizers for rice production. The profits from the business will be used to buy modern cattle.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for rice production.

loans.name: Dolgormaa

texts.en: Mrs Dolgormaa who is 51 years old, lives with her husband and two sons in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. For 13 years, she has been selling bags at a trade center after importing them from a bordering city of China. Her husband has retired from work and gets state pension. The house they live in has been deteriorated over the years and it needs some renovation. So she is requesting a loan of 3,500,000 MNT to buy building materials such as bricks, cement, fiberglass and foam for house renovation. After renovation, her family will begin to live in a more comfortable and warm place where less coal is necessary for heating and as a result, less pollutants will be released into the air.

loans.use: to renovate her house in order to burn less coal for heating.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a 57 year old woman married to John, who adds additional income to support their family. They are blessed with seven children. Janet has been a farmer for ten years earning an income of KES 10,000 at the end of every month.

Janet was introduced to Vision Fund Kenya by a neighbour and is now servicing her first loan of KES 20,000 and intends to use this amount to buy cereals to sell to her customers on a daily basis.

Janet plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees for her children and hopes to become a successful business woman.

loans.use: To purchase cereals to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 50 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional stock of items such as canned goods, noodles, eggs and soft drinks to sell.

Wilma has borrowed and paid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of items such as canned goods, noodles, eggs and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Jean Baptiste

texts.en:
Jean Baptiste is 23 years old; he is married, with two children aged between 1 and 3, not yet going to school. He has been farming for 11 years. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy more fertilizers for rice production. The profit from the business will be used to improve his standards of living.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for rice production.

loans.name: Teresphore

texts.en:
Tresphore is aged 34 years and is married, with four children aged between 2 and 10, two of whom go to school. He has been farming for 10 years. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy more fertilizers for rice. The profits from the business will be used for a cow.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for rice.

loans.name: Altantuul

texts.en:
Mrs. Altantuul, 44 years old, lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been selling vegetables to local people since 2001. Her husband is unemployed and currently looking for a job. Their daughter will graduate from her university next summer, and their son goes to high school. 

She is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to pay the tuition fee of her daughter. She wants her daughter to study hard without worrying about the tuition fee.

loans.use: to pay the tuition fee of her daughter.

loans.name: Isidoro

texts.en:
Isidoro is an organic, certified, Maya Mountain cacao farmer who lives in the beautiful village of Silver Creek in the Toledo district of southern Belize. He sees cacao farming as a beneficial long-term investment for himself and his family. He believes that cacao is a sustainable agricultural crop that is both good for the environment and will help develop his local community. 

Isidoro is requesting a loan so that he can expand his cacao farm by purchasing grafted, high-yielding, disease resistant cacao seedlings. He plans to use the revenue generated from his cacao crop to educate his children and improve his family’s lifestyle. 

He says that cacao farming has led to many improvements in his life because of the income that it has generated, and that cacao production is in high demand in Belize.

loans.use: To purchase grafted cacao trees

loans.name: Carlos Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Carlos es un cafetero muy habilidoso con experiencia en varias áreas de la agricultura, con un talento innato para el trabajo en equipo y una gran mente emprendedora.

Tiene un cultivo de Café que atiende todos los días desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana para sacar las mejores cosechas.

Actualmente vive con su esposa y 3 hijos por los cuales ha tratado de luchar siempre para sacarlos adelante.

El desea darle un impulso a su cultivo y obtener mejores ingresos de este, por eso pide un auxilio económico para invertirlo en insumos agropecuarios como fertilizantes, pesticidas y semillas de café; el préstamo le dará la oportunidad de tener un producto de mejor calidad y una mejor producción.

Su mayor sueño es tener una casa propia y brindarles a sus hijos y su esposa un buen futuro.
texts.en:
Mr. Carlos is a skilled coffee producer, experienced in several areas of agriculture with an innate talent for teamwork and an enterprising mind. 
He has a a coffee crop which he tends to every day beginning in the early hours of the day in order to improve his harvests. 
He currently lives with his wife and 3 children, he has always worked hard in order to provide for their advancement in life.
He wishes to give his crop a boost and obtain better incomes from this one. This is why he is requesting economic assistance to invest in agricultural supplies such as fertilizers, pesticides and coffee seeds. The loan will give him the opportunity to have a better quality product and a higher yield. 
His biggest dream is to own his own home and provide his wife and kids with a good future.

loans.use: purchase agricultural supplies such as fertilizers, pesticides and coffee seeds to improve his crops and be able to sustain his children and his wife.

loans.name: Chifuniro Group

texts.en:
Elube is 37 years old and she belongs to Chifuniro credit group which comprises 15 women. She is married and has six children who go school and she also looks after school-going orphans. Elube sells fresh fish to people around Mangochi town and is requesting this loan from Kiva lenders to order more fish from Lake Malawi to reach more customers in her location.

Elube started her business to support the family and to be able to buy household equipment. Before she started the fish business she was selling vegetables and has been involved in the food market for four years. Her ambition is to build a good house for her family and to produce a passport for her son so that she can send him to South Africa for work when she makes enough profits. As a woman she is able to feed her family and she believes that the ‘Business Management’ training will help her to achieve what she wants from her fish business.

loans.use: to buy fish

loans.name: Limbanazo Group

texts.en:
Lucy is 57 years old and married to Speke, 62 years old. She has seven children and two orphans who go to school.  She sells kitchenware items such as pots and plates; her husband is a teacher.  

Lucy is requesting this loan from Kiva lenders to purchase items that are not in stock from Lilongwe town to attract more customers in her neighborhood. In the past she was a farmer, and has been involved in business during previous years.

Lucy started her business to feed her family and to be able to pay school fees for her children, who are still in school. She works from home and at the moment, her family members help on the daily business operations. Her ambition is to open a big shop in a market when she has enough capital, and to satisfy her children’s needs when she has made enough profits. 

Before she started her business, she was unable to support her family and now she is able to pay school fees for her children and she has managed to buy fertilizer for her field.

loans.use: To buy kitchenware

loans.name: Wathu Group

texts.en:
Fatima is 27 years old and married to Imani, who is 34 years old. Together they have two children, one of whom goes to school. The other one is a kid. 

She runs a market stall selling various food items such as tomatoes, Irish potatoes and cooking oil. 

Fatima is requesting this loan to buy goods in large quantities to reach more customers in her compound. Before she started her business she was a housewife; she has had her market stall for six years.

Fatima started her business to improve her family's living standards, and to be self-reliant. She works from the market and currently she has an employee who assists in everyday business activities, together with her husband. Fatima plans to use any profit generated to buy more products that are currently not in stock in order to expand her business. 

She believes that the training she received on ‘Market Research’ offered by Microloan Foundation will help her to achieve what she wants from her business. As a woman, she is able to satisfy her family's basic needs and she has managed to assist her relatives without involving the husband.

loans.use: To buy assorted food stuffs

loans.name: Nodira

texts.ru: Нодира молодая и энергичная девушка. Ей 18 лет. Она не замужем и живет с родителями. Нодира очень умная девушка. Она с детства мечтала поступить в университет и получить высшее образование. Она в средней школе училась успешно. Ее любимыми предметами были права, английский, история и т.д. Нодира в свободное время читает классическую литературу. Она уверена в том, что и в университете она будет учиться отлично. Нодира запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Nodira is an energetic young woman. She is 18 years old. She is unmarried and lives with her parents. Nodira is a very intelligent woman. From childhood, she has dreamed of enrolling at university and receiving a higher education. She did very well in secondary school. Her favorite subjects were law, English, history, etc. In her free time, Nodira reads classic literature. She is sure that she will get good grades at university. Nodira is requesting a loan to pay for her university tuition. She awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to pay for her university tuition.

loans.name: Yanjindulam

texts.en: Mrs Yanjindulam who is 41 years old, lives with her husband and children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been running a cafeteria since 2013. Her husband works as a packager at a food factory. Their children go to high school. She is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to buy building materials such as bricks, cement, fiberglass and foam for house renovation. After renovation, her family will live in a more comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned and therefore less pollutants will be released into the air.

loans.use: to renovate her house in order to burn less coal.

loans.name: Nicolas Ines

texts.es:
Nicolas de 67 años de edadm vive con su esposa, sus dos hijos y 4 nietos entre las edades de 13,18,4 y 3 años.

Nicolas se dedica a la panaderia desde hace 23 años, oficio que aprendio devido a la necesidad de obtener mas ingresos y poder mejorar la calidad de vida de él y su familia, debido a lo que él obtenia de la agricultura no era suficiente para cubrir los gastos familiares y los estudios de sus nietos.

El préstamo que esta soliictando, es para gastos personales como: la compra de algunos electrodomesticos, y la compra de algunos alimentos (maiz,frijol y arroz).

 Nicolas sueña un dia poder ampliar su panaderia y poder distribuir su pan ha todo el caserio, para poder mejorar sus ingresos y darle un mejor futuro a toda su familia.
texts.en:
Nicolas is 67 years old and lives with his wife, two children and four grandchildren who are 18, 13, 4 and 3 years old.

Nicolas has worked in a bakery for 23 years. He learnt this trade out of a need to make a living and improve his quality of life and that of his family, since what he earnt from farming was not enough to cover the household costs and his grandchildren's education.

The loan that Nicolas is applying for will be used to cover personal costs such as the purchase of electrical appliances and food such as corn, beans and rice.

Nicolas dreams of one day being able to expand his bakery and distribute his bread all throughout his village so that he can increase his income and give his family a better future.

loans.use: to buy some electrical appliances and food such as corn, beans and rice

loans.name: Rosa Lina

texts.en:
Rosa Lina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell dried fish business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell.

Rosa Lina has been in this business for 16 years now.

In the future, Rosa Lina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell fruits and vegetables business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional stock of fruits and vegetables to sell for her buy-and-sell fruits and vegetables business.

Judith has been in this business for two years. She earns additional income from pig fattening.

Judith has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 28,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more raw materials for her weaving business.

Anecita has been in this business for 20 years. Anecita earns more income from farming vegetables. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Anecita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Artemia

texts.en:
Artemia works hard to support her family. She is married and has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. Artemia requested a loan of 25,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more material for her business. She has been in this business for 15 years now.

Artemia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more material for her business.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline works hard to support her family. She is married and has a restaurant business in the Philippines. She requested a loan of 13,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional ingredients like spices, meat and vegetables.

Evangeline has been in this business for 8 years now. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like spices, meat and vegetables.

loans.name: Liezl

texts.en:
Liezl is married with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Liezl is 30 years old and has two children who are in school.

She has a buy and sell used clothes business in the Philippines. Liezl requested a loan of 29,500 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional stock of used clothes to sell.

Liezl has been in this business for 7 years. In the future, Liezl would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: purchase additional stock of used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Maria Olga

texts.es:
Que sería de la vida sin agricultores esos trabajadores incansables del campo que trabajan diariamente muy duro para cultivar las frutas y verduras que se consumen en todos los hogares.

Uno de estos grandes trabajadores es maría una cultivadora de café que solo tiene en su mente trabajar y trabajar es madre de 9 hijos, una numerosa familia que cualquier padre se preguntaría como hace para mantener a tantos pues gracias a sus cultivos de café lo ha logrado.

A sus 61 años de edad está llena de ánimos para trabajar y no se rinda y mucho menos se da a la idea planteada por sus hijos de quedarse en la casa que ellos trabajan, solo quiere producir y morir haciendo la labor que le dio a los seres más amados para ella sus hijos. 

María quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de insumos  agrícolas como son abonos, riegos fertilizantes, fungicidas, pesticidas, insecticidas, el monto es considerable puesto que los insumos para el campo son muy costosos.
texts.en:
What would life be like without those untiring farmers who work hard every day to grow the fruits and vegetables that are eaten in all households? One of these great workers is Maria, a coffee farmer for whom work is always on her mind. 

Maria has nine children, a big family that would make any parent wonder how she manages to support them all. It is thanks to her coffee farm that she has managed it.  

At 61 years old, Maria is full of energy for work and will not give up or even entertain the idea that her children proposed, which was that she stay at home and let them do the work. She just wants to keep working and die doing the job that has supported those she loves most, her children.

Maria is asking for a loan to buy farm supplies such as fertilizer, pesticide, fungicide, insecticide and irrigation equipment. The loan amount is large because these supplies are expensive.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticide, fungicide, insecticide and irrigation equipment, which are expensive but necessary supplies for any farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wire, outlet boxes and light switches in order to install electricity in his house.

loans.name: Gulsara

texts.ru: Гулсара трудолюбивая женщина. Ей 40 лет. Она работает учительницей в средней школе в течение многих лет. Гулсара замужем и имеет 3 детей. Ее сын окончил университет по специальности финансы и кредит. Он работает. Ее старшая дочь учится на 3 курсе в факультете Иностранные языки. Ее младшая дочь Мехрангез поступила в Таджикский Государственный Университет по специальности юриста. Гулсара должна оплатить за учебный договор своей дочери и с такой целью она запрашивает займ на сумму 1100 долларов США. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Gulsara is a hardworking woman. She is 40 years old. She has worked as a secondary school teacher for many years. Gulsara is married and has 3 children. Her son graduated from university with a degree in finance and lending. He has a job. Her oldest daughter is a third-year student in the Foreign Languages Department. Her youngest daughter, Mehrangez, enrolled in Tajik State University in the Law Department. Gulsara needs to pay for her daughter's tuition which is why she is requesting a loan for 1100 USD. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's education.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 43 years old, and one of her children is currently in school.

Jocelyn has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 23,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more raw materials for her abaca weaving business.

Jocelyn has been in this business for 15 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials for her abaca weaving business.

loans.name: Vidal Ceferino

texts.es:
Vidal de 33 años de edad, se dedica a la albañileria desde hace 15 años, y actualmente vive con su compañera de vida quien se dedica a los oficios domesticos y un hijo de 5 años y 5 meses.

Vidal tiene 10 años de experiencia en su trabajo como ayudante de albañileria, donde obtuvo sus conocimientos. Además antes de dedicarse a la albañileria estuvo 10 años en Estados Unidos trabajando para mejorar su calidad de vida.

El prestamo que esta solicitandom es para comprar algunas herramientas de trabajo como pulidora, medidas, carretas, y cuchara.

El cliente tiene la necesidad de construir su propia vivienda y piensa viajar hacia los Estados Unidos para contruirla.
texts.en:
Vidal is 33 years old, he has made a living in construction for 15 years. He currently lives with his life partner who takes care of household chores and a son who is five years and five months.
Vidal has 10 years of experience in his job as a construction assistant where he obtained his knowledge of the trade. Additionally, before dedicating himself to construction he was in the United States for 10 years working to improve his quality of life. 
The loan he is requesting is to purchase some work tools such as a polisher, measuring tools, wheelbarrows and trowels.
The client is in need of building his own house and is considering traveling to the United States to build it.

loans.use: purchase some work tools such as a polisher, measuring tools, wheelbarrows and trowels.

loans.name: Essi

texts.fr: Demeurant  à  Lomé dans le quartier d’Adidogomé, Essi  est âgée de 34 ans,  elle est mariée  avec 2 enfants en charge. Essi  fait le commerce de charbon de bois et du maïs comme activité . Elle s’approvisionne  2 fois  par mois  à Kpalimé et  revend  à domicile.  Essi sollicite un prêt pour agrandir  son commerce et faire plus de profit.
texts.en: Essi lives  in the Adidogomé neighborhood of the city of Lomé. She is 34 years old, married and has two dependent children.  Essi works as a vendor selling charcoal and corn. She stocks up in Kpalimé twice a month and resells out of her home. She is seeking a loan in order to expand her business and increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy 19 bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Marcial Humberto

texts.es:
Marcial Humberto, vive en casa propia de material rustico, tiene 2 hijoS de 12 y 19 años de edad, tiene muy buena referencias tanto personales como laborales en su comunidad, la cual esta ubicada en el distrito de Pucará, provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarcam costa norte de Perú.

Marcial Humberto se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de arroz, con una experiencia en el rubro de 30 años, el préstamo que se le otorgará, lo utilizará en labores agricolas, aplicaciones e incorporaciones de productos fito sanitarios, fertilizantes, y mano de obra para su cosecha. De esta manera lo ayudará a la mejora tanto fisiológica, morfológica y productiva de su cultivo, así como también tener una cosecha oportuna, y por ende tendrá mayor producción, una mejor calidad de producto, por lo cual no tendrá problemas en vender su producto.
texts.en:
Marcial Humberto lives in his own home made of rustic materials. He has two children, 12 and 19 years old. He has very good personal and work references in his community, located in the Pucará district of the Jaén province, part of the region of Cajamarca in northern coastal Peru. 

Marcial is a farmer with 30 years of experience, specifically growing rice.

He will use the loan for farming tasks, the application and incorporation of plant sanitation products, fertilizers, and labor for the harvest. This will help to improve the crops physiologically, morphologically, and productively, and will also ensure a timely harvest resulting in better yield and increased product quality. He will therefore have no trouble selling his product.

loans.use: to use in farming tasks to ensure a successful harvest.

loans.name: Abdurahim

texts.ru: Абдурахим родился в 1966 году. Он честный и трудолюбивый человек. Абдурахим женат и имеет 3 детей. Он работает строителем уже более 15 лет. Абдурахим строит дома и всегда старается, чтобы в его стране строились новые и красивые дома. Абдурахим данное время нуждается финансовой поддержке, так как двое его сыновей учатся в университете. Он должен оплатить за учебный договор своих сыновей и поэтому запрашивает займ. Он ждет вашу доброту и ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Abdurahim was born in 1966. He is an honest and hardworking person. Abdurahim is married and has three children. He has worked as a construction worker for more than 15 years. Abdurahim builds home and always does his best so that new and beautiful homes are built in his country. Currently, Abdurahim needs financial assistance as two of his sons are studying at university. He needs to pay for his sons' tuition which is why he is requesting a loan. He awaits your kindness and your generosity.

loans.use: to pay for his sons' tuition.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet works hard to support her family. Juliet is married and has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines.

Juliet requested a PHP 19000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her abaca weaving business. Juliet has been in this business for 5 years now.

In the future, Juliet would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her abaca weaving business.

loans.name: Ma. Luz

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Ma. Luz works hard to support her family.

She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Ma. Luz is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to buy more ingredients like meat, vegetables, spices, etc., for her restaurant business.

Ma. Luz has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients like meat, vegetables, spices, etc.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is 45 years old and married with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur and has children who are in school.

Teresa has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Teresa has been in this business for 16 years. In the future, Teresa would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Samuel Dario

texts.es:
Hay algo que nadie puede discutir en Colombia y es que las comidas hecha a fuego de leña son las que tiene el mejor sabor y es esta la profesión de Samuel quien elabora platos típicos que prepara la aire libre (ver foto). 
La profesión la aprendió hace 6 años trabajando para otra persona y vio que tenía todas las facultades que para emplear el negocio y decidió independizarse y hace 4 años trabaja y piensa en grande tanto así que ahora solicita un préstamo para poder darle la oportunidad a un compañero para que elabore comidas con su receta.

Solicita un crédito para poder brindar un trabajo y beneficiarse tanto a su compañero que necesita mucho el trabajo pues no tiene trabajo pero si una familia que espera un bocado de comida y a él pues sus ingresos se duplicaran,

Con el crédito comprara dos ollas grandes, cucharones, empaques, y surtido verduras, frutas, carnes, etc. 

Samuel es padre de 2 hijos de 16 y 12 años de edad y tiene su meta muy clara en la vida brindarles a sus hijos la oportunidad de acceder a estudios universitarios y que tengan un trabajo más lucrativo que el que tiene hoy en día.
texts.en:
There's one thing no one argues about in Colombia, and that's that food cooked over a wood fire tastes the best. This is Samuel's line of work, cooking typical dishes that he prepares outdoors over an open flame (see photo).

Samuel learned this profession six years ago while he was working for someone else. When he saw that he had all the necessary qualities to run a business himself he set off on his own, and for four years he has been working and thinking big. This is why he is now asking for a loan, so that he can give a colleague of his the opportunity to start preparing foods with him, using Samuel's recipe.

Samuel is asking for this loan in order to give his currently out-of-work colleague a job. By doing so, he will help this colleague to feed his family and also help himself, as his income will double. With the loan money he will buy two large pots, large spoons, packages of ingredients and a variety of vegetables, fruit, meat, etc.

Samuel has two children who are 12 and 16 years old and his goal in life is very clear to him: to give his children the opportunity to get a college education and for them to get better-paying jobs than the one he currently has.

loans.use: to buy a large pot, large spoons, and supplies like vegetables, meat and other ingredients, and to create a job.

loans.name: Damirjon

texts.ru: Дамирчон очень сообразительный, добрый и трудолюбивый парень. Он живет со своими родителями. В семье их 3 детей. Он самый старший. Его отец старается, чтобы его сыновья получили хорошее образование. Его отец и мать занимаются скотоводством. Несмотря на тяжелое условие жизни, он окончил среднюю школу с отличными оценками. Дамирчон поступил в университет. Его бабушка живёт вместе с ними. У его бабушки очень маленькая пенсия. Его семья живет очень бедно. Дамирчон запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Damirjon is a very quick-witted, kind and hardworking guy. He lives with his parents. There are three children in his family; He is the oldest. His father does his best so that his sons can receive a good education. His father and mother practice cattle breeding. Despite his difficult living conditions, he graduated from secondary school with high marks. Damirjon enrolled in university. His grandmother lives with his family. His grandmother has a very small pension. His family lives in poverty. Damirjon is requesting a loan to pay for his university tuition. He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for his university tuition.

loans.name: Leonidas

texts.en: Leonidas is 43 years old and single. She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Leonidas is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to buy additional piglets, feed and vitamins for her business. Leonidas has been in pig fattening for four years and also earns additional income from vegetable vending. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets, feed and vitamins for her business.

loans.name: Jasmin

texts.en: Jasmin is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of peanuts for her food vending business. She has been in this business for six years. Jasmin also earns more income from a general store. Jasmin has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of peanuts for her business.

loans.name: Ma. Joelita

texts.en: Ma. Joelita is 54 years old and has four children. She is married and has one child who is still in school. Ma. Joelita is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Ma. Joelita has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been in pig fattening for 10 years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. Ma. Joelita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Simplicia

texts.en: Simplicia is 48 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.  Simplicia has been in this business for three years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Bunthan

texts.en:
Bunthan (in the photo) is a motor taxi driver, while his wife is a garment factory worker. He has been married since 1996 and has two children, one son and one daughter. The family is living on an Island in the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Bunthan has been driving a motor taxi for almost 15 years. He hopes to change his business from motor taxi to Tuk Tuk, because it could carry more goods and people than a motor taxi. Hence, he decided to apply for a loan.  In the past, they were commonly known as "tuk tuks" (a three wheeled motorcycle taxi), but they are now officially called "moto kangbei" by government authorities.

loans.use: to buy a remoque moto kangbei.

loans.name: Sokchea

texts.en:
Sokchea is 40 years old, and lives in a suburb of Phnom Penh city. She has been married since 2003, and has four children: two sons and two daughters. One of her children is married, and lives away from home. The others attend school.   

Sokchea is a garment factory worker. Her husband is a carver; he does not have his own business, but works for someone and gets paid with a fee. 

Sokchea wants to buy a motorbike for her husband for commuting to work; hence she decided to apply for a loan.

Photo: Sokchea and her husband

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband for commuting to work.

loans.name: Jesus Teodoro

texts.es:
Jesús Teodoro es soltero, tiene 22 años de edad, vive en casa familiar con su abuela, cuenta con buenas referencias personales y laborales, es de familia unida, vive en una comunidad dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganaderia; ubicada en el distrito de Saña, provincia de Chiclayo, región de Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Jesús Teodoro se dedica al comercio(cria y venta de animales menores: patos, cuyes, carneros, chivos), en la zona de sipan, desde hace más de 02 años aproximadamente. El destino del préstamo es para la compra de animales, y asi poder diversificar su stock y poder cumplir con todos los gustos de sus clientes consumidores.
texts.en:
Jesús Teodoro is 22 years old and single. He lives in his family's home with his grandmother and has good references, both personal and professional. He comes from a tight-knit family and lives in a community where most people work in trade, agriculture and cattle raising. It is located in the Zaña district of Chiclayo province, in the Lambayeque region on Peru's northern coast.

For the last 2 years Jesús Teodoro has worked raising and selling small animals such as ducks, guinea pigs, sheep and goats near the archaeological site of Sipan. With this loan he plans to buy more animals in order to diversify his stock and to meet the needs and tastes of his customers.

loans.use: to buy animals to diversify his stock.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en: Marissa is single and has a pig fattening business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase piglets, feed, vitamins and other supplies for her business. Marissa has been in this business for five years now. In the future, Marissa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase piglets, feed, vitamins and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Juvelyn

texts.en:
Juvelyn is married, 37 years old, and has two children.

She is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Juvelyn requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional livestock to raise.

Juvelyn has been for three years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock to raise

loans.name: Marime

texts.en:
Marime is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a direct selling of Mse and Natasha products business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase more items to sell for her direct selling of MSE and Natasha products business.

Marime has been in this business for five years. She earns more income from buy and sell rice.

Marime has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more items for her direct selling business

loans.name: Juan Alfredo

texts.es: Este señor alegre es Juan, está casado con una señora de nacionalidad colombiana, y tiene 3 hijos de 6, 8 y 14 años de edad, mismos que asisten a la escuela, Juan juntamente con su esposa se dedican a trabajar al jornal de tareas en el campo, y tiene pequeñas cantidades de cultivos, comenta que en la actualidad tiene sembrado 2 quintales de papas, el crédito lo va a invertir en la comprar en la compra de fungicidas para cuidar de cualquier enfermedad que puede darle a su cultivo, la meta de este señor es lograr una buena cosecha para la próxima siembra sea de mas quintales de papas para mejorar sus ingresos y sobre todo dar la educación a sus hijos.
texts.en: This happy man is Juan.  He is married to a Colombian woman and has 3 children aged 6, 8, and 14 years who attend school.  Along with his wife, Juan works in the fields where he has small plots under cultivation.  He comments that at this time he has planted 200 pounds of potatoes.  He will invest this loan in the purchase of fungicides to avoid any diseases that may affect his crops.  His goal is to get a good harvest so that he can plant more potatoes in the next cycle.  This way he can increase his income and, most importantly, provide his children with an education.

loans.use: to buy fungicides

loans.name: Jose Marcelino

texts.es: José es un señor colombiano de 60 años de edad, cuenta que su esposa le abandono dejándole un hijo, en la actualidad el joven tiene 15 años de edad, no pudo asistir al colegio debido a la falta de recursos económicos de su padre, entonces no lo puso a estudiar y más bien lo llevo a trabajar al jornal, Jose se dedica a sembrar huertas pequeñas de productos que se dan en la zona donde vive Jose, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de  fungicidas para tener sanos sus cultivos y de ahí aspira incrementar su cultivo para mejorar la calidad de vida de su hijo y seguir luchando para cubrir los gastos diarios sobretodo de alimentación.
texts.en:
José is a 60-year-old Colombian man. He says his wife left him, leaving him with a son. The youngster is now 15 years old and was not able to go to school because his father's low income meant he could not provide him with an education. Instead he took him to work as a labourer. 

José makes a living planting small vegetable gardens with produce which grows in the area where he lives. 

He will use the loan to buy fungicides to keep his crops healthy and so he hopes to increase his crop to improve his son's quality of life. He hopes to keep working hard to cover his daily expenses, particularly food.

loans.use: to buy fungicides.

loans.name: Ranya's Group

texts.en:
Ranya was selected to be a group leader for a loan from MAXIMA. In the group, there are two members, Ranya and Ann.  They are living on the Island of Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Ranya, age 22, is a garment factory worker. Her husband is also a garment factory worker. She just has one young daughter.  She wants to purchase a new motorbike, because the old one does not work well and uses more gasoline. She hopes the lenders will offer her loan! Ranya is on the left and Ann in on the right.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorbike.

loans.name: Las Gaviotas Group

texts.es:
La señora Blandina tiene 45 años de edad, está casada con el señor Camerino, tienen 4 hijos de los cuales 3 son mujeres y uno es hombre. Desde hace ya 7 años, doña Blandina establecióuna pequeña tienda de abarrotes en su casa. Con las ganancias obtenidas y la aportación económica de su esposo quien se dedica a trabajar en el campo y a pescar en la laguna para vender mojarra, sustentan los gastos de la familia. Doña Blandina comenta que al año, cuando la laguna "crece" (aumenta el nivel del agua) debe desalojar su casa y levantar todas sus pertenencias para no perderlas por lo que igual traslada la tienda a casa de sus suegros donde viven dos meses al año, “ya nos acostumbramos a cambiarnos cuando la laguna crece” comentó.

La señora Blandina invertirá su préstamo en la compra de: arroz, frijoles, aceite, azúcar, galletas, aceite, sopa, sazonadores, atún, chiles en lata, papel higiénico, detergente, shampoo. De esta manera podrá surtir su tienda para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.

Las demás integrantes y sus actividades son:

Lidia -Venta De Cosméticos
Angela - Venta De Abarrotes
Juana - Venta De Comida
Clara - Venta De Mojarra
Mauricia - Venta De Pollo

Todas ellas pertenecen a un grupo llamado “Las Gaviotas” ubicado en una localidad productora de caña y de hule. Otra de las actividades es la pesca, cuya temporada más importante es semana santa que es cuando el pescado se puede poner en venta a un costo más elevado. La desventaja de la pesca es que cuando la laguna disminuye la actividad se complica.  

*En la imagen: doña Blandina viste de blusa blanca y falda a cuadros, a su lado posa su hija con vestido amarillo.
texts.en:
Sra. Blandina is 45 years old and married to Sr. Camerino. They have four children, three daughters and one son. Seven years ago, Doña Blandina established a small grocery store in her home. With the money she earns, she is able to assist her husband financially. He works in the fields and also fishes at the lake so that he can sell “mojarra” (a fish similar to tilapia). They both are able to maintain their family’s expenses. Doña Blandina says that when the water level of the lake rises, she must vacate her house. To prevent from losing her belongings, she has moved everything to her in-laws’ house where she and her family live two months out of the year. She says, “We are accustomed to moving whenever the lake rises.”

Sra. Blandina will invest her loan in the purchase of rice, beans, oil, sugar, cookies, oil, soup, seasonings, tuna, canned chili peppers, toilet paper, detergent, and shampoo. This will enable her to restock her store so that she can satisfy the needs of her customers.

The other members and their businesses are as follows:
• Lida sells cosmetics.
• Angela sells groceries.
• Juana sells food.
• Clara sells fish.
• Mauricia sells chicken.

All of them belong to the group named “Las Gaviotas” (The Seagulls), which is located in a community known for producing sugar cane and rubber. Another industry if fishing, which is especially important during Holy Week since fish can be sold at a higher price during that time. The disadvantage of fishing is that the process gets complicated when the water level goes down.

*In the photo, Doña Blandina is wearing a white blouse and a checkered skirt. Next to her is her daughter who is wearing a yellow dress.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, oil, sugar, cookies, oil, soup, seasonings, tuna, canned chili peppers, toilet paper, detergent, and shampoo.

loans.name: Lezel

texts.en:
Lezel is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a handicraft business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more materials like shells, wire, nylon thread and related inputs for her handicraft business.

Lezel has been in this business for seven years. Lezel earns additional income from a general store.

Lezel has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more materials like shells, wire and nylon thread for her business

loans.name: Jenelen

texts.en:
Jenelen works hard to support her family. Jenelen is married and has a retail business selling ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of ready-to-wear clothing to sell.

Jenelen has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Jenelen would like to save enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of ready-to-wear clothing to sell

loans.name: Katherine

texts.en:
Katherine is 37 years old and married with two children. With one child currently in school, Katherine works very hard to provide for them.

Katherine runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, soft drinks, eggs, bread, biscuits, diapers, etc. to sell.

She has been in this business for one year, and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soft drinks, eggs, bread, biscuits, diapers, etc. 

Katherine would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, soft drinks, eggs, bread, biscuits, diapers, etc.

loans.name: Ma. Pene

texts.en: Ma. Pene is 50 years old and married with six children. With two children currently in school, Ma. Pene works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store. She has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as eggs, detergent soap, canned goods, noodles, shampoo, coffee, etc.  In the future, Ma. Pene would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Angie

texts.en: Angie is 38 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase stock to sell like noodles, canned goods, milk, sugar, coffee, etc. Angie has borrowed and repaid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from food vending. Angie aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase stock to sell like noodles, canned goods, milk, sugar, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 45 years old and has one child who is currently in school.

Magdalena has a shell craft business in the Philippines. She requested a 17,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her business. Magdalena has been in this business for six years and she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her business

loans.name: Charito

texts.en:
Charito works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 20 years now.

Charito has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell. She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Jorge Hernan

texts.es:
Jorge es un hombre con todas las pilas puestas para enfrentar el mundo y tener una vida plena gracias a sus esfuerzos.

Tiene un almacén en el que vende productos como concentrados, alimentos, juguetes y accesorios para mascotas en el municipio de La Estrella, Antioquia.

El desea mejorar su oferta de productos y mejorar sus ventas inyectándole capital a su empresa, es por esta razón que solicita un crédito para darse la oportunidad de ser independiente y tener las razones suficientes para dedicarse en pleno a su negocio. 

El dinero será invertido en la compra de surtido como alimentos y juguetes para mascotas con los que actualmente no cuenta.

Tiene grandes esperanzas en su negocio y piensa que su futuro puede mejorar considerablemente gracias al apoyo de estas entidades que hacen lo posible para que las personas puedan soñar con una vida mejor y más estable.
texts.en:
Jorge is a man with his act together and ready to take on the world and have a better life thanks to his efforts. 
He has a store in which he sells products like food pellets, treats, toys and accessories for pets in the municipality of La Estrella, Atioquia. He wants to improve his selection of products and improve his sales to inject capital into his company; it's for this reason that he requests a loan to give him the opportunity to be independent and have sufficient means to dedicate himself in full to his business. The money will be invested in buying assorted treats and toys for pets that he currently does not have. 
He has big dreams for his business and thinks that his future can get considerably better, thanks to the support of these entities that do what they can so that people can dream of a better, more stable life.

loans.use: To buy food pellets and pet's toys to supply his business and be able to improve his life and the life of his family.

loans.name: Hosmani

texts.es: Hosmani de 23 años, desde el año 2010 inició su propio negocio, cuando su primo le enseñó el oficio de reparación de relojes, al que agregó posteriormente su comercialización. Poco a poco adquirió su conocimiento y logro  a través de  su primo,  obtener una experiencia que le ha servido desde ese momento hasta la presente. Su servicio lo ofrece de contado diariamente, trabajando desde las 9 de la mañana, hasta las 6 de la tarde y sus principales clientes son transeúntes y referidos, que se han convertido en sus mejores y fieles clientes. Su meta empresarial es lograr fortalecer su capital de trabajo e incrementar sus ventas. Así mismo  nivel familiar, planea educar a su hijo con calidad  y obtener su propia vivienda, aunque su mayor desafío sea tener el suficiente capital de trabajo, para mejorar su negocio. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará relojes, repuestos y accesorios al por mayor y de contado, inversión que le dará una mayor liquidez, e incremento de su clientela.
texts.en:
Hosmani is 23 years old. He started his own business in 2010, when his cousin taught him how to repair watches. He gradually grew his knowledge and experience of the trade through his cousin, who he has been learning from up until now. 

His business is open daily, and he works from 9 am until 6 pm. His main customers are passers-by and referrals, who have become his best and most loyal customers. His business goal is to increase his working capital and sales. His personal goals are to provide his son with a high-quality education and to own his own home. However, his biggest challenge is not having enough working capital to improve his business. 

For this reason, he is requesting a his first loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which he will use to buy watches, parts and accessories at wholesale and with cash. This investment will provide him with greater liquidity and increase his clientele.

loans.use: to buy watches, parts, and accessories at wholesale for his watch repair business.

loans.name: Hilda Cirley

texts.es:
Hilda es una joven muy emprendedora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante y progresar.

Desde hace 3 años se viene dedicando a la venta de productos por catalogo como ropa, accesorios, artículos de belleza y elementos para el hogar, estos productos los vende principalmente a amigos, vecinos y familiares que conocen a Hilda. 

Desde siempre le ha gustado trabajar independiente y es por eso que se esmera para trabajar y salir adelante todos los días.

Solicita un préstamo para comprar surtido de productos de belleza y ropa para aumentar su inventario y mejorar sus ventas, obteniendo así unos buenos ingresos para colaborar con los gastos de su hogar.

Tiene la esperanza de poder salir adelante gracias al apoyo de las personas de buen corazón que apoyan este tipo de proyectos.
texts.en:
Hilda is a very enterprising young woman with a great desire to get on in life and make progress.

For the last 3 years she has been making a living selling products from catalogues such as clothing, accessories, beauty products and household items. She mainly sells these products to friends, neighbours and family members who know her.

She has always liked working independently and this is why she makes an effort to work hard and make progress every day.

Hilda is asking for a loan to buy a range of beauty products and clothing to increase her stock and improve her sales. This will give her a good income so she can contribute to the household running costs.

She hopes to be able to make progress thanks to the support of the kind-hearted people who support this type of project.

loans.use: to buy beauty products and clothing to increase her stock and keep her business going, so she can improve her home situation.

loans.name: Naruem

texts.en:
Naruem, aged 21 years old, is a garment factory worker. She has been married since 2013 and has no child yet. Her husband is a security guard.

Naruem lives with her parents, whom are vegetable farmers. She assists her parents in the farming business when she is free (shown in photo). She wants to have her own house and live separately from her parents.  That’s why she decided to apply for a loan in order to build her own house.

loans.use: To build her own house to live in.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys es una mujer de 24 años de edad soltera, tiene un hijo y su negocio es la venta de ropa de lana y dralón.
Ella es emprendedora, independiente, constante, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su labor lo realiza en la avenida Buenos Aires una zona caracterizada por el comercio informal, donde se comercializa; ropa, artículos eléctricos, juguetes, etc.
Gladys es de tez morena cabello largo negro, estatura mediana, su negocio lo realiza en la calle, ante las inclemencias del tiempo y el paso de los peatones. Cada mañana a partir de las nueve horas, se dirige a su depósito donde varios vendedores guardan su mercadería y con la ayuda de un cargador transporta su bolsa llena de ropa hasta su esquina donde es su puesto de venta, los días de lluvia son un problema porque no tiene como protegerse. La acompaña su hijo de apenas cuatro años de edad, que se divierte por los alrededores, almuerzan en el mismo lugar y usan el baño público que está en la otra esquina.
Su sueño es tener su propio taller de confección para darle un futuro mejor a su niño. Ella desea diversificar su negocio realizando la compra de ropa de alpaca, para mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
Es por esos motivos que Gladys solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa de alpaca y darle un futuro mejor a su niño.
texts.en:
Gladys is a 24 year-old single woman.  She has a child, and a business selling clothing made of wool and Dralon.  She is enterprising, independent, consistent, responsible, and very hardworking.  She sells on Buenos Aires Avenue.  This is an area that has a lot of informal commerce where people sell clothing, electronics, games, etc.

Gladys has a dark complexion, long black hair, and a medium build.  She sells in the street out in the weather to the passers-by.  Every morning she goes out at 9am to her storage spot where various sellers store her merchandise. There someone helps her transport her bale of clothing to the corner where she has her sales post.  The rainy days are a problem, because she has no way to protect herself from the weather.  She brings her 4 year-old son with her, who is entertained by the surroundings, and they eat lunch in the same place and use the public bathroom located on the other corner. Her dream is to have her own sewing workshop so that she could provide her son with a better future. 

Gladys wants to diversify her business by purchasing clothing made from alpaca wool to increase her income.  This is why Gladys is requesting a loan to buy clothing made of alpaca, so that she can give her son a better future.

loans.use: to buy clothing made of alpaca

loans.name: Ismirah

texts.en:
This is the story of Rais, son of Ismirah: 

"I live with my parents, who both work as hawkers. My father goes around the town selling kids' toys, while my mother sells some snacks in an elementary school. I have two siblings who still need much. I plan to keep on studying since I want to make a better living. I don’t want the same thing that happened to my parents over and over. However, it’s hard for me to ask them to fund my studies since I know very well how hard it is to get money. That’s why I’ll be glad if I can get Kiva’s support. I really want to keep on studying."

Pictured are Rais, Ismirah and Ismirah's daughter.

loans.use: to pay education fees at the vocational school

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca works hard to support her family. She is married and has a dry goods sales business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of dry goods like bags, t-shirts, blouses, shorts, etc. to sell to her customers. Rebecca has been in this business for 14 years now. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of dry goods like bags, t-shirts, blouses, shorts, etc. to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en: Corazon is 50 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, coffee, etc. Corazon has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from raising livestock. She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Zoila Elena

texts.es: Con 44 años de edad Elena es madre soltera y tiene 5 hijos, de los cuales  los 3 de 5, 10 y 20 años aun viven con ella y los dos menores están estudiando, Elena se dedica al jornal de trabajo de en el campo y también cría terneros, el dinero del crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de terneros para tenerlos en unos lotes de terreno que le prestan unos vecinos, la aspiración de Elena es seguir trabajando duro para darles lo indispensable a sus hijos y sobre todo la educación.
texts.en:
44-year-old Elena is a single mother with 5 children. Three of them, aged 5, 10 and 20, still live with her and the two younger ones go to school. Elena makes a living as a farm labourer and also raises calves.

She will use the money from the loan to buy calves, which she will keep in fields which some neighbours are lending to her.

Elena's dream is to keep working hard to give her children everything they need, especially their education.

loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en: Remedios is 60 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her general store. Remedios has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from selling brooms and electronic mobile load retailing. Remedios aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Joanne

texts.en:
Joanne works hard to support her family. She is married and has a rice mill operation business in the Philippines.

Joanne requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her rice mill. She has been in this business for eight years now. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her rice mill

loans.name: Nelly Beth

texts.en:
Nelly Beth is 31 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for seven years and also earns an income from food vending.

Nelly Beth has requested a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell, like canned goods, soft drinks, eggs, milk, and sugar. She has borrowed and repaid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell, like canned goods, soft drinks, eggs, milk, and sugar

loans.name: Rubirosa

texts.en:
Rubirosa is 47 years old and married with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has an Internet cafe business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for nine years.

Rubirosa has requested a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase an additional computer set and pay her Internet and electricity bills. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase an additional computer set and pay her Internet and electricity bills

loans.name: Rica

texts.en:
Rica works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business selling vegetables in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years now.

Rica has requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of vegetables to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Thy

texts.en:
Thy, who is 50 years old, lives in a rural area of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has five children, three of whom are still dependent on her for support. She is a farmer on a small farm located near her house, and her primary activity is growing rice and selling the crop to local dealers. She has been a farmer for nearly thirty years. 

Thy lives quite far from the water source and it is not quite easy for her to get water for household use. Now she is taking a loan from HKL to dig a well for the sake of her family members. Through this loan, she hopes that the well will help her to save energy and time in getting water to use. She would like to thanks all lenders for the financial support via HKL, which provides her with a much lower interest rate than on its general loan product.

loans.use: to dig a well

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en: Sophea (in photo) is 29 years old, a widowed mother with one daughter who attends school. She is garment factory worker. She lives on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Sophea wants to buy a motorcycle for commuting to work because she does not have one!

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Margarita Ines

texts.es:
La señora Margarita una mujer luchadora que vivió uno de los peores episodios en su vida hace un año cuando la desplazaron de sus tierra natal de san Carlos y vino a la ciudad con 4 hijos buscando una oportunidad para vivir. 

Gracias a una miscelánea que logro montar con ayuda de sus hijos, su espos puede aportar en su hogar y es que la vida les sonrió pues se toparon con buena gente que le ayudaron a salir de esas difícil crisis. 

En su miscelánea vende productos de revista y tiene una papelería la cual quiere potenciar e implementar servicio de fotocopiadora pues se entiende que al ser desplazada no tiene muchos servicios o insumos para ofrecer pero la idea de ella es progresar y servirle a su familia. 

Solicita un crédito el cual invertirá en la compra de una fotocopiadora y surtido para iniciar una venta de línea de calzado. 

Su principal sueño es comprar una casa iniciar de nuevo en el sector que le dio la mano cuando más la necesitaba
texts.en:
Margarita is a fighting woman who was living in the worst time of her life a year ago when she was displaced from her hometown, San Carlos, and came to the city with her 4 children looking for an opportunity to live. 

Thanks to the shop that she was able to set up with the help of her children and contributions from her husband in the home, life has smiled on them and they ran into good people who helped them out of that difficult crisis. In her shop she sells magazines and she has a stationary shop which she wants to strengthen by implementing photocopying services, understanding that because she is displaced she doesn't have many supplies or services to offer. But her intentions are to make progress and serve her family. 

She requests a loan which she will invest in a photocopier and an assortment to start selling a line of footwear. 
Her main dream is to buy a home and start again in the field that gave them a hand when they needed it most.

loans.use: to buy a photocopier, shoes to sell in a women's line, and continue to leave behind her problem of being displaced.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is a married woman and a mother of five children from Leyte, Philippines. She runs a sari-sari, or a general store, where she sells various types of goods to the people in her neighborhood. This is her source of income. 

Several months ago, a super typhoon hit the country and ruined houses and business establishments, including Carmelita's store. As of now, she is starting to rebuild again and requesting a loan to buy additional merchandise such as canned goods, noodles, biscuits and snack foods, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, cooking oil and seasonings. With this, Carmelita will be able to augment the stocks of her store which will attract more buyers. In the future, Carmelita hopes to make her business a sustainable source of income.

loans.use: to buy additional merchandise to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Marize

texts.en:
Marize is single and has a motorcycle-transport business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 2 years now.

Marize has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy spare parts and gasoline for her motorcycle. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and gasoline for her motorcycle

loans.name: Editha

texts.en: Editha is a 60-year-old married woman and the mother of four children from Dulag, Leyte. She has a vegetable farm. Editha also wants to start a hog raising business but lacks the financial resources to do so. With this, she is asking for a loan to buy piglets to raise and animal feed and to pay for the labor on her vegetable farm. Editha dreams of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise and animal feed and to pay for the labor on her vegetable farm.

loans.name: Ma. Jessica

texts.en:
Ma. Jessica is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ma. Jessica is 47 years old and has four of her children are currently in school.

Ma. Jessica has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines. Ma. Jessica requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more dried fish to sell.

Ma. Jessica has been in this business for 14 years. In the future, Ma. Jessica would like to save enough money to afford to sending her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Maryjane

texts.en:
Maryjane works hard to support her family. She is married and lives in the Philippines, where she has a business making herbal products. She has been in this business for 5 years now.

Maryjane has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her herbal production business. She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her herbal production business

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
Silvia, es una señora que esta enferma tiene una discapacidad debido a su enfermedad. Actualmente Silvia esta obteniendo ingresos con la elaboracion y venta de papas fritas que son comercializadas en locales de fiesta.
Silvia requiere el credito para la compra de una protesis para seguir apoyando a su familia. Actualmente ella es la unica fuente de ingresos en el hogar por eso necesita su ayuda Silvia vive en  La Paz.
texts.en:
Silvia is a woman who has a disability that resulted from her illness. She currently her earns an income by making and selling potato chips, which are sold at special events.

Silvia is requesting a loan in order to buy a prosthesis, which will enable her to continue supporting her family. She is currently the only breadwinner in her household, so she is in need of assistance. Silvia lives in La Paz.

loans.use: to buy a prosthesis.

loans.name: Thavry

texts.en: Thavry (in the photo) sells grocery items from home, while her husband is a policeman. In addition, she also raises cows at home. She has been married since 2011 and just has one daughter who attends school. The family is living on the Island in the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Thavry is requesting a loan to buy a new motorbike for her husband for commuting, because the old one is breaking down.

loans.use: to buy new motorbike for her husband for commuting.

loans.name: Phary

texts.en:
Phary (in photo) is 43 years old and sells fast food from her home. She is a widow and the mother of two sons and two daughters. One of her children is married and lives in a separate home, two are employees and another attends school.

Phary wants to get a new motorbike for her son because the old one is breaking and does not work well. Hence she decided to apply for a loan to add to her own money in order to make the purchase.

loans.use: to add to her own money to get a new motorbike for her son.

loans.name: Juvelyn

texts.en:
Juvelyn is 37 years old and married, and she has two children who are in school.

Juvelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell.

Juvelyn has borrowed and repaid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from her prepaid mobile load business.

She aspires to save enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Vilma works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from directly selling Tupperware products. Vilma is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Vilma has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Las Optimistas  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Las Optimistas está formado por 7 socias y 1 socio quienes laboran día a día para mejorar la estabilidad económica de sus hogares. Viven en la ciudad de Cuenca, lugar de clima frio y verdes campos, es cuna de grandes poetas y atletas, su gente mantienen su cultura y tradiciones, esta ciudad siempre es cálida con sus visitantes, es desde Diciembre de 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad.
