Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señorita. Jenny, tiene 19 años de edad y es soltera, vive en casa de sus padres la misma que no es propia, es de un familiar.
Doña Jenny estudia en la universidad ingeniería en Contabilidad, cursa su segundo año, también trabaja con una tía en el arreglo de locales para eventos y compromisos sociales. El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir  pagar sus estudios. Su meta es estudiar una maestría en su especialidad.
texts.en:
The "Las Optimistas" ["The Optimists"] credit group is made up of seven female members and one male member who work every day to improve the economic stability of their households. They live in the city of Cuenca, a place with a cold climate and green fields. It is the birthplace of great poets and athletes; its people maintain their culture and traditions. This city is always welcoming to visitors, and since December of 1999, it is a World Heritage Site.

One of the members in this group is Señorita Jenny. She is 19 years old and single. She lives in her parents house, which is not theirs; it belongs to a relative. 

Jenny is studying Accounting in the engineering university; she is in her second year. She also works with an aunt in setting up for events and social engagements in establishments. She will invest the money from her loan in paying for her education. Her goal is to earn a master's degree in her specialty.

loans.use: to pay for her university studies

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 51 years old and married with one child. She lives in the Philippines and earns a living by fattening pigs. Marilou is borrowing PHP 27,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Marilou has been in the pig-fattening business for seven years and earns additional income from selling whole roasted pig. She is working tirelessly towards attaining her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en:
Sophal (in photo) is a rice and lotus farmer. She lives in a village outside of Phnom Penh City. Her husband is a construction worker and assists his wife in the farming business when he is free. Sophal has two sons who are in school.

When she is not at the farm, Sophal wants to supplement her income by running a new business selling grocery items. Therefore, she has decided to apply for a loan to buy grocery items and build her grocery store.

loans.use: to buy grocery items for sale and build her grocery store.

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en:
Chantha, age 33, lives in a village about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She sells fish that her husband catches in her local village. Her husband is a fisherman and does construction work when he is free. 

Chantha has been married since 2003 and has four children, two sons and two daughters. Two of her children attend school, and the other two are still young. 

She wants to apply for a loan to buy a cow to raise. That way she will get extra income from selling the cow when it is fully grown.

loans.use: to buy a cow to raise.

loans.name: El Progreso De La Feria Group

texts.es: Sheila de 24 años de edad es separada y tiene 01 hijo dependiente. Este es la Alcancía Comunal “El Progreso De La Feria”  la cual lo conforma 05 personas responsables dedicadas a distintas actividades comerciales. Sheila lleva más de 03 años  dedicándose a la venta de muebles para el hogar como sillones. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de reposteros, sillas y mesas. Su mayor deseo es contar con un local propio para exhibir sus productos. El grupo  “El Progreso De La Feria” agradecen a los inversionistas Kiva por el apoyo brindado. Sheila es la tercera del lado derecho y viste polo celeste.
texts.en:
This is the communal group "El Progreso De La Feria", whose five responsible members are working hard in different business activities. 

One member,Sheila, is 24 years old,  separated,  and has her son to support.  For more than three years, Sheila has been selling furniture for the home, such as armchairs.  She has asked for a loan to buy cabinets, chairs and tables.  She wants very much to have her own place where she can show her products. The group "El Progreso De La Feria" thanks the Kiva investors for the help provided.  Sheila is the third person from the right and wears a blue top.

loans.use: to buy cabinets, chairs and tables

loans.name: Jackilou

texts.en:
Jackilou is 24 years old and married with two children. She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. 

Jackilou is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional feed for her pigs.

Jackilou has been pig fattening for two years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Irabitanga Group

texts.fr:
M. Goreth fait partie du groupe  Irabitanga et  habite à  Gitega. Elle a 39 ans et est mariée à  Jean,un maçon. Ensemble ils ont 1 enfant qui étudie. 

Elle fait le commerce de  riz, et d'huile de palme  depuis  10 ans. 

Elle est à son quinzième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité de riz, et de l'huile de palme à revendre pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
M Goreth is a member of Irabitanga Group and lives in Gitega. She is 39 years old and is married to a man by the name of Jean, a mason. They have one child together, who is school.

M Goreth has been selling rice and palm oil for 10 years. She is on her 15th loan from Turame. With the Kiva loan she is receiving, she will increase her capital and purchase a large quantity of rice and palm oil to sell in order to earn more.

loans.use: To increase her capital and purchase a large quantity of rice and palm oil to sell in order to earn more.

loans.name: Kafui

texts.fr: Agée de 47 ans,  demeurant  à  Lomé dans le quartier d’Adidogomé, Kafui  est  divorcée  sans  enfant. Elle  vend  les sachets plastiques  et  s’approvisionne  2 fois  par mois au grand  marché de Lomé et  les revend au marché d’Assiyéyé par  vente ambulante et à domicile.  Kafui  sollicite un prêt pour agrandir  son commerce et réaliser plus  de profit.
texts.en: Kafui is 47 years old, lives in the Adidogomé neighborhood of Lomé, and is divorced with no children. She sells plastic bags and gets her supplies twice a month at the market in Lomé and resells them at the market in Assiyéyé through itinerant and door-to-door sales. Kafui is seeking a loan in order to expand her business and increase her profits.

loans.use: To purchase four packages of plastic bags.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is a 43-year-old married woman and a mother of eleven children. She is from Dulag, Leyte. 

Elsa is engaged in a hog-raising business. She has been in the business for more than seven years now. This is the source of her income. 

Elsa is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets to raise, and animal feed for the pigs. With this, she will be able to raise healthy pigs, which she can sell after several weeks. 

In the future, Elsa hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise, and animal feed.

loans.name: Gateka Group

texts.fr:
Mariam fait partie du groupe  Gateka  et  habite à  Bujumbura. Elle a 47 ans et est mariée à Amadi ,un chauffeur. Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants âgés de 15 à 29 ans dont 2 étudient.
Elle a sous sa charge 2 enfants membres de sa famille élargie, qui étudient. 

Elle fait le commerce des habits  depuis  18 ans. 


Elle est à son cinquième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup d'habits à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait construire une maison ,et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Mariam is a member of Gateka Group and lives in Bujumbura. She is 47 years old and is married to Amadi, a driver. They have four children together, aged 15 to 29, two of whom attend school. Mariam has two young members of her extended family in her care, both of whom attend school.

Mariam has been selling clothing for 18 years. She is on her fifth loan with Turame. With the Kiva loan she is receiving, she will increase her capital and purchase many items of clothing to sell in order to earn more.

In the coming years, Mariam would like to build a house and see her children attend school.

loans.use: To increase her capital and purchase many items of clothing to sell in order to earn more.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy galvanized metal sheets, wood, and nails to change the roof of her house

loans.name: Linda Catherine

texts.es:
Linda, de 32 años, ha optado por montar un negocio de comidas cerca a su casa ubicada en el municipio de Itagüí, en este negocio vende pasteles de pollo, empanadas, buñuelos, entre otros.

Linda trabaja todos los días desde las 6 de la mañana hasta la 1 de la tarde, es una mujer muy responsable, juiciosa y aplicada con su negocio.

Entre sus sueños más latentes esta el poder tener un restaurante en el que ofrezcan distintos tipos de alimentos y puede ofrecer empleos.

Ella pide un aliento económico para capitalizar su negocio y comprar insumos como pollo, aceite, harina, entre otros.

El crédito impactara su vida y su negocio de un modo muy favorable pues podrá cumplir con su sueño y tendrá una mayor variedad de alimentos para ofrecer a sus clientes, además de que de este negocio dependen sus dos hijos.
texts.en:
Linda is 32 years old and has started a food stall near her house in the municipality of Itagüí. Linda sells chicken pastries, fritters and other items. 

Linda works every day from 6am until 1pm. She is responsible, sensible and dedicated to her business.

Among the dreams that she has not realised, Linda would like to have a restaurant where she can offer different types of meals, and give other people work.

Linda is applying for a loan in order to buy supplies such as chicken, oil, flour and more in order to capitalise her business.

This loan will have a very positive impact on Linda's business and life. She will be able to achieve her dream and offer a greater variety of foods to her customers. Linda's children depend on this business.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as chicken, oil, flour and more in order to capitalise her business and improve sales. By doing this, Linda can then support her children.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is 33 years old and has four children. She is married and three of her children are in school.

Melanie is in the agricultural business, raising pigs, in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. Melanie has been raising pigs for seven years now and has borrowed from NWTF 12 times in the past to sustain her business.

In the future, Melanie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Mujiati

texts.en:
This is the story of Refa, daughter of Mujiati:

"I am the older child in my family. I have a bigger responsibility because of that. One day, I want to help funding my younger siblings. However, it’s clearly difficult for me since I haven’t got higher education. That’s why I want to continue my study so I can make my dream of becoming a successful person come true.  In my current family’s condition, it’s almost impossible for me to do so since my father’s uncertain income doesn’t help much. My mother has to take care of us so it’s hard for her to work and help raising our income. I hope KIVA can help me so I can keep on studying."

In picture: Refa, Mujiati, and second daughter of Mujiati.

loans.use: to pay for education fees at the vocational school

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es: Virginia de 64 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su grupo familiar. Ella es una mujer que gracias a su tenacidad ha logrado salir adelante junto a sus hijos, ahora mayores de edad. Virginia a observado que el techo de su vivienda se encuentra deteriorado, por lo que desea cambiarlo, además desea cerrar con tela metálica el corredor de su vivienda, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: lámina galvanizada, tela metálica, alambre y pines para cambiar el techo y cerrar el corredor de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Virginia is 64 years old. She lives in her own home with her family. Thanks to her tenacity, she has been able to move forward with her kids, who are now adults. Virgina has realized that the roof of the house is damaged, and she wishes to replace it. She also wants to close the hallway of the house using wired mesh. 

She is requesting the loan to FUSAI to buy: galvanized sheet, wired mesh, wire, and pins to replace the roof and to close the hallway of her house.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheet, wired mesh, wire, and pins to replace the roof and to close the hallway of the house.

loans.name: Tania Isabel

texts.es:
En la localidad conocida con el nombre de Pachinche  de la parroquia Colon de la ciudad de Portoviejo lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora y dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Grupo De Crédito Emprendedoras De Pachinche.
En este lugar vive la señora Tania, tiene 36 años de edad, está separada pero  de esa relación tiene cuatro hijos de 13, 9, 8 y 6 años, todos  estudian en colegio y escuela.
Doña Tania es una gran madre que para obtener sus propios recursos y con estos sacar adelante a sus hijos  se dedica a  la cría de pollos, para los cual hizo construir una pequeña granja en su casa, por temporadas mete de 150 a 200 pollos dependiendo de la demanda que exista en esos momentos, esto le permite ganarse el sustento diario de ella y sus hijos.
Este crédito es para comprar alimentos y medicinas para los pollos. Está en el Grupo De Crédito hace 4 ciclos y le gusta ya que con los créditos se ayuda mucho para salir adelante. Sus sueños son que a sus hijos nunca les falte nada.
texts.en:
In the Colon parish of Portoviejo city, the town of Pachinche is a place known for its hard-working people who make a living in farming and cattle-raising. Here, every fortnight, the "Emprendedoras de Pachinche" loan group meets.

And it is here that 36-year-old Tania lives. She is separated but has four children. They are thirteen, nine, eight and six years old each, and all attending school.

Tania is a great mother who, in order to earn her own income and support her children, works raising chickens. She has a small farm in her house and has between 150 and 200 chickens each season, depending on demand. This work allows Tania to look after her children.

This loan will be used to buy food and medication for Tania's chickens.

Tania has been with this loan group for four cycles and she likes at as the loans have helped her to get ahead. Tania dreams that her children will never need for anything.

loans.use: to buy feed and medication for chickens.

loans.name: Phors

texts.en:
Phors, who is 23 years old, lives in a rural area of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has only one child. To make a living and support her family, she has been involved with a farming business on a small farm for many years. 
Since the earning that she can generate from her farming seems to be insufficient for her household expenditures, she has come up with a new business idea. She wants to open a grocery store near her house to serve the people in her community. Now she is applying for a KIVA loan via HKL, to use as her capital investment for her new business. She hopes to improve her living standard with the support from this loan. She would like to thank all lenders for their financial support toward poor people.

loans.use: to open a grocery store

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like soap, shampoo, eggs, spices, coffee, and canned goods.
Nelly has been in this business for 20 years. 
She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like soap, shampoo, eggs, spices, coffee, and canned goods.

loans.name: Haide

texts.en:
Haide is 55 years old and married with three children.
Haide works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of snack foods, soft drinks, beer, biscuits, candies, noodles, bath soap, diapers, shampoo, etc. to sell.
Haide has borrowed and paid 24 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 39 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.
Haide aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of snack foods, soft drinks, beer, biscuits, candies, noodles, bath soap, diapers, shampoo, etc. to sell

loans.name: Amada Guadalupe

texts.es: Amada de 36 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus 2 hijos de 16 y 14 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que se esfuerza por apoyar a su compañero de vida en la economía familiar, por medio de su pequeño negocio, Amada recorre todos los días las calles de diferentes sitios turísticos ofreciendo diversidad de productos plásticos tales como: tazas, vasos, guacales, etc. Y es gracias a ello que se gana la vida desde hace 6 años. Amada desea construir un muro de retención en su vivienda, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y pagar mano de obra necesaria para construir un muro de retención en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Amada is 36 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and two children, who are 16 and 14. She is an entrepreneurial woman who strives to support her husband with the family income through her small business.

Amada walks along the streets every day at different tourist sites selling a variety of plastic products such as cups, glasses, crates, etc. This is how she has made a living for the past 6 years. Amada wants to build a retaining wall in her home, so she is requesting a loan through FUSAI to buy cement, sand, gravel, brick, and to pay the labor needed to build the retaining wall.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, brick, and to pay the labor needed to build a retaining wall in her home.

loans.name: Irish

texts.en:
Irish is 27 years old and married with one child.

Irish works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Irish has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year, and also earns additional income from selling spare parts and motorcycle supplies.

Irish aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma, a 35-year-old married mother of three, lives with her family in a rural community. Despite the hardship of living, she and her husband intend to continue sending their children to school so that they will find a good job someday. 

Due to the high cost of school fees, Gemma operates their motorcycle transport service while her husband works on their farm. To continue operation of the motorcycle, she would like to avail a loan of PHP10,000.00 to renovate both its interior and exterior, change the oil, and purchase new brake shoes, a battery, sprocket and motor chain.

Being a hardworking mother, Gemma believes that she will earn sufficient income and meet the necessities of her family.

loans.use: to renovate both the interior and exterior of her motorcycle, change the oil,  and purchase new brake shoes, a battery, sprocket and motor chain.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana works hard to support her family. She is married, and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase flour, sugar, cooking oil, etc.

Ana has been in this business for 32 years now.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, cooking oil, etc

loans.name: Melba

texts.en:
Melba is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell recyclable materials business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy more recyclable materials to sell for her buy and sell recyclable materials business.

Melba has been in this business for two years. She earns more income from general store.

Melba has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of repairing and renovating her family home in the future.

loans.use: to buy more recyclable materials to sell

loans.name: Analie

texts.en:
Analie works hard to support her family. Analie is married and has a butcher shop business in the Philippines.
She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional meat to sell.
Analie has been in this business for two years now.
In the future, Analie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional meat to sell

loans.name: Nicki

texts.en:
Nicki is 36 years old and married with two children.
She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Nicki is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.
Nicki has been raising pigs for ten years, and she also earns additional income from a general store.
She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita, a 59-year-old married mother of eight children, four of whom are still in school, is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For two years now she has operated a food vending business in the Philippines and is now requesting a PHP 6000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more ingredients for her food production business.

Nenita would like to build and expand her enterprise to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Nelda

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Nelda works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Nelda is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Nelda has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business raising pigs in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Nenita has been in this business for five years. She earns more income from a general store.

Nenita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Carmela

texts.en:
Carmela works hard to support her family. She is married, and has a pig fattening business in the Philippines.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she requested additional loan to further build her business. Carmela requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She has been in this business for eight years now.

Carmela would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Karen Estefania

texts.es: A sus 21 años de edad Caren es madre soltera, tiene un hijo de 3 años, vive en la casa de sus padres que se dedican a comercializar animales y es de ahí que le enseñaron a Caren a criar chanchos, ya es un año que se dedica  a esta actividad, el crédito lo va a invertir en la comprar de chanchos para seguir adelante en su negocio, mismo del que aspira aprender mejor para sacar provecho y tener de donde darle la alimentación y vestido a su hijo.
texts.en:
At 21 years of age, Karen is a single mother with a 3-year-old son and they live in her parents' house. She raises and sells farm animals, an activity that taught Karen to raise pigs, which she has done for the last year. 

The loan will be invested in purchasing pigs in order to continue in her business. She aspires to learn more in order to take advantage and generate the income needed to feed and dress her son.

loans.use: buy pigs to raise.

loans.name: Koemsroeun

texts.en:
From Prey Chhor District, Kampong Cham Province, Koemsroeun, 50, farms a small ricefield near her house. She has four children, two of whom are dependent upon her support. A farmer for 15 years, her average income is USD 5.00 a day.   

To increase her family income, Koemsroeun wants to buy a cart to carry bananas to sell around her community. She has requested a Kiva loan via HKL for this purpose. With support from this loan, she hopes to improve her income as well as promote her family's living standard. 

Koemsroeun also thanks all the lenders for their generous support.

loans.use: to buy a cart

loans.name: Visal

texts.en:
Visal (in photo) is 21 years old, and he lives about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. He is a young husband, married since 2012, and has just one young son. In addition to his son and wife, he also has his widowed mother living with him.

Visal is an electrician, while his wife is a garment factory worker. He wants to replace his motorbike, because the old one does not work well and uses more gasoline. He hopes the lenders will offer him a loan!

loans.use: to replace his motorbike.

loans.name: Yessica Damariz

texts.es:
En la localidad conocida con el nombre de Pachinche  de la parroquia Colon de la ciudad de Portoviejo lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora y dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Grupo De Crédito Emprendedoras De Pachinche.
En este lugar vive la señora Yessica, tiene 25 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre pero aun no ha podido tener  hijos. Su esposo es pintor.
Doña Yessica con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto ayudarle a su marido con los gastos del hogar se dedica a  la venta de zapatos por catalogo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes más conocidos, deja a crédito y cobra cada 8 días. Lleva 3 años con su negocio con el cual se ayuda para salir adelante.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar zapatos de todo tipo. Lleva tres ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos financia mejor su negocio. Sus sueños son tener un hijo.
texts.en:
In the place known as Pachinche, in the Colon parish of the city of Portoviejo, the communal bank "Emprendedoras de Pachinche" meets every 15 days.  In this place, the people are engaged in livestock production and farming.

This is where Yessica, 25, lives.  She is in a common law marriage but she has not yet been able to have children.  Her husband is a painter.  With the goal of earning something on her own to help her husband with the household expenses, Yessica started a business selling shoes through a catalog.  She sells door-to-door and also from her house, where her most well-known customers come to shop.  She sells on credit and collects every 8 days.  She's had this business for 3 years, and it has  helped her to get ahead.

Yessica will use this loan to buy all types of shoes.  She's been with her communal bank for 3 loan cycles, and she likes it because with the loans she can finance her business better.  Her dream is to have a child.

loans.use: to buy shoes

loans.name: Saroeurn

texts.en:
Saroeurn, 56 years old, is a married man who lives in a rural area of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. To make a living, he manages and operates a farming business on a small farmland which is located near his house. On his farmland, he grows cassava and sells his agricultural products to local dealers. So far, he has been involved in this career for around fifteen years.

Saroeurn would like to keep his cassava growing well by using natural fertilizers on his farmland. Because there is insufficient money, he has applied for a loan to buy fertilizer to use in his farming process. With the support from this loan, he hopes his cassava will grow well and produces more crops for him. He would like to thank for all lenders for their financial support toward poor people.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Nazim

texts.en:
Nazim is 34 years old and married, and the father of four children. He lives in Gujrat, Pakistan, along with his family. He is the sole earner and responsible for the financial support of his family.

The income generated by his present flock is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so he wants to increase his business of poultry. He has been doing this work for the last fifteen years and has become famous in his locality, for providing good-quality poultry products.

With the support of BRAC Pakistan, he has gradually improved his business. Currently he has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to increase his poultry business. This will help him to increase his sales, which will ultimately help in generating more income for him. Nazim thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase his poultry

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Luzviminda is 53 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Luzviminda has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Luzviminda requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Luzviminda has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Luzviminda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Moeur

texts.en:
Moeur, 50 years old, is a married woman who lives in a rural area of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has one unmarried and one married child. 

To make a living and support her family, Moeur manages and operates a farm located near her house upon which she grows rice  that she sells to  local dealers. She has been involved in this career for more than 30 years. 

Moeur is requesting a Kiva loan via HKL to build a house which she hopes will improve her living standard. She would like to thank all lenders for their financial support of poor people.

loans.use: build a house

loans.name: Jenalyn

texts.en:
Jenalyn, 36, is a married woman and has two children. Both of her children are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She has a food-vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years.

Jenalyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase additional items and ingredients for her food-vending business.

In the future, Jenalyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items and ingredients for her food-vending business.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita works hard to support her family. She is married, and she has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years, now.

Angelita requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan amount to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

Angelita would like to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Charlene

texts.en:
Charlene works hard to support her family. She is married and has a butcher/meat business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan amount to purchase more meat to sell.

In the future, Charlene would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more meat to sell

loans.name: Rona

texts.en:
Rona is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 6000 through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

Rona has been in this business for one year. Rona earns more income from selling frozen foods.

Rona has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Amparo

texts.en:
Amparo works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years.

She has requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan amount to purchase more groceries to sell, in her general store.

Amparo would like to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Grupo Chuguexa Primero Group

texts.es:
La necesidad de  seguir adelante en la vida ha llevado a Tomas de 50 años de edad casado, a aprender algunos oficios.  A través de los años se ha dedicado a la venta de celulares, el no se deja vencer por los obstáculos que le pone la vida el se ha decidido a enfrentarlas, el tiene 5 hijos por los cuales  está decidido a trabajar, el primero ya tiene familia aparte y los cuatro últimos son estudiantes de la escuela de su comunidad. (Tomas es el líder del grupo y es el único hombre entre el grupo de mujeres en la fotografía)  
La actividad que Tomas realiza con tanta dedicación es la compra y venta de celulares, el lleva realizando dicha actividad desde hace 16 años y es un negocio que le ha dejado ingresos económico y ganancias que le son de utilidad para el mejoramiento de las condiciones de vida de su familia. La segunda actividad que el realiza es el cultivo de maíz y frijol en los terrenos que el tiene disponibles y para luego venderlas por los alrededores de su comunidad para así tener un ingreso extra.
El es un buen líder en su comunidad y colaborador y es por eso que un grupo de mujeres se ha decidido a reunirse con Tomas para emprender juntos sus negocios para que ellas también mejoren las condiciones de vida de sus familias.
El uso respectivo que el dará al préstamo gestionado es para la compra de accesorios para celulares ya que para el lo son de importancia para una buena realización de su actividad para servir a su clientela de la mejor manera y con trabajos bien hechas.
Una de las aspiraciones de Tomas es que sus hijos se convierten en profesionales y tener un local en el centro de su comunidad para así mejorar sus ventas y comprar más terrenos.
texts.en:
The need to get ahead in life has led Tomás, 40 years old and married, to learn a few trades.  Through the years he has earned a living celling mobile phones.  He doesn't let himself give in to the obstacles that come up in life; he has decided to face them.  He has five children, for whom he's determined to work.  The oldest one already has his separate family; the four others are students in the school in their community.  (Tomás is the leader of the group and the only man in the group of women in the photograph.)

The job Tomás does with such dedication is buying and selling mobile phones, which he has done for 16 years.  It's a business that has given him an income and profits that are useful to him in improving his and his family's living conditions.  The second job he does is growing corn and beans on his available land.  He sells his crops around his community for a bit of extra income.

He's a good leader and collaborator in his community.  That's why a group of women decided to get together with him to implement their businesses together, so they, too, can improve their families' living conditions.

He'll use the loan to buy accessories for mobile phones, which are important for him to do his job well and serve his customers in the best way with a job well done.

One of Tomás's goals is for his children to become professionals.  He also wants to have a store in the center of town so he can improve his sales and buy more land.

loans.use: to buy mobile phone accessories

loans.name: Ayra

texts.en:
Ayra is 33 years old and married. She has three children, who are in school. She works very hard to provide for them, running a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years.

She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF. She will use it to buy items to sell at her store, like shampoo and groceries.

In the future Ayra would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to sell at her store, like shampoo and groceries.

loans.name: Amir

texts.en:
Amir is aged 37 and living in Gujrat, Pakistan. He is a responsible father of five children. He is a farmer by profession, and he owns large areas of cultivated land. He cultivates seasonal crops in his land and gets fruitful outputs from his crops. Mostly he likes to cultivate rice, cotton, and wheat.

He wants to use some agrochemicals for better production by his crops of wheat and rice. Sometimes he has to spray his crops, to protect against harmful organisms. So he is in need of some agrochemicals, for the betterment of his agriculture business. For this purpose, he needs some additional amount of funds. Therefore, Amir has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

He is very thankful to Kiva and its partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy agrochemicals for his agriculture business.

loans.name: Kibo Group

texts.en:
Samson is a father of two daughters and one son, of whom two are in school and another is still young. He is aged mid 30's and married. For three years now, Samson has been running a butchery where he sells cow meat. He is working from 06 am to 08 pm daily, and is able to realize a good profit each month. 

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is his first loan request to be apportioned among KIBO, a five member group. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. 

Samson will invest his loan to improve his butchery by putting an aluminum door and buying a new fridge. He desires to expand his business to more than four branches.

loans.use: to improve his butchery by putting an aluminum door and buying a new fridge.

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda is 61 years old and widowed. She has five children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines.

Luzminda requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase additional stock for the store, including soap, milk, sugar, eggs, and canned goods.

She has borrowed and repaid 18 loans from NWTF, before this loan. She has been running the general store for 23 years, and she earns additional income from pig fattening. Luzminda aspires to save money, to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock, including soap, milk, and canned goods

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion, 45, is a married woman and has seven children. All of her children are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years.

Salvacion requested a PHP 6000 loan amount through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

In the future, Salvacion would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel works hard to support her family. She is married, and she has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years.

Maribel requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy more fish to sell.

Maribel would like to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Jesel

texts.en:
Jesel is 21 years old and single. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She has a business, buying and selling frozen foods, in the Philippines.

Jesel has requested a PHP 6000 loan amount through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase more packs of frozen foods to sell.

She has been in this business for one year. In the future, Jesel would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more packs of frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Nimfa

texts.en:
Nimfa works hard to support her family. She is a widow, and has a buy and sell rice grains business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice grains to sell.

Nimfa has been in this business for 15 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice grains

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has a buy-and-sell-firewood business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years, and she earns additional income from selling frozen foods.

She is borrowing PHP 6000 through NWTF. She will use the loan amount to buy more stock of firewood to sell.

Rowena has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of firewood to sell.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 30 years old and married; she has four children. With three children currently in school, Vilma works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items, such as salt, sugar, coffee, detergent soap, and other groceries.

Vilma has requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF. She will use the funds to buy additional items to sell, like salt, sugar, coffee, and detergent soap.

In the future, Vilma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell, like salt, sugar, and coffee

loans.name: Ma. Diana

texts.en:
Ma. Diana is 31 years old, married and has three children who are in school. For the past three years she has raised pigs to sell.

Ma. Diana has taken out and successfully repaid seven loans through NWTF to improve her business. She is now applying for a 7000 PHP loan to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Ma. Diana’s goal is to save enough money so she will be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Brenda Yanira

texts.es:
Es un día muy caluroso, el mercado mayor de Suchitepéquez está repleto de personas que van y vienen, unos comprando otros vendiendo.  La esperanza baila entre los dos grupos. La necesidad de  seguir adelante en la vida ha llevado a Brenda  de 30 años de edad casada a aprender algunos oficios.  A través de los años se ha dedicado a la compra y venta de abarrotería, ella tiene la visión de superar cada día en su negocio para que le genere más ganancias para el beneficio de su familia, ella tiene 2 hijos que son estudiantes de la escuela de la comunidad. 

La actividad que ella realiza es la compra y venta de abarrotería en la comunidad, ella  tomo esa iniciativa de vender productos de abarrotería porque ya tiene 5 años de experiencia en dicho campo laboral y sabe que deja muy buena ganancia para ella y su familia para mejorar las condiciones de vida. 

El uso respectivo que la dará el crédito es para la compra de mercadería de abarrotería ya que ella es una mujer con visiones hacia el futuro, piensa en el futuro de sus hijos para mejorar las condiciones de vida de ella y su comunidad. Con las ganancias que obtengan de su negocio sus metas personales en los próximos años es poder ampliar más su tienda y ver que sus hijos se gradúen como profesionales en la vida.
texts.en:
It is a very hot day, and the main market in Suchitepéquez is brimming with people coming and going; some are buying, others selling. Hope sways between the two groups. 

The need to get ahead in life has led Brenda, a 30-year-old married woman, to learn some trades. Over the last few years, she has made a living buying and selling groceries. She envisions improving her business every day so that it will generate more profits, which will benefit her family. She has two children who are students at the community school.

She buys and sells groceries in the community. She took the initiative to sell groceries to improve her and her family’s living conditions. She has five years of experience in this field and knows that it is a very profitable business.

She will use the loan to buy grocery store merchandise. She is a woman who looks to the future. Thinking about her children’s future is what motivates her to improve her living conditions and her community.

Her personal goals for the next years are to use the profits from her business to expand her store and see that her children become professionals.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.name: M.riaz

texts.en:
M.riaz is age of 34, living in Gujrat, Pakistan. He is a responsible father of three children. He is a farmer by profession, and owner of large areas of cultivation land. He cultivates seasonal crops on his land. Mostly he likes to cultivate rice crop. 

In his land area, there is no canal system for watering, but a rice crop needs much water for irrigating purposes. So he has to arrange another source for his crop irrigation. Now he has decided to irrigate his land by a tube well system. He felt the irrigation by tube well would be good because this rainy season is not so effective for the water requirements of rice crops. For this purpose he has to get some additional amount. Therefore, M.Riaz has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

He is very thankful to Kiva and its partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: for rice cultivation use

loans.name: Divina

texts.en: Divina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Divina requested a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers. She has been in this business for two years now. Divina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 57 years old, married, and has one child who is still in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Marilyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store. She has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as detergent soap, shampoo, juice, coffee, salt, noodles, etc. 

In the future, Marilyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is a 45 year old, married, woman and a mother of four children from Dulag, Leyte. 
Nenita has been engaged in the hog raising business for more than 10 years now. She also makes brooms which she sells in the market. 

Nenita is asking for a loan to buy animal feed and additional piglets to raise. With this, she will be able to raise healthy pigs which she can sell to the market.
 
Nenita hopes of making her business a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for the school expenses of her children.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and additional piglets to raise.

loans.name: Mwenda Pole Group

texts.en:
Mwigulu, aged early fifties, is a widow and has one school-going daughter. She has a beauty salon and a liquid soap-selling business, projects she has been with for five years. Mwigulu starts working from 9:00AM and continues until 6:00PM daily. She is able to make a fair monthly profit.

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is Mwigulu's first loan request. This loan will be apportioned among the ten-member group, called Mwenda Pole. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

Mwigulu will use her portion of the loan to buy soap mixtures, and hair products for her beauty salon. She desires to grow her beauty salon and become a big liquid soap supplier to schools and offices.

loans.use: to buy soap mixtures, and hair products for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is a married woman who lives in Piat with her husband. They do not have a child yet but are praying to have one in the future. She manages a sari-sari, or general store and her husband drives a tricycle rickshaw to make a living.

In order to keep her store well stocked, Rosemarie is applying for a 12,000 PHP loan to buy more merchandise such as canned goods, soft drinks, noodles and eggs to sell. This will help her meet her customers’ demands for available and affordable good merchandise.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to stock her store

loans.name: Floriana

texts.en:
Floriana works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. Floriana requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like chicken livers, meat, seasonings, etc. for her food production business.

Floriana has been in this business for eight years now. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. In the future, Floriana would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like chicken livers, meat, seasonings, etc.

loans.name: Zahid

texts.en:
Zahid is age 31, living in Gujrat, Pakistan. He provides rural transport facility in the form of a tractor to the people of his society. He has been running his tractor as a loader and cargo transport. He has his own tractor for the last 10 years. Due to excessive and continuously use, it needs some maintenance. So Zahid has decided to repair his tractor as soon as possible. But due to lack of finances, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing his tractor. 

Therefore, Zahid has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to help him to cover the cost of repairing his tractor. 

Zahid is so much thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to cover the cost to repair his tractor

loans.name: Madelyne

texts.en:
Madelyn is 37 years old, married and has two children. She manages a sari-sari, or general store, while her husband is a security guard. Together they work to support their family.

Madelyn is now applying for a 12,000 PHP loan through ASKI to buy more stock for her store, such as canned goods, bread, eggs, coffee and soft drinks. This will help her increase her sales, thus enabling her to save money for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her store

loans.name: Irenea

texts.en:
Irenea works hard to support her family. Irenea is married and has a candle making business in the Philippines.

Irenea requested an 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more materials for her business.

Irenea has been in this business for 15 years now.

Irenea would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more materials for her business.

loans.name: Jesseca

texts.en:
Jesseca works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store in the Philippines. Jesseca requested a 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Jesseca has been in this business for 20 years now. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Trina

texts.en:
Trina is 36 years old, married, and has six children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more household goods to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

Trina has been in this business for 13 years. In the future Trina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more household goods to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta works hard to support her family. She is widowed and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Loreta requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall.

Loreta has been in this business for 30 years now. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is a married woman with seven children. She is 36 years old and has five children who are currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Lourdes has a business selling plastic bags in the Philippines. Lourdes requested a 12,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy more materials for her business.

Lourdes has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Lourdes would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her business.

loans.name: Jhonatan Jaime

texts.es: Jaime  tiene 20 años de edad, hace un año que salió del colegio y no puede ingresar a la universidad, es un año que se dedica a comercio y crianza de terneros, cuenta que a sus  5 años tuvo un accidente el cual le hizo perder su brazo, pero que ya ha logrado superar este problema ya que aun faltándole una extremidad puede ayudar a sus padres al comercio de ganado, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de terneros para seguir adelante en su negocio, la aspiración de Jaime es mejorar su negocio mismo del que espera ayudarse económicamente cuando ya ingrese a la universidad.
texts.en: Jaime, 20, left college a year ago, and is unable return to the university.  He has been engaged in raising and marketing calves for a year.  He says that when he was five years old, he had an accident, which caused him to lose his arm.  He has already managed to overcome this problem, however, because even lacking a limb, he can help his parents with the livestock trade.  He is going to invest the loan in the purchase of calves to continue moving forward in his business.  Jaime aspires to improve his business and, at the same time, he hopes to support himself financially when he enrolls at the university again.

loans.use: to purchase calves.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to connect to Haiti's first solar hybrid smart electricity grid.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to connect to Haiti's first solar hybrid smart electricity grid.

loans.name: Ma. Chona

texts.en:
Ma. Chona is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ma. Chona is 46 years old and has one child who is currently in school.

Ma. Chona has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She  requested a 13,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

Ma. Chona has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Arsenia

texts.en:
Arsenia is 54 years old and has two children. Arsenia is married and has one child who is still in school.

Arsenia is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a 12,000 PHP  loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Arsenia has been raising pigs for 8 years now, and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Arsenia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Marta Del Rosario

texts.es: Marta de 31 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus 3 hijas de 12, 9 y 5 años de edad. Ella es una mujer con una gran visión para los negocios ya que ha sabido mantener su negocio de venta de productos de belleza por mucho tiempo en el gusto de sus clientes y es así como ha logrado sostener a su familia. Sobre la vivienda de Marta cayó un árbol el cual daño un muro y el techo de dicha vivienda por lo que desea repararlos lo antes posible. Por lo anterior ella solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: lámina y madera, además comprará cemento y arena para reparar el muro de su vivienda.
texts.en: Marta, 31, lives in her own home with her life companion and three children, ages 12, 9, and 5.  She is a woman with a great business vision because she has known how to maintain her business selling beauty products to suit her customers’ tastes for a long time, and this is how she has managed to support her family.  A tree fell on Marta’s home and damaged a wall and the roof, which she wishes to repair as soon as possible.  Therefore, she is requesting a loan from Fusai to purchase metal sheets and wood.  She will also purchase cement and sand to repair her home’s roof.

loans.use: to purchase metal sheets, wood, cement, and sand to repair her home's roof and wall.

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fishing materials for maintenance of her fishing business.

Chona has been in this business for 2 years. She earns additional ncome from buying and selling fish.

Chona has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials for maintenance of her fishing business.

loans.name: Oscar Antonio

texts.es: Oscar de 45 años de edad habita en vivienda propia, además tiene 3 hijos de 12, 10 y 8 años a los que apoya económicamente pero viven solo con la madre. Él es un hombre emprendedor que se esfuerza por salir adelante y apoyar  a sus hijos, por lo que se gana la vida como albañil independiente. Oscar desea reparar el piso y el techo de su vivienda, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: lamina, madera, cemento, arena y grava para reparar el techo y el piso de su vivienda.
texts.en: Oscar, 45, lives in his own home.  He has three children ages 12, 10, and 8 whom he supports financially, but they live with their mother.  He earns his living as an independent construction worker, and he is an enterprising man that works hard to get ahead and support his children. Oscar wishes to repair his home’s floor and roof, for which he is requesting a loan from Fusai to purchase metal sheets, wood, cement, sand, and gravel to repair his home’s roof and floor.

loans.use: to purchase metal sheets, wood, cement, sand, and gravel to repair his home’s roof and floor.

loans.name: Ma. Emperatriz

texts.en:
Ma. Emperatriz works hard to support her family. She is married and has a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Ma. Emperatriz requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase piglets, feed, and vitamins for her business.

Ma. Emperatriz has been in this business for four years now. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. Ma. Emperatriz would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase piglets, feed, and vitamins

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 27 years old, married, and has two children who are currently in school. Maria works very hard to provide for them.

Maria runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more inventory like detergent soap, fabric softener, shampoo, hair conditioners, rice, coffee, juice, etc. to sell.

Maria has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as detergent soap, fabric softener, shampoo, hair conditioners, rice, coffee, juice, etc. 

In the future Maria would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more detergent soap, fabric softener, shampoo, hair conditioners, rice, coffee, juice, etc. to sell

loans.name: Marlota

texts.en:
Marlota works hard to support her family. She is married and has a rug making business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for six years now.

Marlota requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more materials for her business.

Marlota would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more materials for her business

loans.name: Ntawenderundi

texts.en: Ntawenderundi is 52 years old. He is married and has 10 children between the ages of 28 and 9 years old. Five of them go to school. He sells Irish potatoes, and he has been selling for 15 years. With the loan, he would like to buy more Irish potatoes for resale. The profits from the business will be used to renovate his house.

loans.use: To buy more Irish potatoes

loans.name: Miguel Dario

texts.es: Miguel, tiene 37 años de edad, es casado, tiene 3 hijos y vive en el municipio de Jesús de Otoro con su familia.  Se dedica a la producción de café desde hace 20 años. Esta producción de café la vende en su comunidad a intermediarios de la zona. Ha invertido dos préstamo en su finca y esta solicitando otro préstamo que es de 10,000 lempiras para la compra de fertilizantes para darle mantenimiento a la finca y  aumentar la producción. Su idea es salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en: Miguel is 37 years old, is married, has 3 children, and lives in the town of Jesús de Otoro with his family. He has made his living in coffee production for 20 years. He sells his coffee in his community and to brokers in the area. He has invested two loans into his farm and is requesting another loan for 10,000 lempiras to purchase fertilizer to maintain his crops and increase production. His dream is to help his family get ahead.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer to maintain his coffee crops.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 58 years old and has six children. She is widowed and two of her children are in school.

She is in the agricultural business farming rice in the Philippines. Letecia requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Letecia has been farming rice for five years now and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Letecia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Gaspard

texts.en: Gaspard is 37 years old.  He is married with three children between 10 years old and 1 month  old. Two of the children go to school. He sells potatoes and has been running the business for the past four years. With the loan, he would like to buy more potatoes for sale. The profits from the business will be used to buy goats and sheep and reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: To buy more potatoes to sell

loans.name: Ritchell Ann

texts.en: Ritchell Ann is a 26-year-old married woman and a mother of three children. She lives with her family in the province of Leyte, Philippines. Ritchell Ann has been engaged in a hog-raising business for more than seven years now. She also makes brooms, which provides her with supplemental income. Ritchell Ann is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets to raise and animal feed. Ritchell Ann hopes to improve her business in the future so that it will generate enough income to support the needs of the family, especially for her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise and animal feed

loans.name: Emmanuelie

texts.en: Emmanuelie is aged 28. She is married with two children aged between four and two years, not yet going to school. She works in a shop and has been working for five years. With the loan, she would like to buy more rice, sugar, biscuits, books and pens to sell. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more rice, sugar, biscuits, books and pens to sell

loans.name: Eda

texts.en:
Eda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net for her fishing business.

Eda has been in this business for 10 years. She earns more income from her buy and sell of dried fish business.

Eda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net

loans.name: Saul

texts.es: Saúl de 45 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, se dedica a cultivar pilones de café desde hace varios años, es una persona honrada y trabajadora, el terreno lo tiene ubicado cerca de su lugar de residencia, con lo que gana de sus ventas logra solventar las necesidades de su hogar, Saúl solicita un crédito para la compra de insumos en la producción de pilones de café como: abonos, herbicidas, controles de plagas etc. para seguir con su trabajo y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Saúl, 45 years old, lives in his own home with his family group. He has made a living from coffee seedlings for many years. He is an honorable and hard-working person. The land is located near his residence. From that which he makes from his sales, he is able to pay for the necessities of his home.

Saúl is requesting a loan for the purchase of supplies for coffee seedlings production such as: fertilizer, herbicide, pest control, etc., to continue with his work and give his family a better quality of life without any limitations.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, herbicide, pest control, etc.

loans.name: Estela Elisabett

texts.es: Estela de 48 años de edad es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable, vive en casa propia con sus hijos, ella se dedica al cultivo de maíz, ya tiene 15 años de experiencia en la agricultura por esa razón cosecha los mejores cultivos, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias logra cubrir algunas de las necesidades que se le presentan en su hogar, Estela solicita un crédito para la compra  de fertilizantes, abonos, herbicidas, semillas, controles de plagas etc. y así continuar con sus cultivos y  para darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Estela, 48 years old, is a very hard-working and responsible person. She lives in her own home with her children. She makes a living from corn cultivation. She already has 15 years of experience in agriculture. For that reason, she harvests the best crops. She sells her products in the different markets that are found near her residence. From what she makes from her profits, she is able to cover some of the necessities that are needed at home.

Estela is requesting a loan for the purchase of fertilizer, compost, herbicide, seeds, pest control, etc., and so continue with her crops and give her family a better economic stability without any limitation.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, compost, herbicide, seeds, pest control, etc.

loans.name: Emerita

texts.en:
Emerita is thankful for the loan assistance extended to her. She was able to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her grandchildren’s education and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her grandchildren’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Emerita hopes that her business will grow bigger and dreams that her grandchildren will finish their studies through all her hard work. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God that she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Muungano Self Help Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Susan. She is a member of Muungano Self Help Group. She is forty-eight years old, married and a mother of ten children.
 
She farms maize and beans, and practices poultry. She is happy for the Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HIH EA) enterprise management training she received, which equipped her with skills to manage her business. 

She borrowed Kenya Shillings (Ksh) 10,000 from the HIH EA Enterprise Incubation Fund, which she used to start the poultry-keeping business. She completed repaying the loan. She is borrowing from Kiva to further expand her poultry business. She hopes that the Kiva loan will assist her in boosting her business, hence increasing her income. This will enable her to improve the living standards of her family, which includes quality education and modern housing. 

Susan is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: María Luisa

texts.es:
En la localidad conocida con el nombre de Pachinche  de la parroquia Colon de la ciudad de Portoviejo lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora y dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Grupo De Crédito Emprendedoras De Pachinche.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 37 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 13 y 2 años, el mayor estudia en colegio. Su esposo es taxista.
Doña María es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, sale a recorrer por toda la localidad ofreciendo sus productos, deja a crédito y cobra cada ocho días, ella también en su casa se dedica a la cría de pollos para lo cual tiene un corral, esto le deja muy buenos ingresos, gana lo suficiente para cumplir con sus obligaciones y puede darles ciertas cosas que necesitan sus hijos. 
Este crédito es para comprar ropa y para alimento para los pollos. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace 5 ciclos  y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a  sus hijos.
texts.en:
The members of the communal bank Emprendedoras de Pachinche [Pachinche Entrepreneurs] in the town known by the name of Pachinche in the Colon parish of the city of Portoviejo meet every 15 days. This place is known for its hard working people who earn a living in agriculture and cattle raising.

In this place lives Maria, 37 years old, who maintains a common law marriage. She has two children from this relationship, 13 and 2 years old, and the older one is in high school. Her husband is a taxi driver.

Maria is a homemaker who, in order to obtain her own funds, engages in the sale of all types of clothing. She goes out all over town offering her products, leaving them on credit and charging every eight days. At her house she also engages in raising chickens for which she has a pen. This earns her very good income. She earns enough to fulfill her obligations and be able to give her children certain things that they need.

This loan is to buy clothing and chicken feed. She has been with the communal bank for 5 cycles and likes it for the help that the loans provide her. Her dream is to provide her children with the best.

loans.use: to buy clothing and chicken feed.

loans.name: Ancille

texts.en:
Ancille is 30 years old. She is married with three children aged between the ages of 1 and 8 years old; two of her children go to school. 

Ancille sells Irish potatoes and has been running her business for five years. With the loan, she would like to buy more Irish potatoes for resale. The profit from the business will be used to reinvest and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy Irish potatoes for resale.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
The person appearing in the photograph is Nancy. She is fifty-five years old, married and living with five of her eleven children she is blessed with.
 
She is involved in dairy and poultry farming. The training she got from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa has enabled her to run the enterprises effectively. Her businesses have expanded, and she wants to buy more animal and chicken feeds. The loan will enable her to achieve her goal of expanding the business.

Nancy plans to use the profits to support her children’s education. She is grateful to Kiva and for the support they will get from their lenders.

loans.use: to purchase dairy cows and chicken feeds.

loans.name: Rodelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Rodelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice and running a general store. Rodelyn is borrowing 50,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase ingredients like bananas, sugar, milk, cooking oil, etc., for her food vending business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Rodelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 25 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like bananas, sugar, milk, and cooking oil for her food vending business.

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en: Bernadette is 45 years old. She is married with eight children between the ages of 2 and 24 years old and four of her children go to school. Bernadette sells firewood and has been selling for the past year. With the loan, she would like to buy more firewood for resale. The profits from the business will be used to provide welfare and to buy land for building.

loans.use: to buy more firewood for resale.

loans.name: Philomene

texts.en: Philomene is 48 years old. She is married with seven children between the ages of 6 and 25 years old; four of her children go to school. She sells beans and has been working for the past 20 years. With the loan requested, she would like to buy more beans for resale. The profits from the business will be used to increase her business in order to reinvest.

loans.use: to buy more beans for resale.

loans.name: Shalom Self Help Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photograph is Joyce, who describes herself as ambitious. She is a member of Shalom Self Help Group, thirty-two years old, married and a mother of three children.

She operates a retail shop where she sells flour, cooking fat, sugar, cleaning detergent and snacks. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the lack of enough funds. She will use the loan to buy more retail shop products. Her business goal is to open another shop within three years.

loans.use: to buy additional stock such as flour, cooking fat, sugar, snacks and cleaning detergents.

loans.name: Kongowe Kati Group

texts.en:
REHEMA, who is in her late 30s, is single with four children. Two are grownups and two are still at school. She has been running two projects, a beauty salon for nine years, and a grocery store for one and a half years now.  She works from 09am to 11pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be REHEMA's 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She will use this loan to buy chairs, tables, drinks for the grocery store and to buy salon equipment.  She dreams of building a nice house.  

Rehema will share this loan with her group "KONGOWE KATI" which consists of four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy chairs, tables, drinks for the grocery store and to buy salon equipment.

loans.name: Marianne

texts.en:
This is Marianne. She previously accessed an 11,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, in their personal, household, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 12,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result for better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Marianne hopes that her store will get bigger. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week. There she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en: As a way of generating income, Edna has been engaged in buying and reselling various fruits and vegetables within their community. She is 36 years old and blessed with four children, who are attending school. Due to the high cost of school fees, Edna wants to make her business profitable in order to increase her income. She wants to acquire more fruits and vegetables to sell, but she has inadequate capital. For this reason, she would like a loan of PHP12,000 to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables to resell. She believes that this financial assistance will enable her to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 66 years old and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She has a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines and has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy sacks of charcoal for resale.
