Elizabeth has borrowed and paid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the charcoal business for 15 years and also earns income from motorcycle transport and food vending businesses.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Elizabeth aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita is 55 years old and married with 10 children, 4 of whom are in school.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Emelita is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Emelita has been farming rice for 35 years, and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college .

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en:
Elenita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 14,000 PHP through NWTF to buy gasoline, fish box, fishing net, etc., for her fishing business. Elenita has been in this business for three years. Elenita earns income from buying and selling fish.



Elenita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business. She dreams of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college  in the future.

loans.use: to buy gasoline, fish box, fishing net, etc

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla is 53 years old and married with six children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a direct selling business, selling Avon products in the Philippines and has requested a 21,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional Avon products to sell.

Priscilla has borrowed and paid 21 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the direct selling business for 17 years and also earns income from a food vending business.

Priscilla aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional Avon products for sale.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
Herminia is 60 years old, and married with 10 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Herminia requested a PHP 19,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stock of fish to sell.

Herminia has been in this business for 24 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fish

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Rita works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling vegetables. Rita is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy fishing materials for the maintenance of her fishing business.

Rita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials for the maintenance of her business.

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is a 47-year-old married man, living with his family in his own house in the capital city of Sana'a, Yemen. He has a diploma certificate and he is an employee in the public sector with that certificate. The salary that he receives from his job is not enough to cover all the expenses of his family. He is a talented and respected responsible man and knows how he runs his life well. He has a high determination inside himself to improve the living standards of his family and to prepare his house with all the family's needs. From this perspective, he decided to start his own business besides his work in the public sector. 

In the beginning, Khaled accumulated a good amount of money from his salary and purchased a minibus to work as a driver in order to earn money. Over time, that bus became very old and now does not work well as well as it needs to, requiring weekly repair and maintenance. Khaled could not afford this because the repair and maintenance cost him a lot of money. For this reason, Khaled decided to purchase a taxi to work as a driver, transporting people from one place to another inside the capital city of Sana'a, in order to earn money and be able to provide his family with a better future. Khaled believes that this taxi will be very profitable for him than his old minibus, and he will earn a lot of money. 

Unfortunately, Khaled's salary is not enough to purchase a taxi. As a result, he has applied for loan of 2,000,000 YER from AMB, in order to purchase a taxi to use instead of his old minibus, adding another income source for his family. 

Khaled looks forward to providing his family with a better future. He hopes to open a savings account in AMB.

loans.use: to purchase a taxi that will replace the worn out minibus that he currently uses for transporting passengers.

loans.name: Kolap

texts.en:
Kolap is a 33-year-old married woman .She has two dependent children who are currently in school. She lives in a small village of Kampong Speu province, Cambodia. To make a living and support her family, she runs a grocery store to serve the people in her community. So far, she has been in this business for four years with an average earning of USD 4.00 a day.

Kolap wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine and buy its facilities. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. 

She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita owns and operates a food stall business. She has been successful in this business for years, and she repaid her previous loan used for the business. She also finds ways to improve her income to provide for the family's every day needs.

Relative to this, she would like to take a new loan to increase her profit. She is requesting an amount of PHP 10,000 to buy products like rice, sugar, condiments and seasonings, in larger quantities.

Nenita hopes for her business to grow bigger and better. She dreams of giving her family a good life in the future. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more products, condiments and other raw products for her food business.

loans.name: Warlito

texts.en:
Warlito is a 34-year-old married man and a father of three children from Dulag, Leyte. Warlito earns a living by selling coconut wine to the people in his village. Coconut wine can also be fermented into vinegar. He also sells electronic load for prepaid subscribers.

Warlito is asking for a loan to buy more coconut wine. In the future, Warlito hopes of making his business a success. Moreover, he wants to save money for the school expenses of his children.

loans.use: to buy more coconut wine.

loans.name: Karlo

texts.en:
Karlo owns and operates a jeepney unit. He has been successful in this business for two years, and has repaid the previous loan that he used for the business. He also finds ways to improve his income to provide for their everyday needs and necessities.

He would like to take out a new loan to buy spare parts and accessories for his vehicle. He is requesting an amount of 22,000 PHP for the maintenance of the jeepney unit and to buy other materials needed in his business. In the future, Karlo hopes that his jeepney will continue to operate and he wants to buy another unit for additional income. He wishes for his family to be always healthy and happy. He meets up every week with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his life and business and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance of his jeepney unit.

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a bakery business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 24,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase flour, sugar, milk, yeast, etc., for her bakery business.

Glenda has been in this business for ten years. She earns additional income from a poultry business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Glenda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients, such as flour, sugar and yeast, for her bakery business.

loans.name: Nieva

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, two of whom are in school, Nieva works hard to support her family. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening.  

She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business. 

Nieva is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to buy an additional box of fish to sell for her fish vending business. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy an additional box of fish to sell.

loans.name: Cherrylyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Cherrylyn works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell buko juice business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening.  Cherrylyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Cherrylyn is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her business, like young coconut, sugar, milk, etc. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her business like young coconut, sugar, milk, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional poultry.

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Ruby works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling fish. Ruby is borrowing 28,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net for her fishing business.

Ruby has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net

loans.name: Eugenie Need Photo

texts.en:
Eugenie is 36 years old. She is married with seven children between the ages of 1 and 16 years old. Four of her children go to school. 

Eugenie sells goats and she has been working at this business for the past three years. With the loan requested, she would like to buy goats for resale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children and to buy domestic animals like goats and sheep for rearing.

loans.use: to buy goats for resale.

loans.name: Sonia Nicauris

texts.es:
Sonia da mil gracias a Dios por encontrarse en el camino un jefe humilde que piensa siempre en los trabajadores y que lo aconsejo para volverse emprendedor y que pensara en un futuro.

Le aconsejo que tomara clases de confección e iniciara su propio negocio pues contaba incondicionalmente con ella y Sonia le retribuyo con resultados y agradecimiento la confianza puesta en ella y hoy por hoy hace 6 años tiene un taller de confección a terceros operando. 

Buscando mejores ingresos y pensando en la educación de sus hijas menores de 13 y 21 años, ya que tiene tres una ya se vale por si misma quiere solicitar un crédito para iniciar una línea propia de ropa, el crédito lo usara para la compra de telas, y accesorios decorativos para prendas, hilos, agujas etc.  

Con el crédito podrá seguir honrado a esa persona que la apoyo y que la vea progresando cada día más y además representara un gran avance en su negocio y si tiene éxito empleara personas y seguirá con su proyecto de vida y piensa montar un gran taller que distribuya en toda la ciudad.
texts.en:
Sonia thanks God a thousand times for finding a humble boss on her journey who always thinks of the workers and who advised her to become an entrepreneur and to think about the future.

He advised her to take sewing classes and to start her own business. She could rely on him unconditionally. Sonia repaid him with results and appreciation for the confidence placed in her. At present, she has had a third party sewing shop operating for 6 years.

Seeking better income and thinking about the education of her younger children of 13 and 21 years of age, being that she has three and one is already on their own, she wants to request a loan to start her own clothing line. She will use the loan to buy fabrics, decorative accessories for garments, threads, needles, etc.

With this loan she will be able to continue honoring this person who supports her and sees her progressing more each day. It will also represent a major advance for her business. If successful, she will hire people and continue with her life plan and thinking about setting up a large shop that would distribute across the city.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, decorative accessories for garments, thread and needles to start her own clothing line since she wants to educate her children.

loans.name: Mariana Azucena

texts.es:
En la localidad conocida con el nombre de Pachinche  de la parroquia Colon de la ciudad de Portoviejo lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora y dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Grupo De Crédito Emprendedoras De Pachinche.
En este lugar vive la señora Mariana, tiene 19 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y está embarazada de su primer bebe. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña Mariana con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto ayudarle a su marido con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes, deja a crédito  y cobra cada quince días, su marido por su parte también vende ropa pero él se desplaza a otras ciudades a vender su mercadería.  Su marido tiene muchos años con esta actividad mientras que ella comenzó con el primer crédito que recibió del grupo.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar todo tipo de ropa para ella y para su esposo. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace 3 ciclos  y le gusta porque así empezó su negocio. Sus sueños es tener a su bebé.
texts.en:
The members of the communal bank Emprendedoras de Pachinche [Pachinche Entrepreneurs] in the town known by the name of Pachinche in the Colon parish of the city of Portoviejo meet every 15 days. This place is known for its hard working people who earn a living in agriculture and cattle raising.

Mariana, 19 years old, lives in this place, maintains a common law marriage and is pregnant with her first baby. Her husband is a merchant.

Mariana, with the intention of earning something on her own and with this help her husband with the household costs, engaged in the sale of clothing of all types. Her sales method is door to door and she also sells from her home, to which her customers arrive. She sells on credit and charges every fifteen days. Her husband also sells clothing but moves around other cities to sell his merchandise. Her husband has many years in this business whereas she began with the first loan that she received from the group.

She will use this loan to buy all types of clothing for her and her husband. She has been with the communal bank for 3 cycles and likes it since that was how she started her business. Her dream is to have her baby.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fishing materials for her fishing business.

Nora has been in this business for four years. She earns additional income from buying and selling fish.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and she has now requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Nora has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials for her fishing business.

loans.name: Ronelyn

texts.en:
Ronelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional fishing materials for her fishing business.

Ronelyn has been in this business for two years and earns additional income from buying and selling fish.

Ronelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing materials.

loans.name: Gaspard

texts.en: Gaspard is 38 years old. He is married with three children aged between 10 years and one month old; two of them go to school. Gaspard sells clothes and has been running the business for the past five years. With the loan, he would like to buy more clothes for resale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for his children and to buy food for consumption.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: St Thereza Women Group

texts.en: Alex is a 33-year-old married man with three children living in Kasese, Uganda. He is a member of St. Thereza Women Group. He sells electronics, a business he has worked in for eight years. In addition, he gets extra income from farming. Alex wants money to buy electronics to sell. Alex dreams of expanding his business into a wholesale business. He is a hardworking person; however, low capital is his challenge.

loans.use: to buy electronics to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a quality dairy cow.

loans.name: Rocela

texts.en:
Rocela is 38 years old, married, and works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell rattan business in the Philippines (native vines, a species of palm used in businesses for making furniture, matting, etc.). She also earns additional income from a general store. Rocela is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional rattan to sell through her buy-and-sell rattan business.

Rocela has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional rattan to sell for her business.

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
Esmeralda has faithfully paid back her previous loan which she used for her business. She has been operating her own “sari-sari” (variety) store for many years, and she earns well from this. She sustains all her needs through her business while ably helping her family at the same time. She also works hard with the determination of having better income.

To improve sales, Esmeralda would like to apply for a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. With PHP 40,000, she could purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation in advance for this assistance.

Esmeralda hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family. She dreams of becoming a successful businesswoman someday. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their work every week, and she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay their microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta 21 años de edad es una joven muy responsable y trabajadora, tiene muy buenas referencias por parte de sus vecinos, viven con su esposo en casa alquilada, ella se dedica a la venta de pan dulce, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de habitación, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas y con la ayuda de su esposo logran salir adelante con los gastos que se le presentan  en su hogar, la joven solicita un crédito para la compra de pan dulce, pan francés, repostería, pan de caja, etc. todo por mayor para obtener mejores ingresos y tener junto con su esposo una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: The 21 year old borrower is a young, very responsible hard worker. She has very good references from her neighbors. She and her husband live in a rented house. She works selling sweet bread. Her business is located in her home where she sells her bread and with the support of her husband they are managing to handle the household expenses that come up. She is asking for a loan in order to buy sweet bread, French bread, pastries, bread box, etc., all at wholesale in order to obtain better earnings so she and her husband can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy sweet bread, French bread, pastries, bread box, etc., at wholesale prices for her business

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en: Jacqueline is 34 years old. She is married with five children between the ages of 7 and 13 years old; four of the children go to school. Jacqueline sells different types of clothing, such as t-shirts, trousers, and dresses. With the loan, she would like to buy more clothes for resale. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house and provide welfare.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente de 20 años de edad vive en casa de un familiar con su compañera de vida, el joven se dedica a la venta de productos lácteos como queso, crema, etc. distribuye sus productos en las diferentes tienda y también vende en las colonias, tiene mucha clientela por los buenos precio y la calidad del producto, el joven está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas productos lacteos por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas y asi tener junto con su compañera de vida una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: The 20 year old borrower lives with his life companion in a relative’s house. He sells dairy products such as cheese, cream, etc. He distributes his products in various stores and he also sells in the suburbs. He has many customers because of the good prices and product quality. He is asking for a loan in order to buy more dairy products at wholesale in order to continue his sales and also so he and his partner can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cheese, cream, etc. at wholesale

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is a married woman and mother of five children. She is from Dulag, Leyte. She is engaged in buying and selling coconut fruit. Coconut fruit is then dried, and oil is extracted. Thelma buys coconut fruits and resell them to the copra maker.

As of now she needs additional capital for her business. She is asking for a loan to buy more coconuts for resale. In the future, Thelma hopes to improve her business and make it a success.

loans.use: to buy more coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny is a responsible mother who helps her husband in earning income. She is 39 years old, married and blessed with two children. She and her husband aimed to improve their standard of living in order to educate their children and give them a better life. 

Jenny owns and manages a small retail store and sells pork and chicken barbecue in her community. She aims to make this business profitable to generate sufficient income. Having inadequate capital, she would like to request a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy seasonings, sticks, and pork and chicken barbecue to be cooked and sold in the local community. She believes that someday she will further improve the business with this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy seasonings, sticks, and pork and chicken barbecue to be cooked and sold.

loans.name: Honorio

texts.en:
Honorio is thankful for the financial assistance extended to him. He has used the loan to buy spare parts and accessories, and for the maintenance of his Tricycle unit. His earnings were a big help for the education of his children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

He would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan to buy more spare parts and for the maintenance of his Tricycle unit. His profits from his business will definitely help him to meet the family's daily needs and pay the educational expenses of his children. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Honorio dreams to have another unit of tricycle that he could use for his transportation service. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and it is where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis.  A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners.  The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the spare parts and maintenance of his Tricycle unit.

loans.name: Dora Nieves

texts.es: Dora es una señorita de carácter muy tranquilo, es madre soltera y tiene una hija de 8 años que asiste a la escuela, Dora  se dedica a trabajar al jornal y también se dedica a la venta de ropa bajo pedido, ofreciendo a sus clientas  y por catalogo, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de mercadería en ropa para ofrecerla, lo que Dora aspira es mejorar sus ventas para incrementar su negocio y seguir trabajando para bienestar de su hija.
texts.en:
Dora is a good-natured young lady. She is a single mother and has an eight-year-old daughter, who goes to school.

Dora makes a living working as a day labourer and also selling clothing on request, direct, and through catalogues.
She will invest the loan in the purchase of clothing merchandise for direct sales.

Dora aspires to improve her sales in order to grow her business and keep working for her daughter's well-being.

loans.use: to purchase clothing merchandise.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is 24 years old. She is married with two children who are three and seven years old; one of them goes to school. Florence sells clothes and has been running the business for the past four years. With the loan, she would like to buy more clothes for resale. The profits from the business will be used to provide welfare for her children and to buy a motorcycle for transporting her merchandise.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Muendo

texts.en:
Muendo is 29 years old and married to Syomiti, who adds additional income to support their family. They are blessed with five children. Muendo has been a farmer for six years, earning an income of KES. 6,000 each month.
 
Muendo, who was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a credit officer, has requested his first loan for  KES.30,000  to buy fertilizers and seedlings for his farm plantation. He plans to use the anticipated income to further the education of his children; he also hopes to start a cereals business in his hometown.

loans.use: purchase fertilizers and seedlings.

loans.name: Martha Alicia

texts.es:
Martha de 39 años de edad, estudió hasta primer grado, está acompañada y su pareja trabaja como seguridad en un supermercado de la ciudad, tiene 4 hijos pero solo dos dependen de ella pues los mayores han formado sus propios hogares 

Martha se dedica a los oficios domésticos pero también se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras  en el mercado de la ciudad, ya tiene 10 años de experiencia en esta actividad, además en ocasiones realiza ventas de conservas de fruta como tamarindo, nance, coco entre otras, ella cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijas de 13 y 17 años de edad y para llegar al lugar de trabajo deben recorrer 25 minutos a pie.

El dinero será utilizado específicamente para comprar frutas como anonas, mandarina, naranjas, bananos y manzanas, por lo tanto el crédito le servirá como capital de trabajo.  

Sus planes a futuro son mejorar su vivienda, brindarle la educación a sus dos hijas, cumplir con el pago del crédito y mejorar y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Martha is 39 years old and studied through the first grade. She is in a relationship and her partner works as a security guard at a supermarket in the city. They have four children, but only two are dependent on her. The other two are grown and have started their own families.

Martha takes care of the household chores, but she also sells fruits and vegetables at the city market. She has 10 years of experience in this business. On a few occasions, she also sells preserved fruit such as tamarind, nance, coconut, and other items. She has the help of her daughters, ages 13 and 17. In order to get to her place of work, Martha must make a 25 minute walk.

The money will be used specifically to buy fruit such as custard apples, tangerines, oranges, bananas, and apples. Therefore, this loan will serve as operating capital.

Her plans for the future are to make improvements to her home, provide an education for her two daughters, complete her loan payments, and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy custard apples, tangerines, oranges, bananas, and apples.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn by the quintal, firewood, and cheese for her business

loans.name: Seng

texts.en:
Seng, who is 57 years old and a married man, lives in a community of Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. He has three married children and he also has one dependent child who is currently in school. He is an active and honest farmer. So far, he has been a farmer for than 30 years.  

Seng wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in his house right now. Therefore, he is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine and buy its facilities. By doing this, he can help his family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. He is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine.

loans.name: Maria Santos

texts.es: María de 65 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a sus 2 nietos de 19 y 12 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que desde hace 15 años se dedica a la elaboración de pupusas en su domicilio, negocio con el cual ha logrado salir adelante al lado de sus nietos, además su hijo le apoya económicamente. María desea colocar techo a su corredor ya que actualmente solo posee una galera con palmas de coco la cual no protege de la lluvia por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos para colocar un techo de lámina a su corredor.
texts.en:
María is 65 years old and resides in her home along with her two grandchildren, ages 19 and 12. She is an enterprising woman who has been preparing “pupusas” (stuffed tortillas) from her home for the past 15 years. Her business enables her to help her grandchildren get ahead. In addition, her son provides financial assistance.

María wants to install a roof over the corridor of her house. The corridor is currently covered with palm leaves, but they don’t provide protection against the rain. Therefore, she is requesting a loan from FUSAI in order to buy galvanized sheets, wood, and nails so that she can put a metal roof over the corridor.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheets, wood, and nails in order to put a sheet metal roof over the corridor of her house.

loans.name: Flavia Mery

texts.es:
Flavia es una mujer con un espíritu emprendedor envidiable. A sus 53 años ha pasado por muchos obstáculos, entre ellos, migrar de Waslala hasta Managua, buscando por una mejor vida, luego que su exesposo la abandonara con sus tres hijos, quienes ahora tienen 21, 18 y 15 años de edad. Ella tenía toda su vida allá, sin embargo tuvo que iniciar de nuevo vendiendo ropa usada en la capital, ingresos que le han ayudado a salir adelante desde hace más de tres años y que son indispensables para el pago del colegio de sus dos hijos menores, ya que para Flavia los estudios son la única herencia que les puede dejar.
Para Flavia y su familia, este negocio exitoso, gracias al apoyo de sus hijas, es su única fuente de ingresos. El sueño de esta mujer emprendedora es poder comprar una casa para sus hijas y así dejar de alquilar, sin embargo, sabe que para poder lograrlo, necesita seguir invirtiendo en su negocio. Por esta razón solicita un préstamo para comprar más ropa de segunda mano y así presentar variedad a sus clientes, lo que le permitirá generar más ganancias y ahorrar para tener algún día un techo estable.
texts.en:
Flavia is a woman with an enviable entrepreneurial spirit. At 53 years of age she has gone through many hardships, among them migrating to Waslala to Managua looking for a better life, after her ex-husband abandoned her with three children who now are 21, 18, and 15 years of age. She had all her life there, but she had to begin anew, selling used clothing in the capital city, income that has helped her get ahead for more than three years and is indispensable for the payment of school fees for her two young children, since for Flavia their studies is the only legacy she can leave them.

For Flavia and her family, this business is successful, thanks to the support of her daughters, as it is her only source of income. The dream of this enterprising woman is to be able to buy a house for her daughters and stop renting, but she knows that to be able to do it she needs to continue investing in her business. This is why she is asking for a loan in order to buy more second hand clothing and thus be able to have a variety for her customers, allowing her to generate more earnings and save in order to have a stable roof over her head some day.

loans.use: to buy more second hand clothing to sell

loans.name: Gunjan Mahila Samuha Shg Group

texts.en:
Lalita, Satya, Tara, Yatri, Sangita, and Bina live in the rural part of Virniya, Jharkhand, and they have formed a group, “Gunjan Mahila Samuha”, to help each other improve their livelihoods. Each one has their own aspirations that they hope to realize. They want to educate their children and improve their standard of living, for which they are ready to work hard and do what it takes to uplift their families. 

Lalita is the group leader of the group (hand raised). She lives with her husband and their two sons. Lalita and her husband are engaged in agriculture activities on the three acres of cultivatable land that they have. They grow vegetables and sell them in the weekly market or to the agents. Her husband also works as a daily-wage worker in his free time. Lalita is requesting a loan to purchase better seeds and fertilizer to improve their yield. 

The other members are also requesting a loan to improve their small businesses, as these women need sufficient capital that they will invest in their respective endeavors. Your loan will help six hardworking and deserving families take a big step towards improving their livelihoods and lives.

loans.use: to purchase better seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Jose Domingo

texts.es: José de 52 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus cuatro hijos, es una persona trabajadora muy responsable, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz, maicillo y frijol, su terreno está ubicado en una zona de incidencia agrícola, por esa razón posee los mejores cultivos, comercializa en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside, con lo que gana de sus ventas logra solventar las necesidades que se le presentan en su hogar, José solicita un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. y mejora el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para continuar con sus cultivos y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: José is 52 years old and lives in his own house with his wife and four children. His is a hard-working and responsible person. He grows corn, sorghum, and beans. His land is located in an agricultural area. For this reason, he has better crops. He sells in the areas surrounding where he lives. With what he earns from his sales, he succeeded in paying for his household’s needs. José requests a loan to buy fertilizers, infestation controllers, herbicides, etc. and to improve the land that is shown in the photo, so that he can continue his crops and give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, infestation controllers, herbicides, etc. and to improve his land.

loans.name: Ana Gloria

texts.es: Ana de 45 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella se dedica desde hace 10 años a la venta y elaboración de tortillas, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia, posee mucha clientela por la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, Ana está solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz por quintales y cal para continuar con su trabajo y así poder tener junto con su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Ana is 45 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and her two children. She has been making and selling tortillas for 10 years. Her business is located in her home. She has many customers because of her friendliness at the moment of sale. Ana is asking for a loan in order to buy corn by the quintal and lime in order to continue her work so that she and her family can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn by the quintal and lime

loans.name: Carlos Paulino

texts.es: Carlos de 56 años de edad posee desde hace 10 años una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos del hogar, Carlos quiere mejorar su vivienda pero con lo que obtiene de sus ventas no le alcanza para poder realizarlo por esa razón esta solicitando nuevamente a INTEGRAL un crédito para comprar cemento, arena, piso cerámico, hierro, laminas y pago de mano de obra para encementar el suelo y poner las puertas en los cuartos por esa razón solicita dicho crédito y así vivir junto con su familia más seguros.
texts.en: Carlos, age 56, has had a small store in his home for ten years. This gives him an income to cover some household costs. Carlos wants to improve his home but his earnings are not enough for this, so he is requesting a new loan from INTEGRAL to buy cement, sand, ceramic flooring, iron, and laminate, and to pay the labourers to put in more of the floor, and to install doors in the homes. This is why he is requesting this loan, in order to live more securely with his family.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, ceramic flooring, iron, and laminate, and to pay the labour.

loans.name: Fidel Ángel

texts.es:
Fidel tiene 52 años de edad, solo pudo estudiar hasta 4° grado, sus padres hicieron todo lo posible por educarlo pero no pudo continuar por las condiciones económicas, tiene cinco hijos pero ya todos son mayores de edad y viven en hogares aparte, Fidel solo vive con su compañera de vida y se dedica a los oficios domésticos.

Fidel se ha dedicado a trabajar en la agricultura desde que era muy pequeño, ya que es una actividad familiar, actualmente está cultivando 2 hectáreas de maíz para lo cual uno de sus hijos le ayuda a realizar el trabajo, además se dedica a cuidar de ganado de repasto y posee un vehículo con el que hace viajes a otras personas, de modo que trabaja en diversas actividades para obtener ingresos.

Él necesita el crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas, abonos, fertilizantes y para preparar la tierra para cultivar 2 hectáreas de maíz.

Sus aspiraciones a futuro son seguir trabajando y poder mantener a su compañera de vida.
texts.en:
Fidel is 52 and was only able to study up to grade 4. His parents did everything possible to educate him but he was not able to continue because of economic conditions. He has five children but they are all grown and live separately. Fidel lives only with his wife, who does the housework.
Fidel has worked in agriculture from a young age, as this is a family business. He is currently cultivating 2 hectares of corn, and one of his children is helping him with the work. He also cares for livestock and has a vehicle with which he transports other people; he has various activities to generate an income.
He needs a loan for the purchase of agricultural supplies, manure, and fertilizers in order to prepare the land to cultivate two hectares of corn.
His dreams for the future are to keep working and supporting his wife.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies, manure, and fertilizers, and to prepare the land for cultivating 2 hectares of corn.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy stock of animal leather for his business.

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.es: Nicolás de 48 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus tres hijos ellos ya trabajan pero le ayudan económicamente, el se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura  desde hace varios años, Nicolás está solicitando un crédito para poder mejorar su vivienda encementado el suelo y repellar las tanques donde mantiene el agua que es el que muestra la fotografía,  ya que con lo que el obtiene de la ventas de sus productos no le alcanza para poder realizarlo, por esa razón solicita dicho crédito ya si comprar los materiales necesarios como: cemento, arena, piso cerámico y pago de mano de obra para poder  vivir más seguros y cómodos con su familia.
texts.en: Nicolás, age 48, lives in his own home with his wife and three children who work but help him economically. He has worked in agriculture for several years. Nicolas is requesting a loan in order to improve his home by cementing the floor and plastering the water tanks seen in the photo. His income from his produce is not enough to do this work, so he is requesting a loan in order to purchase the materials such as cement, sand, and ceramic flooring, and to pay the labourers. This way, he will be able to live more securely and comfortably with his family.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and ceramic flooring, and to pay the labourers.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en: Nilda owns and operates an agricultural farm, growing coconut, banana and other crops for a living. Nilda has been engaged in this business for many  years, with her husband also working on it, and earns well from these activities. Her farm is doing well and yet, she needs financial assistance to improve it. Recently, she took a new loan to buy organic fertilizer. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her farm to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a washing machine for her home.

loans.name: Nofo

texts.en: Nofo, a 33-year-old married mother of five. She makes and sells fried chicken with rice in her community to earn a living. With four years of experience in this business, Nofo is requesting a loan from SPBD to buy boxes of chicken leg quarters, soya sauce, onions, a new oven and soft drinks. She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital. Nofo hopes to use the profits from her sales to pay for her families weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy boxes of chicken leg quarters, soya sauce, onions, a new oven and soft drinks

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en: Lilia is 37 years old, married, and has a child. To make a living, she sells grocery items and vegetables in her store in Enrile. Her spouse is a tricycle driver. Together, they support their family. Lilia wants to buy more merchandise to sell, which is why she is asking for additional capital of 15,000 PHP to buy squash, eggplants, noodles, sardines and cases of soft drinks. This will help increase her sales and earn more income. She will save her profits to improve her stall and to educate her child.

loans.use: to buy squash, eggplants, noodles, sardines and cases of soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Felix

texts.es: Felix se gana la vida como empleado publico pero esta enfermo y necesita un prestamo para tratamiento medico y medicinas Felix vive en La Paz, tiene un buen historial de credito (actualmente no tiene deudas)  y es padre de 3 hijos por lo que necesita su ayuda por que es la unica fuente de ingresos de su hogar
texts.en:
Felix makes his living as a public employee. However, he is ill and needs a loan in order to buy medicines and pay for treatment.

Felix lives in La Paz and has a good credit history (he currently has no debts). He is the father of three children and is in need of assistance because he is the only breadwinner in his household.

loans.use: to buy medicines and pay for medical treatment.

loans.name: Segundina

texts.en: Segundina is a widow with five adult children who operates a retail business to make a living. She vends fish and crabs in their village. She has been in this field of business for over ten years and she earns better to provide for her family's daily needs. Recently, she borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase more crabs to sell. In the future, Segundina wants to own a stall in the market in town where she vends fish. She wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase more crabs to sell.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 37 years old and lives in Sumasap, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 2 children who are now at school age.
 
Marilou earns a living from snack vending and rice production business activities she's had for 5 years already. Marilou earns approximately 1,000 PHP each month doing these types of businesses. She has requested a loan to be used for purchasing commercial fertilizers and sprays for her rice production activity.

Marilou has been a member of PMPC for almost 3 years. In the future, Marilou hopes to build a food stall for her snack vending business.

loans.use: to purchase commercial fertilizers and sprays

loans.name: Yudy

texts.en:
Yudy is a 25-year-old single man. He is now working as a nurse at a hospital. He lives with his parents. They are Yosua, 53, who is running a kiosk business and Damaris, a 52-year-old housewife.  Yudy has a brother Doni, 26, who has just finished his bachelor degree in mechanical engineering; twin sisters Linda, 18, a 1st semester university student majoring in midwifery and Voni, 18, a 1st semester university student majoring in banking. 

Beside working as a nurse, Yudy also has a small kiosk business (different from his father’s) which sells gasoline, cigarette, etc. Yudy wants to purchase additional stock for his kiosk but has limited capital. Therefore, he applied for an individual loan from TLM for 4,000,000 IDR. The loan will be used to purchase more stock.

loans.use: to purchase more stock.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.en:
Gregoria is thankful that she was previously granted a 15,000 PHP loan to buy the additional products she needed in her direct selling business. Through her earnings she is able to send her child to school and meet her family's daily personal and household needs. 

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan to buy more merchandise items and products to increase her product inventory. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better her chances of increasing her sales and profit. This will definitely help her to sustain her child’s education and daily needs.  

Gregoria aims to expand her business and hopes to have a happy family in spite of the challenges she faces. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise such as clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is thankful that she was previously granted a 10,000 PHP loan, which she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products to sell her variety store. Through her earnings she is able to send her children to school and meet their daily household and personal needs. 

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items and choices displayed at her store, the better her chances of increasing her sales and profits. A good return on her store business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expense. She looks forward to this increase in financing with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

She aims to grow her variety store so that she can give her children the best education and lead a better life for her family. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda owns and operates a tricycle unit. She has been successful in this business for years, and she repaid her previous loan used for the business. She also finds ways to improve her income to provide their everyday needs and necessities.

She would like to apply again for another loan of an amount of 30,000 PHP to buy spare parts and accessories for her tricycle and for its maintenance.

In the future, Erlinda wants to buy another unit of tricycle to increase her income. She hopes to improve their general living conditions and to give her children the best education possible

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance of her tricycle unit.

loans.name: Veronica Maria

texts.es:
Verónica una joven de 24 años muy emprendedora y sobretodo protectora pro el gran cariño que tiene sobre los niños estudio para poder ser dicente y guiarlos en las primeras etapas su gran razón para realizar esta profesión es su hermano menor quien es especial y requiere cuidados y atenciones. 

Buscando que su madre no tenga que trabajar y se dedique de lleno a cuidar a su hermano menor hace un mes tomo la iniciativa de vender productos de la marca Amway básicamente productos de belleza 

Solicita un crédito para seguir proyectando su idea de sacar a su madre de trabajar para que cuide a su hermanito, el crédito lo destinara en su totalidad para comprar productos de belleza y distribuirlo a amigos, familaires y en sus ratos libres a vecinos por lo que necesita buen capital para ejecutar esta noble causa.
texts.en:
Verónica is young women, who is 24 years old. She is very enterprising and above all is very protective of the great affection she has for children. She studied to be a speaker and to guide children in early stages. Her major reason for pursuing this profession is that her younger brother has special needs and requires care and attention. 

So that her mother doesn’t have to work and can be fully dedicated to caring for Verónica’s younger brother, Verónica took the initiative of selling Amway products beauty products beginning a month ago.

She requests a loan to continue pursuing her idea of allowing her mother not to work so that she can take care of her younger brother. The loan will be used to buy beauty products and sell them to friends, relatives, and, in her free time, to neighbors so that she has enough money to carry out her noble goal.

loans.use: to buy Amway beauty products and to earn a better income to help with expenses for her brother, who has special needs.

loans.name: Jesilyn

texts.en:
Jesilyn is 44 years old and is married with three children, one of which is in school. 

Jesilyn and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home was wiped out. 

Jesilyn is taking out a housing loan amounting PHP 10,000 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Jesilyn has been an NWTF borrower since 2013.

With your help, Jesilyn can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is a married mother of four children, two of whom are in school. She works hard to support her family.

She has a food-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming vegetables and raising pigs. Jessica is borrowing 20,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) in order to buy ingredients like rice, meat, chicken and other spices for her food business.

Jessica has sustained her business activities through her past twelve loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to continue sending her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like rice, meat, chicken and other spices for her food business.

loans.name: Parvati Mahila Samuha Shg Group

texts.en:
Parvati Mahila Samuha Group comprises Basanti, Sumitra, Mina, and Babita, from rural areas of Jharkhand. They have come together to help each other improve their livelihoods. All these women work hard in order to supplement their family incomes and provide a better future for their children. They realize the urgency of earning more and seek to expand their small businesses as the first step towards meeting their goals.

Basanti is the group leader of this group. She lives with her husband and two children who are studying in school. Basanti’s family income is mainly from agriculture. Her husband even works as a daily-wage worker and earns INR 200 per day. 

These women are unable to arrange the required capital for their expansions, so they are seeking a loan repayable in easy installments. With this loan, Basanti will buy seeds and fertilizer to gain a better yield and margin from her vegetable cultivation. 

Your loan will help these four hardworking women with the impetus to carry forward their plans and achieve their simple goals.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Alba Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda es una señora positiva, le gusta mucho su negocio ya que arrienda un cuarto para exhibir su mercadería en zapatos y en una partecita de ese lugar también tiene su máquina de coser para confeccionar prendas que le piden que haga, Yolanda es casada y tienen 3 hijos de 3, 7 y 12 años de edad de los cuales los mayores están estudiando, son 2 años que se dedica a la venta de zapatos y su esposo trabaja chofer, Yolanda va a invertir el crédito en la compra de zapatos para dama, lo que Yolanda aspira mejorar su negocio, poner más variedad de zapatos para atraer más clientela y de ahí tener mejores ganancias para darles lo necesario a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Yolanda is a positive woman who greatly enjoys her business. She rents a small space for exhibiting the shoes that she sells. In a small section of the space, she also has a sewing machine that she uses to make clothes that have been ordered.

Yolanda is married and has three children (ages 3, 7, and 12). The older children are studying. She has been selling shoes for two years and her husband works as a chauffeur. Yolanda will invest the loan in the purchase of women’s shoes. She aspires to improve her business by acquiring a wider variety of shoes in order to attract more customers. This will help to improve her earnings so that she can provide for her children’s needs.

loans.use: to buy women's shoes to sell.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is 48 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 29,500 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell like soap, shampoo, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

Angelina has been in this business for 2 years.

In the future Angelina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell like soap, shampoo, eggs, milk, sugar, etc

loans.name: Sandra Milena

texts.es:
Sandra una mujer que antes no tenía esperanzas en la vida su calidad de vida era baja, en muchas ocasiones no tenía para comer, un día escucho por radio de interactuar y acudió a este, le brindaron la ayuda y le prestaron dinero para comprar una pequeña tienda donde pudo levantar su familia conformado por sus 3 hijos y sus padres, sus hijos tienen 16, 14, 9 años de edad. 

Solicita un crédito abundante para la compra de surtido, comprara artículos de aseo, granos, abarrotes, comprara un refrigerador, y productos congelados. 

La razón del monto del crédito es pro que casi quedo en banca rota pues un familiar fue secuestrado y los extorsionaron para soltarlo lo que la dejo sin capital y siendo la tienda su único sustento necesita un buen monto para levantarlo por lo que pide su ayuda para seguir progresando
texts.en:
Sandra is a woman who previously did not have hopes in life. Her quality of life was low, and she often did not have food to eat. One day she heard about Interactuar on the radio and went to see them. They offered her help and lent her money to buy a small store where she was able to raise and support her family, made up of her three children and her parents. Her children are 16, 14, and 9.
She is requesting a large loan for the purchase of stock (cleaning products, grains, and groceries) as well as a fridge and frozen goods.
The reason for the amount of the loan is because she was nearly left bankrupt when a family member was kidnapped. The kidnappers requested a bribe for their release, and this left Sandra without capital. Her store is her only source of income, so she needs a good amount in order to get it running well. She is requesting help in order to keep moving forward.

loans.use: to buy stock (grains, cleaning products, groceries) as well as a freezer in order to recover from extortion resulting from the kidnapping of a family member.

loans.name: Fidel Antonio

texts.es:
Fidel de 64 años de edad, no tiene ninguna preparación académica pues sus padres pensaban que no servía de nada estudiar, actualmente está acompañado y tiene 5 hijos de los cuales solo uno vive en casa y los otros ya se acompañaron.

Fidel se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos y su pareja le ayuda en la actividad, además cuando no cultiva se dedica a la albañilería u otro trabajo que pueda desempeñar pue su padre le enseñó diversas cosas para que se pudiera defender en la vida.

Este crédito lo necesita para reparar su vivienda, específicamente el techo que se encuentra en mal estado, de esta forma podrá estar en un hogar más seguro con su esposa e hijo.

Su sueño es seguir trabajando y mejorar poco a poco su vivienda.
texts.en:
Fidel, age 64, does not have any schooling because his parents didn't think that studying had any value. He is married and has five children, only one of whom lives with him. The others are married.
Fidel cultivates basic grains and his wife helps him. When he is not farming, he works as a bricklayer or does other work. His father taught him various things so that he could fend for himself in life.
This loan is necessary to repair his home, specifically the roof, which is in bad shape. He will be able to live in a more secure home with his wife and child.
His dream is to continue working and to improve his home bit by bit.

loans.use: to repair his roof which is in bad shape.

loans.name: Mirna Elizabeth

texts.es:
Mirna de 43 años de edad, con mucho esfuerzo logró cursar hasta quinto grado, luego ya no quiso seguir estudiando para ayudar a su madre, ahora está acompañada y su pareja se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura y a la crianza de ganado de repasto y sus hijos ya son mayores de edad.

Mirna se dedica a la crianza de animales de granja (pollos de encordé) esto se lo enseñó su madre quien también se dedicaba a esta actividad, lo ha hecho desde hace 5 años y ya tiene 3 pequeñas jaulas, ella está muy pendiente de que no le falte la comida a sus animales para que puedan desarrollarse sanos, su pareja le ayuda cuando va a vender los pollos, los venden por libra por lo tanto tiene que destazarlos y prepararlos para venderlos.

Los fondos del crédito serán utilizados para comprar 500 pollitos de engorde, además para comprar concentrado para la alimentación de los mismos.

Espera para un futuro poder construir una jaula más grande para tener a los pollos y que sus ingresos mejoren para su familia.
texts.en:
Mirna is 43 years old. Through much effort she managed to complete grade 5 but then didn't want to stay in school so she could help her mother. She is now married, her husband is a farmer and also raises livestock. Their children are already grown up.

Mirna earns her living raising poultry, a job she learned from her mother. She's been doing this for five years and already has three chicken pens. She is always on the lookout to make sure the chickens aren't short of food so they develop healthily. Her husband helps her when it is time to sell them. They butcher and prepare the chickens before selling them by the pound.

The loan money will be used to buy 500 chicks to raise as well as special feed for them.

Mirna's hopes for the future are to have a bigger pen for the chickens and to increase her income for her family.

loans.use: .buy 500 chicks to raise as well as special feed for them

loans.name: Sina

texts.en:
Sina (in the photo), age 23, is single and lives with his parents on an island of Mekong River. His parents are rice farmers. 

Sina is a second year student, majoring as a nurse at University in Phnom Penh. He wants to continue his studies. That’s why he applied for a loan in order to pay for his school fees.

loans.use: to pay for his school fees.

loans.name: Dora Alicia

texts.es: Dora de 45 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus tres hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de tamales y elaboración de productos lácteos como: queso, crema, requesón, etc. desde hace 30 años, esos años le han dado la experiencia necesaria para elaborar dichos alimentos, tiene mucha clientela por los buenos precios, Dora está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar maíz, pollo, verduras, etc. y  moldes para elaborar queso así como los que muestra en la fotografía para continuar con su trabajo y asi tener una mejor calidad de vida sin limitación alguna junto con su familia.
texts.en: Dora, age 45, lives in her own home with her wife and three children. She sells tamales and makes dairy products such as cheese, cream, and cottage cheese. She has been doing this for 30 years, and these years have given her the necessary experience to make these foods. She has a large clientele because of her good prices. Dora is requesting a loan in order to purchase corn, chicken, vegetables, etc, and moulds in order to make cheese, as shown in the photo. This will allow her to continue with her work and have a greater quality of life without any limitations, with her family.

loans.use: to buy corn, chicken, vegetables, etc, and moulds for making cheese.

loans.name: Luis Alonso

texts.es: Luis de 39 años de edad se dedica desde hace varios años a la venta de agua de coco vende de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia,  tienen mucha clientela pues es un hombre muy amable, trabajador, honrado y honesto, por eso ha sabido ganarse a sus clientes, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos y su esposa, luis está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar cocos por mayor y seguir con su negocio ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo, para poder darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Luis, age 39, has worked for several years selling coconut water on the street in the different neighbourhoods near to his home. He has many clients because he is a very kind, hard-working, honest and trustworthy man. This has allowed him to win over his clients. With his earnings, he is able to cover some household costs. He lives in his own home with his three children and his wife. Luis is requesting a loan for the wholesale purchase of coconuts in order to continue with his business, as this is his only source of income. He wants to be able to give his family greater economic stability.

loans.use: to buy coconuts wholesale.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en: Merlita is a 43-year-old mother who was gifted with seven children. They are currently residing in a rural community and make their living through farming. Due to the high cost of commodities and school fees, Merlita is also engaged in buying and reselling fruits and vegetables to earn and save income for the sake of her children. She aims to continue and strengthen her business in order to increase her income. Due to insufficient capital, she would like to avail herself of a loan of PHP12,000.00 to buy more stocks of taro, cabbages, squash, beans, eggplants and leafy vegetables to resell. Being a kind and diligent mother, she believes that, someday, she will make her business more profitable.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of taro, cabbages, squash, beans, eggplants and leafy vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Stefania Fiorella

texts.es:
Stefania es una joven luchadora, tiene 22 años de edad, es soltera y vive en San Juan de Lurigancho junto a su familia. Es madre soltera de un pequeño y hermoso niño, ella quiere brindarle lo mejor por eso trabaja incansablemente para poder sacar a su hijo adelante. Por iniciativa propia y con mucho esfuerzo logró iniciar un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa y le va bien porque siempre ofrece productos de calidad y es muy amable con los clientes.
Stefania en estos momentos necesita comprar ropa por temporada de invierno para poder ofrecer a sus clientes, solo necesita una pequeña ayuda para sacar adelante su negocio. Ella está muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprar la mercadería que necesita para incrementar sus ventas y hacer crecer su negocio. De esta manera en poco tiempo podrá cumplir su gran sueño: "Tener su casa propia".
texts.en:
Stefania is a hard-working young woman, age 22. She is single and lives in San Juan de Lurigancho with her family. She is a single mother of a small and handsome boy. On her own initiative, and with great hard work, she was able to start a small business selling clothing. It is going well for her because she always offers quality products and is very kind with her clients.
Stefania needs to buy seasonal clothing for the wintertime in order to be able to sell it to her clients. She only needs a small amount of help to get her business ahead. She is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because through their support she will be able to buy the merchandise she needs to increase her sales and expand her business. This way, in a short time, she will be able to achieve her great dream: "To have my own home".

loans.use: to buy seasonal clothing for winter.

loans.name: Vencedors Group

texts.es:
ESTUARDO hombre trabajador de 40 años de edad. Vive con su esposa y  2 hijos en una comunidad de Esmeraldas. 
ESTUARDO se dedica a varias actividades para poder ganarse unos dólares y llevar a casa el pan de cada dia. El hace trabajos de albañilería – agricultor – pescador y jardinero. 
El, espera con este crédito gestionado en FODEMI reiniciar la actividad de cria de pollos que desafortunadamente en un incendio perdió. 
Con este crédito el comprará  pollos- alimento balanceado para aves – recipientes para granos y agua de los pollos e invertirá en la adecuación del galpón. 
El tiene la seguridad que con la experiencia puede levantar el negocio y volver a tener su actividad productiva – donde da trabajo a gente del sector.
Menciona que en su comunidad – la gente es muy colaboradora y participativa en las actividades que van en beneficio del pueblo.
texts.en:
Estuardo is a hard-working man, who is 40 years old. He lives with his wife and two children is the community of Esmeraldas.

Estuardo does various activities to earn money and bring food to the house every day. He does construction, agriculture, fishing, and gardening work.

He hopes that this loan, managed by FODEMI, will allow him to begin raising chickens again; he lost the chickens he had in a fire.

With this loan, he will buy chickens, balanced food for poultry, containers for grain, and water for chickens, and he will invest in improving the shed. 

He has conviction that with experience he can start the business and return to having a productive business, where he gives jobs to people in his area. He said that in his community, people in are very collaborative and participate in activities that bring well-being to the town.

loans.use: buy chickens, balanced food for poultry, containers for grain, and water for chickens, and he will invest in improving the shed.

loans.name: Orbelina

texts.es:
Orbelina tiene 52 años de edad, no estudió y está acompañada, su pareja se dedica a las actividades agrícolas y tiene 4 hijos que se encuentran estudiando diferentes niveles académicos. 

Actualmente, Orbelina se dedica a la venta de antojitos en su comunidad, ella prepara diferentes platillos de buen gusto para sus clientes, esta actividad la realiza desde hace 5 años y su pareja le ayuda al igual que sus hijos.

Este financiamiento lo necesita para comprar materia prima para la elaboración de antojitos como aceite, papas, repollo, harina, plátanos, etc. Y también comprar fertilizantes para la producción agrícola.

Su sueño es que su familia siempre esté bien, que sus hijos sigan adelante con sus estudios y apoyar siempre a su pareja para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Orbelina is 52. She did not study and she is in a relationship. Her partner works in agriculture. She has four children who are studying at different academic levels.
At the moment, Orbelina sells food in her community. She makes various different delicious dishes for her clients. She has been doing this for five years and her partner and children help her.
She needs this loan for the purchase of basic ingredients for making her food, such as oil, potatoes, cabbage, flour, and bananas. She also wants to buy fertilizers for agricultural production.
Her dream is for her family to always be well, for her children to move forward with their studies, and to always support her partner in order to succeed.

loans.use: to buy basic material for making foods: oil, potato, cabbage, flour, bananas, etc. She also wants to buy fertilizers for agricultural production.

loans.name: Carly

texts.en:
Carly is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to buy additional ingredients like rice grains, sugar, milk, etc., for her food vending business.

Carly has been in this business for 10 years. Carly earns more income from buying and selling fertilized duck eggs.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like rice grains, sugar, milk, etc.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 46-year-old man. He lives in Boyuk Bahmanli village of Fuzuli region with his large and lovely family. Ali’s family consists of six people: Ali, his wife (who is a housewife and doesn't work), and four children - three girls and a boy. Three of the children are going to secondary school and the little child is going to kindergarten. Ali and his wife are Internally Displaced Persons-IDP from Fuzuli city. They have an animal breeding business. Today Ali needs a loan in the amount of 1200 Azerbaijan new manat to develop and increase the family business. With this amount he is planning to buy winter feed for his animals. Ali is thankful for the help from dear Kiva organization and Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy winter feed for his animals.

loans.name: Orfith

texts.es:
Orfith es una madre de familia dedicada, tiene 54 años de edad y vive en San Martin junto a su familia.
Desde muy joven ha luchado por sacar adelante a sus hijos, quienes hoy se han convertido en grandes profesionales y personas de bien y la apoyan de manera incondicional. Desde hace más 20 años viene dedicándose al negocio de venta de carne de res y le va muy bien porque es muy trabajadora, responsable, ya es conocida por sus clientes porque ofrece productos de calidad y es muy confiable.
Orfith está muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá mejorar su vivienda como pintarrajear las paredes, de esta manera mejorará la calidad de vida de su familia y seguirá luchando para ampliar su negocio y vivir una vida tranquila junto a su familia.
texts.en: Orfith is a devoted mother. She is 54 years old and lives in San Martin, together with her family. Since she was young she has worked to get her family ahead. They are now good professionals and good people, and support her unconditionally. For more than 20 years she has worked selling beef, and she does very well because she is very hardworking and responsible. She is already known by her customers because she offers good quality products and she is trustworthy. Orfith is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, because with their support she will be able to improve her house by painting the walls. In this way she will improve the quality of life for her family, and she will continue striving to expand her business and live a quiet life together with her family.

loans.use: to paint the walls of her house.

loans.name: Annabel Monserrate

texts.es:
En la localidad conocida con el nombre de Pachinche  de la parroquia Colon de la ciudad de Portoviejo lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora y dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Grupo De Crédito Emprendedoras De Pachinche.
En este lugar vive la señora Annabel, tiene 42 años de edad, es madre soltera de una hija de 21 años que está comprometida pero viven con ella. 
Doña Annabel es una mujer que siempre le ha gustado ganar lo suyo para salir adelante, ella  se dedica a la venta de productos Avon y Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta todos los días, ella también en su casa se dedica a la cría de chanchos con lo cual se gana algo extra. Lleva más de 6 años con sus ventas.
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y alimento para chanchos. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta la ayuda de los créditos. Sus sueños son seguir adelante y tener buena salud.
texts.en:
The members of the “Emprendedoras De Pachinche” [Pachinche Entrepreners]  communal bank (known locally as “Pachinche”) meet every fifteen days.  Pachinche, of the Colon parish in Portoviejo, is a place known for its hardworking people that are engaged in agriculture and livestock.  In this place, lives Annabel, a 42 year old single mother with a 21 year old daughter.  She is engaged but she and her fiancé live with Annabel.

Annabel is a woman who has always enjoyed earning her share to get ahead.  She is engaged in selling Avon and Yanbel (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and ladies’ accessories).  She sells door-to-door every day and is also engaged in raising pigs in her home, with which she earns something extra.  She has been engaged is sales for six years.This loan is to purchase perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and feed for the pigs.  She has been involved in the communal bank since the start, and she is pleased with the support from the loans.  Her dreams are to continue moving forward, and to have good health.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and pig feed.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en: Nelson is a 32-year-old, married man with five children, living in Kasese, Uganda. He sells clothes- a business he has run for 14 years now. He earns additional income from farming. Nelson began the business to pay school fees for his children and to have a sustainable income for his family. Business expansion is his dream. He desires to achieve his dream. However, limited capital is a challenge. Nelson wants money to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Banabas

texts.en: Banabas is a repeat client growing tea as his main source of income, a business he started in 2009. He is a married man with two children aged 4 and 1 and one attends school.
