He is a hardworking man who works eight hours a day and six days a week. He started his business to be able to have a sustainable source of income to cater to his needs and the needs of his family. In addition to his major source of income, he also has a butchery to supplement his monthly income. The business is done in Kayembe, Mashonga, Kyamuhunga, Igara, Bushenyi district and his clients are tea traders and meat eaters. He has applied for a loan of shs 4,000,000 (four million shillings) to buy fertilizer and cows for slaughtering so that he can make more profit and educate his children. His major challenge is the poor weather of dry season. However he is determined to boost his businesses and achieve his targets through his hard work.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his tea farm and cows for his butchery.

loans.name: Ansar

texts.en:
Ansar is 33 years old and married. He is a father of four children. He lives in Gujrat, Pakistan along with his family. He is the  family's sole earner and is responsible for financially supporting his family.

The income generated by his present herd is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so he wants to increase his business of poultry. He has been doing this for the last 12 years and has become famous for providing good-quality poultry products in his area.
 
To increase his current poultry business, he has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan. This will help him to increase his sales, which will ultimately help in generating more income for him.
 
Ansar thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase his poultry business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Dinorah

texts.es:
Dinorah tiene 32 años de edad, pudo estudiar hasta sexto grado ya que sus padres no pudieron seguir dándole el estudio, está acompañada y su pareja se dedica al cultivo de maíz y sus hijos están estudiando en la escuela de la comunidad.

Dinorah se ha dedicado a trabajar desde que era muy pequeña en el cultivo de maíz y a la crianza de ganado bovino y de granja ya que su padre se dedicaba a esta misma actividad, cuando se acompañó no se le hizo difícil de acoplarse al estilo de vida de su pareja. Actualmente cultiva 2 hectáreas de maíz, ella se levanta desde muy temprano para preparar los alimentos que llevará al trabajo, el trabajo agrícola lo realiza en época de invierno y en la época de verano se dedica a trabajar en la corta de caña de azúcar.

Los fondos del crédito serán destinados para llevar a cabo la siembra de una hectárea de maíz, comprará insumos agrícolas como fertilizantes, y abonos.
Espera para un futuro que sus hijos puedan estudiar y prepararse, mejorar su vivienda para que ella y su familia puedan tener mayor seguridad.
texts.en:
Dinorah is 32 years old.  She was only able to study until 6th grade, because her parents could no longer send her to school.  She has a partner and he works cultivating corn.  Her children study in the local school.

Dinorah has been working cultivating corn and raising cattle and other livestock since she was very young, because her father was a farmer.  When she got with her partner, it was not difficult for her to adjust to his way of life.  They now cultivate 2 hectares of corn.  Dinorah gets up very early to prepare food to take to work.  She does the farmwork in the winter season, and in the summer she works cutting sugarcane.

The funds from this loan will be used to cultivate a hectare of corn.  Dinorah will buy agricultural supplies such as chemical and organic fertilizers.  In the future she hopes that her children can study and train, and also that she can improve their home so that she and her family can have more security.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies

loans.name: Amjad

texts.en:
Amjad is 45 years old and married, and the father of five children. He lives in Gujrat, Pakistan. He owns a poultry business in which he purchases large quantities of eggs and supplies them to different shops as a retailer. For the last fifteen years he has been running this egg sales business and was quite content with his earnings. 

Suddenly his household expenditures have increased. The income generated by his present flock is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so he wants to increase his egg sales business. He has become famous for providing good-quality eggs in his locality. 

To increase his egg sales business he has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. This will help him to increase his sales, which will ultimately help in generating more income for him. Amjad thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase his egg sales business.

loans.name: Kathangu

texts.en:
Kathangu is a 37-year-old, widower who supports a family of two children. He has been operating an electronics shop for a period of five years, earning an income of 50,000 KES at the end of every month.

Kathangu was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a credit officer and is now servicing his first loan of 100,000 KES and intends to use this amount to purchase torches, batteries, radios, and sockets to add to his electronics shop, which is running short of these items.

Kathungu plans to use the anticipated income to educate his children and hopes to provide the best education to his children. He also hopes to open another electronics shop in a nearby town.

loans.use: to buy torches (flashlights), batteries, cables, radios, and sockets to sell to his customers

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
As a married parent of eleven children, Vilma works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell, dried fish business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Vilma is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional dried fish to sell for her buy and sell, dried fish business.

Vilma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional dried fish to sell

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma works hard to support her family. Vilma is married and has a direct selling, personal collections business in the Philippines.

She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Vilma has been in this business for 2 years now.

In the future, Vilma would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: Virginita

texts.en:
Virginita has five children and works very hard for her family. Virginita is 48 years old and has three children who are in school.

She has a business, selling frozen foods and vegetables, in the Philippines. Virginita requested a 14,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Virginita has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Virginita would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Eduarda

texts.en:
Eduarda is 59 years old with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

Eduarda has been in this business for 2 years. 

In the future Eduarda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell

loans.name: Asaph

texts.en: Asaph, aged 40, is married with four children aged 15, 13, 9 and 4 years old. He deals in general merchandise, having started in 2004. He started the business to have a clear source of income. In addition to his general merchandise business, Asaph does coffee selling to supplement his income to cater to his family needs. He does business from his rural area, Bugongi town, Sheema District. His clients are people around his local area. He has applied for a loan of shs 3,000,000 (three million shillings) to buy general merchandise for his business. He is a very hardworking man working 10 hours a day and seven days a week, which has helped him to thrive greatly in the market despite the stiff competition he faces from other business-people of the same category. However, he hopes to make more profit after buying more merchandise for trade using the loan money. He also hopes to boost his business and in the long run fulfill his dreams of educating all his children.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise ranging from foodstuffs to clothing.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, five of whom are in school. Mary Jane works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling dried fish. Mary Jane is borrowing PHP 13000 through NWTF to buy fishing nets for her fishing business.

Mary Jane has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 40 years old, widowed, and has two children. She has been a farmer for 10 years earning an income of 4,000 KES every month.

Jane was introduced to Visionfund Kenya by a credit officer and requested her first loan for 5,000 KES, which she will use to pay school fees to her children. She hopes to educate her children up to university level and become a successful business woman by opening a cereals stall in her hometown.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz is 47 years old with four children, three of whom are in school. Luz works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

Luz has been in this business for two years. 

In the future Luz would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn works hard to support her family. Jocelyn has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Jocelyn requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase an additional fishing net.

Jocelyn has been in this business for two years now.

In the future, Jocelyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase an additional fishing net

loans.name: Honorina

texts.en:
Honorina is 52 years old and has nine children. Honorina is married and has three children who are in school.

Honorina is in the agricultural pig fattening business in the Philippines. Honorina requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Honorina has been pig fattening for two years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Honorina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 51 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Rebecca has borrowed and repaid 24 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from food vending.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a married man with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. He deals in men's and women's clothes, suitcases and babies’ clothing. He has been in that business for ten years and he does decorations at various functions for additional income.  He is a hardworking man faced with a challenge of competition.

Peter wants money to buy suitcases and baby clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy suitcases and baby clothes to sell

loans.name: M.yousaf

texts.en:
M.  Yousaf is 28 and living in Gujrat, Pakistan. He is a farmer by profession and owner of large areas of cultivation land. He cultivates seasonal crops on his land. Mostly he likes to cultivate rice. On his land area, there is no canal system for watering but his rice crop needs much water for irrigation purposes. So, he has to arrange another source to irrigate his crops. Now he has decided to irrigate his land by the tube well system. He is also in need of some agro chemicals for anti-bacterial products for his rice crop. For this reason, he has to bear some additional expense. Therefore, M. Yousaf has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

He is very thankful to Kiva and its partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy agro chemicals for his rice crop

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie has faithfully paid back her previous loan, which she used for her business. She has been operating her own “sari-sari” (variety) store for more than 10 years and she earns well from this. Having a bigger family requires more effort to provide for their needs, especially for her children. She has to work hard, with the determination of having better income, to provide their children with a better education. 

To improve sales, Julie would like to apply for a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. With PHP 50,000, she can purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Julie hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family. Every week, she meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages that she will sell in her store.

loans.name: Pablo

texts.en:
Pablo is 45 years old and has seven children. He has been engaged in buying and reselling fruits and vegetables within his community to generate income. He aims to further improve his business in order to sustain the necessities of his family and educate his children. 

Due to capital insufficiency, Pablo would like to access a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy various fruits and vegetables to resell. Through hard work and strong determination, he hopes that he will improve his business as well as his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy various fruits and vegetables to resell

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is married and works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for one year.

Erlinda requested a loan from NWTF for 5,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional fishing net. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley is 53 years old, single and helps her parents.

She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Shirley requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional feed.

Shirley has been raising pigs for five years now and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is a 46-year-old married woman with seven children living in Kasese, Uganda. She operates a salon for ladies. She has been in that business for six years and also does decoration services to improve her income. She began the business to have a stable source of income. 

Margret is a hardworking woman with the idea of expanding her business into a bridal centre. She is faced with a challenge of seasonality, which results in a scarcity of money. Margret wants the loan to buy cosmetics, a hair drier and weaves to use in her salon.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, a hair drier and weaves to use in her salon.

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is married and has four children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mejumaa operates a food-selling business, making dumplings and flat bread to sell. She sells from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the KES 20,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Evelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a restaurant business in the Philippines and earns additional income from her general store. Evelyn is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF to  buy ingredients like canned goods, meat, vegetables, etc for her restaurant business.

Evelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like canned goods, meat, and vegetables

loans.name: Shanti Mahila Samuha Shg Group

texts.en:
Suchitra is 51 years old and lives in a community in the Koriyasa village in Jharkhand. She is married and has a son. Her son is married and works in a private company while her husband is a driver. She didn't have access to a formal education but that didn't stop her from learning to read and write. Suchitra was running a vegetable shop that she closed due to her illness. She has recovered completely and she wants to reopen the shop. For this reason,  she is requesting a loan to buy vegetables.  Suchitra’s happy and enthusiastic personality is something that really characterizes this entrepreneur, and it is reflected in her work too. Her dream is to convert this small shop into a big shop, for which she works day in and day out, as she is sure that this line of work has great economic potential. 

The other members of “Shanti Mahila Samuha” Self-Help Group (SHG), Lakhi, Sakun, Fulkumari and Bebi, are also requesting a loan to improve their livelihoods.

Help these women to change their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy vegetables

loans.name: Noemi

texts.en:
This is Noemi. Her previous loan was a big help for her business, as she was able to purchase products for her direct selling business. The loan is also useful in the education of her children. Her income from the loan assisted with their everyday expenditures at home. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 12,000 PHP loan. It will be used to buy additional supplies and merchandise, such as shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener, undergarments and other products. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from this business will definitely help her to sustain her children’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Noemi hopes to expand her business and that she will have her own space for it. She wants to give her children good and quality education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and also draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and merchandise products like shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener, undergarments and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Mlongo

texts.en:
Mlongo, 28 years old, is married and has two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, school fees and clothing.

For the past four years, she has operated an open-air food business, selling to her neighbors and to neighboring school students. In addition, she does a faming business, which provides another source of livelihood. She faces a major challenge of seasonality, especially during the rainy season when it becomes difficult to operate. She dreams of establishing a retail shop and a café business.

With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to buy a stock of wheat flour, cooking fat oil, salt and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, cooking fat oil, salt and sugar

loans.name: Natalia Andrea

texts.es:
Natalia, en su incansable búsqueda de una mejor vida y una mejor estabilidad económica para su hijo de 3 años, inicio con un negocio de arreglo de uñas y cepillado de cabello prestando su servicio a domicilio en el municipio de Rionegro, Antioquia, un municipio donde el empuje y verraquera es un referente muy importante de los habitantes de esta zona.

Ella trabaja todos los días en horarios muy variados y siempre está ocupada en algún servicio ya que es muy solicitada por su buen trabajo.

Solicita un aliento económico para realizar la compra de planchas para el cabello, secadores y esmaltes de uñas de diferentes colores, así podrá prestar un mejor servicio y podrá mantener a flote su servicio.

Hoy en día se siente feliz por el buen trabajo que hasta ahora ha realizado y que le ha permitido gozar de un trabajo más estable.

Con un crédito podrás apoyar a Natalia a continuar con su proyecto de vida!
texts.en: In her tireless search for a better life and better financial stability for her 3 year old son, Natalia started a nail grooming and hair brushing business.  She provides her services in her home in Rionegro, Antioquia, a town where drive and tenacity are very important traits of the people in this area.  Natalia works every day with a varied schedule, and she is always busy with some service as she is greatly sought after for her good work. She is requesting an economic breath to purchase hair irons, dryers, and different colors of nail polish.  In this way, she will be able to provide better service and keep her business afloat.  Today, she feels happy for the good work that she has done until now, which has allowed her to enjoy a more stable job.  With a loan, you will be able to support Natalia and help her continue her life plan!

loans.use: to purchase hair irons, dryers, and nail polish to stock her micro-busines and be able to provide beauty services.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a quality dairy cow

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a 32-year-old married woman, with one child, who lives in Kasese, Uganda. She sells soft drinks and has been in that business for two years. She also owns a mobile money outlet and owns a textile shop where she gets additional income. She began the business to generate income for her family and give support to her husband.  

She is hard working and has a dream of completing her family house. However, limited capital is a challenge. Rehema wants a loan to buy cement and sand to finish building the family house.

loans.use: to buy cement and sand to finish building the family house.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 47 years old and married with five children. With three children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Elizabeth runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase stocks of household goods to sell. She has been in this business for two years.

In the future, Elizabeth would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of household goods to sell

loans.name: Giyos

texts.ru: Этого 52-летнего предпринимателя зовут Гиёс. Он живет вместе с сыном в городе Кургантюбе. Сын помогает отцу в его деятельности. Гиёс в течение 23 лет занимается производством и продажей мороженного и хлебобулочных изделий. В настоящий момент в его цехе идет ремонт. Он собирается расширить свой малый бизнес. После завершения ремонта своего цеха, Гиёс планирует заняться производством сладостей. На сумму кредита Гиёс купит кондитерский аппарат. Он надеется на поддержку.
texts.en: The name of this 52-year old entrepreneur is Giyos. He lives with his son in the town of Qurgan-Tube. His son helps him in his business. For 23 years, Giyos has been making ice cream, breads and pastries for sale. At present he is renovating his production facility. He plans to expand his small business. After the renovations are completed, Giyos plans to make candy. He will use his loan to buy a confectionery machine. He is hoping for your support.

loans.use: to buy a confectionery machine.

loans.name: Muthoki

texts.en:
Muthoki appreciates the previous loan she received that helped her expand her business.

She has a mat weaving business and sells door-to-door to her neighbors and passersby. With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase paints and sewing materials. 

She faces a major challenge of seasonality. She decided to join Yehu to access the loans to boost her business. She dreams of expanding and establishing a poultry business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase paints and sewing materials

loans.name: Jose Albeiro

texts.es:
El señor Albeiro junto con su esposa tiene un negocio de tienda de ropa puesto que en el campo no todo es cultivo también hay oportunidad para empresarios textiles, trabaja junto con su esposa con la cual tiene dos hijos de 3 y 9 años de edad muy pequeños que necesitan de cuidados pues están empezando su etapa de crecimiento.

El sueño con el que iniciaron su negocio es poder iniciar un ahorro para comprar una casa propia su gran anhelo un acogedor hogar donde puedan seguir con su amor familiar y progresando juntos. 

Buscando mejorar sus ingresos y mejorar la variedad de surtido para destacar entre la competencia quiere solicitar un crédito el cual invertirá en la compra de surtido de ropa para hombre y dama, abrigos, jeans, camisas, camiseras, blusas, sostén, ropa interior en general.

El crédito les beneficiara en gran medida pues tendrá mejor variedad y podrá mejorar sus ventas buscando siempre ese sueño de comprar una vivienda propia
texts.en:
Albeiro has a clothing store business together with his wife, since on the land there is not only farming but also opportunity for textile entrepreneurs. He works with his wife with whom he has two children, 3 and 9 year-olds, little ones who need care at this stage of their growth.

The dream that led to their business is saving to buy their own home, their great desire, a cozy home where they can continue to prosper sharing their family love.

He seeks to improve his income and expand the clothing range to stand out from the competition. He would like to request the loan to buy an assortment of men's and ladies' clothes, coats, jeans, shirts, t-shirts, blouses, brassieres, underwear in general.

The loan will be of great benefit, he will have better stock and will be able to improve the sales, always in pursuit of that dream: buying their own home.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of coats, blouses, jeans, shirts, t-shirts.

loans.name: Yeun

texts.en:
Yeun is a 54-year-old woman who lives in a remote area of Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. At home, she is a lovely mother of three dependent children. To make a living, she manages and operates a farming business in rice farm land, which is located near her house. So far, she has been involved in this business for nearly twenty years with average earnings of $5 (USD) a day.

Yeun wants to have household energy at a reduced monthly cost by purchasing a solar energy home system. Because there is inadequate money, she has requested a Kiva loan through its partner, HKL. After this initial investment, she hopes to have clean energy to power her household lights, TV and radio. She is very happy and thankful because with this loan, HKL has provided her a special interest rate lower than its general loan rates. She awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to buy a solar energy home system

loans.name: Annastasia

texts.en:
Annastasia is a 55-year-old woman who adds additional income to support their family, married to Charles, and are blessed with nine children. She has been operating a food stall for a period of two years and earns herself an income of 4,000 KES at the end of every month.

Annastasia was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a credit officer and she is now servicing her first loan of 5,000 KES. She intends to use this amount to buy some wheat flour to prepare snacks and sell them to her customers who visit her food stall every day.

Annastasia plans to use the anticipated income to open a soft drink shop and hopes to open a restaurant in her hometown in the near future.

loans.use: To buy wheat flour and make some snacks to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.es:
Benjamin es un joven muy trabajador, es soltero, tiene 21 años y vive en San Martin junto a su familia.
Es una persona con muchos deseos de superación, desde muy joven trabaja apoyando a sus padres en las chacras y ahora que está independizándose con mucho esfuerzo y algunos ahorros pudo comprar unos terrenos y desde hace varios años se dedica al cultivo de cacao, gracias a la amplia experiencia que tiene en este rubro hoy le va muy bien y es un productor que ofrece excelente calidad de productos.
Benjamin necesita comprar abono orgánico para sus plantaciones, para que de esta manera pueda obtener una mejor producción en la temporada de cosecha y sus ingresos mejoren, así podrá mejorar la calidad de su familia y seguirá esforzándose día a día para convertirse en el mejor productor de cacao de la zona.
texts.en:
Benjamin is a hard-working young man. He is 21 years old, single and lives in San Martin with his family. He is a person who dreams of getting ahead. 

Since he was a young boy, he has worked in support of his parents on small farms. Now that he is becoming more independent, with a great deal of effort and some savings, he was able to buy some land. For some years now, he has dedicated his time to growing cacao. Thanks to the ample experience he has in this field, today he is doing very well and is producing crops of excellent quality. 

Benjamin needs to buy organic fertilizer for his plants, so he can achieve the best production at harvest time and better his income. That way, he will be able to improve the status of his family and he will continue to strive day by day to become the best producer of cacao in the region.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizer for his cacao crop

loans.name: José David

texts.es:
José tiene 34 años de edad, logró estudiar hasta 6º grado luego ya no quiso seguir debido a que en esos tiempos pensaban que no era necesario el estudio y que lo importante era trabajar, está acompañado y su pareja trabaja en una panadería, tiene 3 hijos y solo dos estudian.

José se ha dedicado a trabajar desde que era muy pequeño en la agricultura, esto se lo enseñó su padre y sus hermanos mayores, José cultiva 2 hectáreas de maíz y frijol, sus cultivos los tiene a un kilómetro de su casa, además en la época que no siembra realiza trabajos de albañil.

Este crédito solicitado lo necesita para comprar medicamentos ya que su pareja fue intervenida quirúrgicamente, además comprará abonos y fertilizantes para aplicar a una hectárea de maíz. 

Sus planes a futuro son terminar su vivienda ya que la va construyendo por partes de la ganancia del cultivo, desea sacar adelante a sus hijos ya que están estudiando.
texts.en:
Jose is 34 years old. He studied until the sixth grade and then didn't want to continue because in those days it was thought that studying wasn't necessary and it was more important to work. Jose is in a common law marriage and his partner works in a bakery. He has three children, and only two of them are in school.

Jose has made a living as a farmer since he was very little. He was taught the trade by his father and older brothers. Jose cultivates two acres of corn and beans, and these are located one kilometer from his house. Also, in the seasons where he doesn't plant seeds he works as a brick mason.

The requested loan is needed to buy medicine since his wife recently had surgery, also he will buy compost and fertilizers to apply on his acre of corn.

His future plans are to finish his house since he has been building it in parts with the income from farming. He wants to help his children get ahead since they are already studying.

loans.use: to buy medicine since his wife recently had surgery, also he will buy compost and fertilizers to apply on his acre of corn

loans.name: Dilafruz

texts.en: Dilafruz is ambitions woman. She was born in the year 1985. Dilafruz is married and brings up two children. Her husband is a businessman. Dilafruz works in a café. She is a cook. Dilafruz cooks tasty dishes. Dilafruz has worked in a café for more than 6 months. She is a very hardworking woman and does her job well. Dilafruz is a very careful mother for her children. Her elder child is a pupil in the second form. Dilafruz must pay for her child’s education but she does not have the money. She is asking for a loan of 200 USD to pay for the education of her child in school. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to pay for the education of her child.

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine, aged 34 years, is married with three children aged between five and ten, all of whom go to school. She has been farming for ten years. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy more fertilizers for rice. The profits from the business will be used to build a house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers for rice.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy timber to make furniture for selling.

loans.name: Jhon Mario

texts.es:
Jhon es un hombre muy trabajador y organizado, se gana la vida prestando el servicio de transporte de materiales de construcción y de mercancía variada e su motocarga a través del municipio de Santa Fe De Antioquia posibilitando la movilización de productos y materiales para sus habitantes.

Es un hombre amable, servicial y muy emprendedor, viven en unión libre con su esposa y siempre procura por ofrecerle lo mejor para sus sostenimiento.

Solicita un préstamo para realizar el mantenimiento y reparación a su motocarga ya que es su único medio de trabajo y con el cual consigue su alimento diario.

Con este crédito podrá mejorar las condiciones de su vehículo y podrá continuar prestando su servicio con total seguridad y sin poner en riesgo su vida ni la integridad de sus cargas.
texts.en:
Jhon is a very hardworking and organized man. He makes his living transporting construction materials and various merchandise throughout the town of Santa Fe de Antioquia. This grants the people living there access to products and materials. 

He's a friendly, helpful and entrepreneurial man who lives with his wife and always strives to provide for her in the best way he can. 

He's asking for a loan to repair and maintain his vehicle, as it's his only means of working and it's how he's able to feed himself every day. This loan will allow him to improve the conditions of his vehicle and will allow him to continue offering his services in total safety without puting his life in danger and without damaging his cargo.

loans.use: to maintain his vehicle so he can continue offering his services and to be able to provide for his wife.

loans.name: Alberto Enrique

texts.es:
Alberto de 38 años de edad, solo estudió hasta 4° grado ya que su familia era bastante numerosa y tenían que dedicarse d trabajar, está casado y su esposa se dedica a vender pescado fresco, tiene dos hijas, una de ellas estudia en la escuela y la otra estudia bachillerato.


Alberto  se dedica a trabajar como pescador artesanal ya que su vivienda se encuentra cerca de una  laguna, él sale todos los días por las noches en compañía de su hermano a pescar, esto lo hace desde que estaba muy pequeño ya que su padre y todos sus hermanos  se han dedicado a la misma actividad, también por las tardes atiende un grupo musical cristiano donde en ocasiones lo buscan para que toque en eventos relacionados con la iglesia.

Él necesita el crédito para comprar una lancha pesquera, además para arreglar los trasmallos de pesca, ya que estas son herramientas necesarias para llevar a cabo la pesca.

Alberto espera para un futuro que sus hijos puedan terminar de estudiar y si fuese posible hasta la universidad ya que espera que puedan tener un buen trabajo que les pueda ayudar para su futuro.
texts.en:
Alberto, 38 years old, only studied through 4th grade since there were many children in his family and they had to earn a living by working.  He is married and his wife works selling fresh fish.  Alberto has two daughters.  One of them is in grade school and the other in high school.

Alberto earns a living working as a artisanal fisherman, since his home is very near a lake.  He goes out every night along with his brother to fish. He has been doing this since he was very young since his father and all his brothers earned a living in this way.  In the afternoons he also participates in a Christian musical group, and sometimes he is sought out to play at events related to the church.

Alberto needs the loan to buy a fishing boat, and also to repair his trammel nets, since these are necessary tools to carry out fishing.

He hopes that in the future his children can finish their studies and if possible through university level, since he hopes they can have good jobs that will help them a lot.

loans.use: to buy a fishing boat, as well as to repair his trammel nets

loans.name: Somaly

texts.en:
Somaly is a 29-year-old married woman. She has two dependent children who are currently in school. She lives in a small village of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business, growing rice and selling the crops to the local dealers. So far, she has been in this career for fourteen years.

Somaly wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from KIVA to build a latrine and buy its facilities. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loans.

loans.use: to build a latrine.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is 33 years old, married to Alango and blessed with three children aged 13, seven and two years. She has been running a retail shop for the last two years and earns a monthly income of 20,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES).
	 
She has applied for her first loan of 20,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya and intends to use the loan amount to buy to buy more stock of cooking oil, sugar and maize flour to add on to her stock for resale.                                                                                           

Caroline will use the anticipated profits to provide for the family basic needs. She hopes to grow her business and be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cooking oil, sugar and maize flour.

loans.name: Julienne

texts.en:
Julienne, aged 40 years, is married with six children aged between 16 and 21, all of them go to school. She has been farming for 11 years. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy more fertilizers of rice. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers of rice.

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona works hard to support her family. Chona is married and has a buy-and-sell vegetable and spices business in the Philippines.

Chona requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Chona has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Chona would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell.

loans.name: Pascal

texts.en:
Pascal is 24 years old and he is married. He has been farming for 12 years. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy more fertilizers for rice production. The profit from the business will be used to buy a new house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers for rice production.

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
Eden is 46 years old and married with one child.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Eden has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from a restaurant.

Eden aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka is a married woman. She has four children, all of whom attend school. Mwaka owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mwaka has operated a charcoal-selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a stiff competition from other firewood operators in her business.
 
With the Ksh. 25,000 she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Madina

texts.en: Madina is a 28-year-old lady. She has a retail shop selling sugar, salt and soap. She also earns from washing clothes. She faces a problem of defaulters and hopes to build a permanent house. She is accessing credit to buy sugar, bread, cooking oil and soap for selling.

loans.use: to buy sugar, bread, cooking oil, and soap for selling.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en: Jackson is 34 years old married with three children living in Kasese, Uganda. He operates a video hall and entertainment center. He has been in that business since 2008. He also earns a salary and owns a drug shop as additional income. He began that business to increase his family income. He is a hardworking man with a dream of developing his plot of land. He is faced with the challenge of an inconsistent power supply, which makes it expensive buying petrol time and again. Jackson wants money to buy a projector in order to serve his clients better.

loans.use: to buy a projector in order to serve his clients better.

loans.name: Juan Bautista

texts.es:
Juan es un agricultor que todas las mañanas desde que sale el sol se levanta a ejercer las actividades del campo, actividad que ha desarrollado su familia generación tras generación y que espera trasmitírselas a sus hijos para seguir con orgullo la tradición de agricultores Hernández. 

Es padre de 5 hijos y con sus cultivos de aguacate y maíz logra llevar el sustento a su familia a pesar de sus 72 años de edad sigue trabajando incansablemente parece que los años no el pesan trabaja largas jornadas laborales de 10- 13 horas diarias y sigue proyectando su negocio. 

Sueña con construir su casa al lado de su finca y pasar con su esposa el resto de su vida allí por eso quiere solicitar un crédito para potenciar su negocio comprara abono, riegos, fertilizantes, semillas, agua, fungicidas, pesticidas, insecticidas, etc. 

El monto es considerable pues sus cultivos son extensos y haciendo cuentas necesitan ese monto para comprar los productos necesarios para cubrir sus campos
texts.en:
Juan is a farmer who every morning gets up with the sun to work in the fields.  His family have been farmers for generation after generation.  Juan hopes to pass the tradition on to his children so that they can proudly carry on the tradition of the Hernández farmers. 

Juan is the father of five children.  His crops of avocado and corn allow him to support his family.  Despite his 72 years, Juan continues to work tirelessly.  His age does not seem to slow him down; he works long, 10-13 hours days and continues to protect his business. 

Juan hopes to build a house beside his farm and to live out his days there with his wife.  That is why he is requesting a loan- to strengthen his business.  He will purchase compost, irrigators, fertilizers, seeds, water, fungicides, pesticides, insecticides, etc. 

The sum Juan is requesting is considerable.  However, he has a large crop and when he takes a look at the numbers, he needs that amount to purchase the necessary supplies to cover all his fields.

loans.use: to purchase irrigators, fertilizers, seeds, water, fungicides, pesticides, insecticides etc.  He is also looking to build a house for himself and his wife to live out their lives in.

loans.name: Elimelech

texts.en:
Elimelech is a 38-year-old man married to Catherine, who adds additional income to support their family welfare. They are privileged to raise two children.  Elimelech operates a tailoring business shop which has been in operation for twelve years earning him an income of KES 15,000 at the end of every month.

Elimelech is now servicing his third loan of KES 40,000 with VisionFund Kenya and intends to purchase some stock of textile materials to boost his tailoring business shop with new and varied designs.

Elimelech plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees to his children and hopes to open a material textile shop to operate as the main wholesaler distributor in his hometown.

loans.use: to purchase new designs and fashions materials.

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.en:
Benedict is 40 years old and she is married. She has been farming for years. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy more fertilizers for rice. The profit from the business will be used to rear modern cows.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers for rice.

loans.name: Steven

texts.en: Steven is a 44-year-old man dealing in bricklaying and also earns from casual labour. Fluctuating weather is his major setback, but he hopes to build a permanent house. He needs a loan to buy firewood so as to bake bricks.

loans.use: to buy fire wood for burning bricks.

loans.name: Clementine

texts.en:
Clementine is aged 35 years; she is married with one child who is the age of 13 and goes to school. She has been farming for five years. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy more fertilizers for rice. The profits from the business will be used to improve their standards of living.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for rice.

loans.name: Nia Njema Group

texts.en:
Nia Njema is a group of four women and together they are known for their hardworking spirit. They join as a team to find a source of funds to grow businesses, hence making life better. Rusia is one of the member who is aged in her late thirties and she is the one who is carrying the profile of the group. 

Rusia is a mother of three daughters and one son, all of them at school. She is a divorcee and takes care of her family. For four years now, Rusia has had a shop selling dry foods such as rice, beans, sugar, maize, baking flour, etc. Working from 7 AM to 8 PM daily, she is able to make a very small profit per month. Despite the small profit and big family, Rusia still works hard and believes to grow to a high income. 

This is her first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, a Kiva partner, a loan to be apportioned among Nia Njema, a four member group. The members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

Rusia wants to use her portion of the loan to replenish her shop with food: rice, beans, cooking oil, maize, baking flour, etc. Her desire is to own a meals machine.

loans.use: to replenish her shop with food: rice, beans, cooking oil, maize, baking flour, etc.

loans.name: Domingo De Jesus

texts.es:
Domingo es un hombre de 43 años de edad el cual se desempeña como padre amoroso de 8 hijos menores de edad y como agricultor, en vista de que los ingresos no son suficientes para cubrir los gastos de su hogar, comenzó con una actividad que realiza en los ratos libres que le quedan como jornalero en otras fincas y es la venta de cerdos de engorde y de pescado con los que intenta mejorar las condición es de vida de su familia ya que como cabeza de familia está a cargo de todos los gastos en su hogar por lo que no le queda mucho capital para invertir en su negocio. 

Es por esta razón que requiere un crédito para la compra de cerdos de engorde y pescado con los que podrá mejorar sus ventas e impulsar esta actividad, teniendo más activas en su micro negocio y haciendo más atractivo a la vista de los clientes pues tendrá más animales para ofertar.

Su principal sueño es poder generar buenos ingresos para no ver pasar a su familia ninguna necesidad pues es algo que vivió y que lo afecto de gran manera por esta razón trabaja incansablemente por sus hijos y su esposa.

Apoya a un campesino del campo Colombiano con grandes sueños para su familia!
texts.en:
Domingo is a 43-year old man who is the loving father of eight dependent children.  He works as a farmer.  Seeing as how his income is insufficient to cover the household expenses, Domingo started a business.  He works at his business when he is not working as a day laborer at other farms.  He sells pigs and fish.  His intention with this business is to improve his family's living conditions.  As the head of the household, Domingo is responsible for taking care of the expenses in his home, so he doesn't have much capital left over to invest in his business. 

That is the reason Domingo needs a loan.  He will purchase pigs for fattening and fish, with which he will be able to improve his sales and give his business a boost.  He will have more assets in his micro-business and it will be more attractive from the point of view of his customers, as he will have more animals for sale. 

Domingo's main hope is to be able to generate a decent income so that his family will not lack for anything, like he did.  His experience affected him greatly, and that is why he works tirelessly for his wife and children. 

Help a Colombian farmer with his grand dreams for his family!

loans.use: to purchase pigs for fattening and fish to stock up his business and generate a better income for his large family.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is a 27 year old single woman blessed with two children and has been operating a retail shop for a period of four years earning her an income of KES. 20,000 at the end of every month.

Dorcas is now servicing her second loan of KES. 100,000 with VisionFund Kenya and intends to use this amount to buy rice, wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar to add to her current stock which is running out.

Dorcas plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees to her children and hopes to become both a retailer and a wholesaler of the food products in her hometown.

loans.use: To purchase some rice,sugar, wheat flour and cooking fat to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Greselda

texts.en:
Greselda is 63 years old and married with one child.

Greselda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store.

Greselda has borrowed and paid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 12 years and also earns an income from raising livestock and selling purified drinking water.

Greselda aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Mario Manuel

texts.es:
El trabajo del campo es una de las labores más difíciles hoy en día por el gran esfuerzo que se debe hacer para progresar. 

Mario es un hombre que nunca se ha rendido y siempre busca alternativas diferentes para progresar a pesar del clima o las circunstancias que puedan pasar, el siempre está dispuesto a conseguir los recursos para su familia.

Se levanta desde primera hora de la mañana para atender un negocio de producción de miel de abeja que tiene en su propia casa, su negocio consiste en la extracción de miel de las colmenas que tiene en su casa.

Es un negocio novedoso y único en esta región y por eso es un hombre muy solicitado por su producto.

Pide un apoyo económico para realizar la compra de materiales para el ampliamiento de sus colmenas como madera y mallas de seguridad.

Con este crédito podrá impulsar y mejorar su negocio para así sostener a su familia compuesta por su esposa y tres hijos pequeños.
texts.en:
Farming is one of the most difficult jobs today.  It requires great effort to progress. 

Mario is a man who has never given up.  He is always looking for different alternatives to progress, in spite climactic or other circumstances that come to pass.  He is always prepared to get the resources he needs for his family. 

Mario gets up early in the morning to tend to his honey production business, which his has situated in his own home.  His business consists of extracting honey from the bee hives that he has in his home. 

It's a novel business and the only one in the region.  Because of that, Mario is well-sought out for his product. 

Mario is requesting financial help to purchase some materials to expand his hives, like wood and safety mesh. 

With this loan, Mario will be able to improve his business and give it a boost.  He will then be able to support his family, which is composed of his wife and three small children.

loans.use: to purchase materials, such as wood and mesh, to expand his hives and continue with his honey production business.

loans.name: Cristo Salvador Group

texts.es: Este es el grupo “Cristo Salvador” conformada por 06 socios responsables y solidarios. Pilar de 23 años de edad es separada con 01 hijo dependiente. Ella  se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza. Así mismo como actividad secundaria se dedica a la venta de golosinas, gracias a su constancia y perseverancia en su negocio puede salir adelante. El crédito que solicitó lo destinará para la compra de perfumes, colonias, talcos y champús. El deseo de Pilar es de contar con un puesto de venta propio. El grupo “Cristo Salvador” agradece a las personas que hicieron posible este crédito. Pilar es la segunda del lado izquierdo y viste chompa negro.
texts.en: The "Cristo Salvador” (Christ the Savior) communal bank is made up of six responsible and supportive members.  One of the members, Pilar, is 23-years old, separated and has one dependent son.  She makes her living selling beauty products.  In addition, she has a second business selling sweets.  Thanks to her determination and perseverance in her business, she is able to get ahead.  The loan Pilar is requesting will be used to purchase perfumes, colognes, talcum powder and shampoo.  Pilar's hope is to have her own sales space.  The “Cristo Salvador” communal bank is grateful to the people who made their loan possible.  In the above photo, Pilar is second from the left and wearing a black shirt.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, cologne, talcum powder and shampoo.

loans.name: Las Inseparables Group

texts.es:
Fanny es una mujer de 24 años de edad, casada, madre de 2 niños y su negocio es la confección de polleras típicas.
Ella es una mujer emprendedora, constante, independiente, fuerte, luchadora, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su deseo de superación la ha llevado a formar una banca de personas con diferentes actividades comerciales para solicitar un préstamo. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona de ‘Huayllani’ que se caracteriza por  ser una población de clima cálido y medianamente seco famosa por sus comidas basadas en carne de conejo cuy y otras ofrendas gastronómicas. Varios restaurantes se pueden encontrar en las calles, es también famosa por sus numerosas chicherias, que producen la chicha de maíz,( Que es un fermento de la misma)de un agradable sabor.
Fanny es de tez morena, cabello negro largo, estatura mediana, su lengua natal es el quechua y utiliza el español para el comercio. (Sentada al centro con sueter a rayas rojas y blanco). Su trabajo es la costura de polleras. Una pollera de las que usan cuesta alrededor de 70 dólares americanos como mínimo, son bastante caras. Lo que está otra vez de moda son las polleras de siete bastas (siete centímetros de ancho en las tablas). El volumen depende del tamaño de la tela. Las que bailan en la fiesta de Gran Poder las hacen de nueve metros, comenta Fanny.
Ella desea ampliar su negocio realizando la compra de una máquina de coser industrial, para ser independiente con un taller propio y contratar a personas con deseo de superación para que la ayuden, esto mejorará la calidad de vida de su familia.
Es por esos motivos que Fanny solicita un préstamo para la compra de una máquina de coser industrial para desarrollar su propio taller de costura.
texts.en:
Fanny is a woman of 24. She is married and is the mother of 2 children. Her business is making traditional skirts. She is an entrepreneurial woman, persistent, independent, strong, striving, responsible, and very hard-working. Her desire to achieve has brought her to form a communal bank of people with different commercial businesses in order to apply for a loan. She carries out her business in the Huayllani zone, which is known for being an area with a climate that is warm and moderately dry. It is famous for its food based on rabbit, guinea pig, and other gastronomic offerings. A number of restaurants can be found on its streets. It is also famous for its numerous "chicherias," which product chicha (a fermented drink with a pleasant flavor)) from corn.

Fanny has a dark complexion, long black hair, and medium height. Her native language is Quechua, and she uses Spanish for business. (She is seated in the center with a red and white striped sweater). Her work is sewing polleras (traditional skirts). A pollera of the type they use costs a minimum of about 70 American dollars. They are quite expensive. What is again in style are the polleras with seven folds (with seven centimeters of fabric in the pleats). The volume depends on the size of the fabric. Those who dance in the Great Power festival have skirts of nine meters, comments Fanny.

She wants to expand her business by purchasing an industrial sewing machine, so that she can be independent with her own workshop and hire people with the desire to achieve, so that they can help her. This will improve the quality of life of her family.

It is for these reasons that Fanny is applying for a loan to purchase an industrial sewing machine to develop her own sewing workshop.

loans.use: to buy an industrial sewing machine in order to develop her own sewing workshop

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Jean works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Jean is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net for her fishing business.

Jean has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net

loans.name: Latif

texts.en: Latif is living with his wife and three children in the Baku region. He has a store and has been running it for over nine years. He also works as a taxi driver at night and transports products to the store with this car. A while ago, his car became disabled and to repair this taxi, Latif needs a loan of 1,400 Azerbaijan New Manat. It's his third loan and his previous loans have been repaid by Latif on time. He gives great thanks to Kiva for repeated help.

loans.use: to pay for repairs to his car

loans.name: Maricris

texts.en:
Maricris is 34 years old and married with three children who are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. Maricris has been in this business for two years. 

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is a 40 year old lady married with 7 children aged 28, 25, 23, 21, 16 and 10.She  bakes pancakes for a living and also earns money from farming.  She faces a challenge of limited capital but hopes to educate her children. She needs a loan to buy cassava flour, cooking oil and sweet bananas to increase on the number of pancakes baked daily.

loans.use: to buy cassava flour, cooking oil and sweet bananas to increase the number of pancakes baked daily.

loans.name: Ana Patricia

texts.es:
Ana con mucho esfuerzo logró cursar hasta noveno grado, dejó de estudiar debido a que sus padres necesitaban que se les ayudara en los gastos del hogar, ella tiene 30 años de edad y es madre soltera de dos hijos que estudian en la escuela a pesar de no tener el apoyo de su padre.

Ana es vendedora de pescados y verduras, esto lo ha hecho desde que estaba muy pequeña ya que su madre y toda su familia se ha dedicado a esta misma actividad, ella tiene que madrugar para comprar el producto fresco y a buen precio y luego va a las comunidades más cercanas a realizar la venta.

Los fondos del crédito los necesita para comprar más productos como pescados, mariscos y verduras ya que tiene bastante demanda de clientes y por el momento no le es suficiente la mercadería para cubrirla.

Sus planes a futuro son  trabajar y mantener a sus hijos, darles el estudio porque quiere que sean personas preparadas para obtener un buen trabajo.
texts.en:
It took Ana a lot of effort, but she was able to go to school until 9th grade.  She stopped going to school because her parents needed her to work and help them with the household expenses.  She is now 30-years old and the single mother of two children who do go to school despite not having help from their father. 

Ana sells fish and vegetables.  She has been doing so since she was very young, as her mother and her whole family worked doing the same.  She has to get up at dawn to purchase fresh products at a good price.  She then goes to the nearest communities to make her sales. 

Ana needs the funds from the loan to purchase more products, like fish, shellfish and vegetables.  She has a great demand from her customers and, at this time, doesn't have sufficient merchandise to meet the demand. 

Ana's future plans are to work and support her children, to give them education.  She wants her children to be prepared for getting good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase more products such as fish, shell-fish and vegetables.

loans.name: Angela

texts.en: Due to financial hardships, Angela has been engaged in a vegetable vending business to supplement her husband's income. She is 26 years old and blessed with three children. She and her husband dream of becoming successful and financially stable in order to give their children a bright future. She wants to strengthen her business and make it profitable but she has limited capital. For this reason, she would like to access financial assistance of PHP 10,000 to buy more eggplant, tomatoes, peppers, beans, cabbages, squash and other vegetables to resell. She hopes that she will receive her loan request so she is able to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy more eggplant, tomatoes, peppers, beans, cabbages, squash and other  vegetables to resell

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional fishnets and other fishing supplies for her fishing business.

Lorna has been in this business for nine years. Lorna earns more income from buying and selling native products.

Lorna has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fishnets and other fishing supplies

loans.name: Jacques

texts.en:
Jacques is 27 years old. He is married with four children between 5 and 12 years old and all of them go to school. He has been farming for 11 years. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy more fertilizers for rice. The profits from the business will be used for food for home consumption.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is a married woman with four children, all of whom still attend school and are still under her care. They live in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for the children.

Francisca operates a rental housing business and town dwellers are her customers. She cites her major challenge to be seasonality. Francisca dreams of establishing a boutique in the future.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase cement, iron sheets, paint and building blocks to renovate her house. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cement, iron sheets, paint and building blocks to renovate her house

loans.name: Saul

texts.en: Saul is 36 years old and married with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. For 10 years, he has been operating a retail shop of general merchandise. He practices farming as additional income. He began the business in order to cater to his family's needs. Saul is a hardworking person with a dream of expanding the business. However, he is faced with the challenge of inadequate capital. Saul wants money to buy salt, rice, sugar, soap and general merchandise to sell.

loans.use: to buy salt, rice, sugar, soap and general merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Ildephonse

texts.en:
Ildephonse is 32 years old. He is married with four children between 2 and 13 years old, two of whom go to school. He has been farming for 10 years. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy more fertilizers for rice. The profit from the business will be used to pay school fees for his children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for rice.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase seeds and farming supplies.

loans.name: Abdul Munaf

texts.en:
Abdul Munaf is a 31-year-old farmer living in Gujrat, Pakistan. He has one child, and is a responsible father. He cultivates seasonal crops, mostly rice, on his land. Rice needs a lot of water, but there is no canal system in his area. He has decided to irrigate his land with a tube well system instead. 

Abdul Munaf also needs some agricultural chemicals for to provide anti-bacterial properties to his rice crops. He hopes that these chemicals will enable him to get the maximum output. Abdul Munaf has asked for a loan from KIVA's field partner, BRAC Pakistan, to pay for the chemicals. He is very thankful to Kiva and its partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy agricultural chemicals for rice cultivation

loans.name: T.khovaiphei Group

texts.en: Tingneithem is a mother of three school-going children. She considers herself the caregiver of the family and does not hesitate to do odd jobs for the benefit of their humble family. Her daily routine includes cooking two meals, washing clothes, and going for her daily wage work. Life is busy for them and they can spend hardly any family time together. Their family spends quality time in the evening and on holidays. Her husband works as a carpenter and is self-employed. Both of them work hard to sustain their family with their daily earnings. The area they live in faces a shortage of power and the current goes off for two to three consecutive days every now and then. It becomes a difficult lifestyle to bear the consequences of the insufficient power supply that brings disadvantage to the study hours of the children after sunset. In consideration of the power situation, the mother took the mini solar loan so that her children can study well and give their best academic performances. She hopes that her children will excel in their studies to become a dependable and reliable person in the near future. She expressed her gratitude to Kiva for being involved in their life.

loans.use: To buy a mini solar home lighting system

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is a 40-year-old married man with four children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He deals in brick making and selling firewood, which boosts his income. He faces the principal challenge of weather fluctuations. He dreams of buying land to build a house to live in. 

William has asked for a loan to buy a forest of trees to provide firewood to bake his bricks.

loans.use: to buy a forest of trees to provide firewood to bake his bricks.

loans.name: Divine

texts.en: Devine is 41 years old. She is married with seven children between 22 years old and 1 month old, four of whom go to school. She sells at a shop and she has been running the business for the past 17 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more items such as cups, biscuits and sugar for sale. The profits from the business will be used to buy land and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more shop items such as biscuits, sugar and cups to sell.

loans.name: Saiti

texts.en:
Saiti is 52 years old and married. She lives with her husband and their children. To support the needs of her family, she usually sells rice from her home. Her husband is a fisherman and he works to find the fish and sell it.

She has asked for a loan from KPP-UMKM Syariah for 6,000,000 rupiah. This loan is being used for the improvement of access to water and sanitation for their family. She will build a bathroom, septic tank, and closet at their home. 

The sanitation makes her and her family have better health. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: to build a bathroom, septic tank, and closet at their home.

loans.name: Albanus

texts.en:
Albanus is a 30-year-old man living in Machakos, Kenya. He and his wife Ruth are blessed with one child. Albanu has been running a battery shop for five years now, selling battery acid and other chemicals. He earns an income of 15,000 Kenya Shillings (KES) by the end of every month. His wife earns an additional income to support their family. 

Albanus was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a Credit Officer. He has asked for his first loan of 20,000 KES, and plans to use this to buy additional  battery acid to add to his stocks.

Albanus plans to use the increased profits generated to pay for school fees for his child, and hopes to improve the quality of life for his family. He would also like to build a rental house in his hometown.

loans.use: To buy battery acid to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Eugenie

texts.en:
Eugenie is aged 32 years old, and she is married with three children aged between 8 and 16, all of them go to school. She has been farming for 13 years. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy more fertilizer for rice. The profits from her business will be used to buy a bicycle for transporting her production.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers of rice.

loans.name: Deo

texts.en:
Deo is a 41-year-old man, married with four children aged between 2 and 8, three of whom attend school. He has a carpentry workshop that deals in furniture, site building and fittings. He faces the challenge of customers wanting furniture at low prices. Deo dreams of building a residential house and an office building. 

Deo has asked for this loan in order to buy timber to make more furniture.

loans.use: to buy timber to make more furniture.

loans.name: Francine

texts.en: Francine is 29 years old. She is married with three children between seven and two years old.  She works in a shop and has been working for the past five years. With the loan, she would like to buy more rice, sugar, soap, and salt for sale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: To buy more rice, sugar, soap, and salt to sell

loans.name: Chantal

texts.en: Chantal is 29 years old. She is married with three children between 10 and 2 years old. Two of her children go to school. She has been selling beans for the past four years. With the loan, she would like to buy more items such as beans and groundnuts for sale. The profit from the business will be used to buy land and goats to raise.

loans.use: To buy more items such as groudnuts and beans to sell

loans.name: Vuslat

texts.en:
Vuslat is married and the mother of three children. She has a jewelry stand on the millrace shore. Through the summer, she opens her stand every evening. With her first loan, she bought materials to make jewelry and earned nice profits with what she sold during the summer.
