This year, even though it rained a lot, there were still crowds visiting the shore and she had many visitors each evening. She’ll keep her stand open until November, so she needs to buy more materials to make different types of jewelry again and continue selling.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Vuslat Hanım evil ve 3 çocuğu var.  Sahilde takı tezgahı var.  Yaz süresince her akşam sahilde tezgahını açıyor.  Aldığı ilk kredi ile takı malzemeleri almış ve yaz sezonun da satmış iyi gelir elde etmiş.  Bu sene yağışlar çok olsa da sahilin kalabalığının azalmadığını ve her gece yoğun ziyaretçileri olduğunu vurguladı.  Sahilde tezgahlar kasım ayına kadar açık kalacağından tekrar malzemeye ihtiyaç duydu ve ikinci kredisi ile tekrardan çeşitli takılar alacak ve satmaya devam edecek.

loans.use: to buy more materials to make different types of jewelry

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 30 years old, married to Vitalis and blessed with five school-going children who are between 14 and five years old. She has been running a quarry site where she sells building stones for her customers. She has been running this business for the past three years and earns a monthly income of KES 15 000 Kenyan Shillings (KES).
	 
She has applied for her first loan of 10,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya and intends to use the loan to hire two more laborers to work in the quarry.                                                                                          

Eunice will use the anticipated profits to provide for the family's basic needs. She hopes to grow her business and be able to give her children the best education.

loans.use: to hire two more laborers

loans.name: Onesmus

texts.en:
Onesmus is a 32-year-old man, married to Emily who adds additional income to support their family's welfare. They are blessed with two children.  Onesmus has been operating a grocery stall for a period of five years, earning an income of KES 10,000 at the end of every month.

Onesmus was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a Credit Officer and is now servicing his fist loan of KES 15,000 and intends to use this amount to buy cabbages, carrots, tomatoes, potatoes and kale to sell to his customers on a daily basis.

Onesmus plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees for his children and hopes to become a successful businessman with a bright future.

loans.use: To buy cabbages, onions, tomatoes, potatoes, carrots and kale to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.en: Gulchehra is an industrious woman. She is married and has two children. Gulchehra is a higher-educated woman. She works in a local school. She is a teacher. Her husband is also a teacher. Gulchehra always cares about the education of her children. Now, her daughter is a student of the first course. She studies economics. Her daughter studies in the capital of Tajikistan. She must pay for her daughter’s education and with this aim, she is asking for a loan of 1,400 USD to pay for the education of her daughter. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To pay for the education of her daughter

loans.name: Ledys Del Socorro

texts.es:
Ledys una mujer de 56 años de edad toda una luchadora, una guerrera de la vida que vio cómo su esposo se marchaba dejándola con sus 3 hijos pero no le quedo grande alimentarlos y educarlos. 

Gracias a un crédito logro montar un restaurante que tiene operando hace aproximadamente 5 años y su idea es seguir proyectándose ya que tiene uan buena clientela realizar modificaciones para mejorar el aspecto y el ambiente del negocio. 

Solicita un crédito para realizar modificaciones a su negocio, compara pintura, cambiara las sillas feas y viejas que tiene, las mesas, los manteles, comparara nuevos implementos de cocina, cucharones, ollas que le hacen falta etc. también comprara surtido para realzar sus alimentos y bebidas, frutas, maíz, carnes, verduras, granos etc. 

Con este crédito podrá seguir operando y ayudara a mejorar su aspecto de su negocio buscando atraer más clientes y apoyar a sus nietos para que estudien y tengan un futuro muy prometedor.
texts.en:
Ledys is a 56 woman who is a real fighter, having watched her husband walk out on her and leave her with three children and hardly anything to feed and educate them. 

Thanks to a loan Ledys was able to to set up a restaurant which she has run for about five years now.  As she has steady customers her idea is to continue with this business but make some changes to improve the look and feel of the restaurant. 

Ledys is applying for a loan to make some changes to her business. She would like to replace the chairs which are old and ugly and buy tables, tablecloths and new implements for cooking which she needs including ladles and pots. She will also buy new stock to make her meals and drinks such as fruit, corn, meat, vegetables, grains, etc.

With this loan Ledys will be able to continue running her business. The loan will help her to improve the look of her restaurant and attract more customers. She will also be able to support her grandchildren so they can study to have a more promising future.

loans.use: to replace the chairs which are old and ugly and buy tables, tablecloths, ladles, pots, fruit, corn, meat and vegetables

loans.name: İsmayil

texts.en: Ismayil is 33 years old and lives in the Baku region with his family. He is married but doesn't have any children yet. His wife is a housewife and Ismayil is a taxi driver. He has been in this business for five years. Now, the engine of his car needs repairs. For that reason, Ismayil needs a loan of 600 AZN (Azerbaijan new manat). Ismayıl is thankful for the Kiva organization and all the lenders for their help and support

loans.use: to repair his car's engine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wheat flour, maize flour, cooking fat, rice, sugar and detergent to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Çiğdem

texts.en:
Çiğdem is single. She runs a café she opened on the millrace shore. Her family comes to the café every morning and works until 2am. In summer they are very busy. Because they’re so busy, they need to buy more supplies. With her second loan, she’ll buy wholesale goods for the café. In the future, she wants to install a roof on her restaurant so she can stay open in the winter months.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Çiğdem Hanım bekar.  Üç buçuk yıl önce  başladığı kafe işletmeciliğine devam ediyor.  Ailesi ile her sabah kafeye geliyor ve gece saat ikiye kadar burada çalışıyorlar.  Yaz dönemi olduğundan işleri çok yoğun. Geceleri çok yoğun olduğundan malzeme almaya yetişemiyorlar.  Aldığı ikinci kredi ile kafeye toplu  malzeme alacak.
İleride kafesinin üstünü kapatmak. Kış aylarında da açık alandan faydalanmak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy wholesale goods for the café.

loans.name: Pallai Group

texts.en:
They are a group of women who reside in the same locality with a common economic background. They think that the place they live does not have adequate social resources like fair wages for a better life. They look forward to running their own businesses so that they can sustain their families and be self-reliant. 

Zenkhonem, pictured with her hand raised, is the featured borrower of the group. She runs a petty shop in her village. The profit she makes from the shop is used for the household expenses and she can hardly save an amount for innovating her business. This business is very special to her because it gives her self-employment. At the same time, it provides customer satisfaction and she feels the joy of serving her customers. As a humble person, she maintains her family expenses with the little profit she makes. At present, she will be innovating the petty shop by buying more inventories so that she can sell more items to attract customers. Customer attraction is very important in her business, said she. By doing so, she will generate more income to satisfy her family and improve her living condition. She says, “Thank you so much Kiva for availing me the loan”. She will make the maximum utilization of the loan.

loans.use: To buy inventory including sugar, soap, toothpaste, mustard oil, cigarettes, beetle leaves and beetle nuts to sell.

loans.name: Engari Nyekundire Group

texts.en:
Beatrace is a 50-year-old woman married with five children. Four of her children are in school. She owns a small retail shop in the trading centre with capital of 700,000 UGX. Beatrace also rears goats as a side business where she gets money to support her retail shop. She has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 UGX to help her add more stock in her business and use the rest of the money to buy more goats so as to boost her goat project. Her major challenge is thieves who steal her goats after she has invested in her loan money which affects her cash flow.

Despite these challenges, Beatrace is a very honest and hardworking woman.

loans.use: to buy goats.

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en: Kousar is a 46-year-old married woman. She is the mother of six children. For the past three years, she has been running a business of cattle purchase and sales, along with her husband. She looks after the cattle and is responsible for feeding them, while her husband sells them to different markets in the city. Their business is providing them with enough income to support their family. However, they need to earn much more to meet their everyday expenditures including food, health and clothing. In order to increase their earnings, Kousar has requested a loan amount of 50,000 PKR to buy cattle for resale purposes. She is hopeful that expanding the business will help to improve her family’s living standards.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David, 65, is a smallholder mixed-farmer from Nandi Hills, Kenya. He has three children. He has been selling milk, eggs and food crops from his farm for 15 years. These primary income sources have sustained him and his family for all this time. However, the income is not enough to fulfill his family’s basic needs. This has forced him to venture into other numerous side businesses.

There is no denying that David loves what he is doing. He names all the animals on his farm. He spends his free time planting and weeding vegetables. His passion enables him to overcome his biggest challenge, which is marketing his products.

David is seeking a loan to purchase farm inputs. He is planning to use these farm inputs, which include cereals, to prepare for the coming season. Farming costs are increasingly becoming expensive for small scale farmers who rely on the income they generate from their previous harvest. When farmers experience a loss or small profits from their harvest, they become incapable of footing farming costs for the next season.

Your loan will help such a farmer to purchase necessary inputs. By supporting their economic activity, you are empowering them.

David plans to continue farming in order to make money for his children's welfare and education. He said, "This loan will help me boost my cereals business.'

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as cereals

loans.name: Zeenat

texts.en: Zeenat is a 49-year-old married woman who has been running a business with her husband selling milk for the past 3 years. She has some animals for milking. She looks after the cattle, feeds them and performs the task of collecting milk from them. She also sells animals on a seasonal basis to generate an extra amount of income. She earns enough income to meet the expenses of her family. In order to make more profits, she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase another cow for milking. She is hopeful that her income will increase and the profits alongside.

loans.use: to purchase another cow

loans.name: Dairo Dario

texts.es:
Dairo es un joven campesino de 22 años de edad, trabajador y humilde, que desde niño aprendió a realizar todas las labores del campo, gracias a las enseñanzas de sus padres. 

Esto le ha permitido progresar y, hoy en día posee un cultivo de yuca, actividad que realiza todos los días y las cosechas las vende en la plaza de mercado del municipio de Valencia, con los ingresos que obtiene vela por el bienestar de sus padres que tanto lucharon para sacarlo adelante. 

Con el apoyo del crédito comprará insumos agrícolas al por mayor como abonos, pesticidas, fertilizantes y otros, con esto seguirá cuidando sus cultivos y tendrá una mejor cosecha, con lo que mejorará los ingresos a la hora de vender sus productos. 

Dairo, con su espíritu emprendedor, su pujanza y tenacidad, quiere seguir luchando para cumplir el sueño de tener una finca propia, en la que pueda cultivar mucha más variedad de productos y así mejorar la rentabilidad del negocio, garantizando una estabilidad económica para dar mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Dairo is a 22-year-old, hard-working and humble peasant. Thanks to his parents, he has been learning to do all sorts of work in the countryside since he was a boy.

Learning these skills has allowed Dairo to progress in life and today he has yucca crops. He looks after his crops every day and sells his harvest at the market square in the municipality of Valencia. He uses his income from this to look after the well-being of his parents, who fought so hard to help him to get ahead.

This loan will be used to buy fertilisers irrigation tools and manure. With it, Dairo will continue to look after his crops and will have a better harvest. This will allow him to increase his income when he comes to sell his products.

With drive, tenacity and an enterprising spirit, Dairo wants to continue fighting for his dream of owning his own farm. There he would like to grow a much greater variety of products, increase profitability, and guarantee a stable financial situation in order to offer his family a higher quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilisers irrigation tools and manure for his yucca crops and to increase his income in order to support his parents.

loans.name: Karina Isabel

texts.es:
Karina es una joven de 26 años de edad quien encuentra en su hijo (ver foto) la mayor fuente de fuerza e inspiración para seguir adelante y soñar con un mejor futuro, es una persona muy humilde, pero que en base a trabajo le brinda lo esencial a su hijo. 

Buscando mejorar la calidad de vida, reformar su vivienda y un futuro prometedor a su hijo Karina quiere solicitar un crédito para iniciar su negocio de comidas rápidas, pide un monto pequeño pues está muy consciente que tiene que ser puntual para que le vuelvan a dar la oportunidad de prestarle dinero y con ese poco dinero comenzara a construir su futuro y7 el de su hijo. 

El crédito lo invertía en surtido en un carrito de comidas rápidas que le dejaran muy económico (ver foto) y solo queda que le den un voto de confianza para trabajar por su hijo por que el merece lo mejor del mundo y ella hará hasta lo imposible para dárselo
texts.en:
Karina is 26 years old. It is from her son (shown in the photo) that she finds her greatest source of strength and inspiration to move forward in life and dream of a better future. Karina is a very humble young person but, through her work, she provides her son with the necessities.

Looking to improve her quality of life, make improvements to her home and provide her son with a promising future, Karina is applying for a loan in order to start a fast-food business. She is asking for a small amount of money as she is very aware that she will needed to be punctual with repayments in order to be given other loan opportunities. Karina will use this small loan to build a future for herself and her son.

Karina will invest this loan in stock and a very economical fast food cart (shown in the photo). Then, all she will need is a vote of confidence in order to work for her son. He deserves the best that there is, and Karina will do everything that she can to give it to him.

loans.use: to start a fast-food business in order to give her son a better future.

loans.name: José Raul

texts.es:
José tiene 40 años de edad, debido a la situación económica de su familia con pudo continuar estudiando, su esposa se dedica a trabajar en la venta de pescado fresco, tiene 3 hijos que están estudiando en la escuela de la comunidad.

José se dedica a trabajar en la pesca artesanal, pues cerca de su casa hay una laguna la cual le proporciona una fuente de trabajo  para mantener a su familia, esto la ha hecho desde muy pequeño pues su padre y sus hermanos se dedicaban a la misma actividad, este trabajo lo hace por la mañana o por las noches todos los días, además, cultiva una hectárea de maíz pero solo lo hace ocasionalmente.

El crédito lo necesita para comprar trasmallos para pescar diferente tipo de peces. 

Él sueña para un futuro darle el estudio a sus hijos y comprar una lancha pesquera.
texts.en:
José is 40 years old and, due to his family's financial situation, he could not study. José's wife makes a living selling fresh fish. The couple has three children who attend the local school.

José is an artisan fisherman as there is a lake near to his home, and this provides him with a source of work to support his family. José has done this work since he was very young as his father and siblings did this same work. José works in the morning or at night every day. He also occasionally grows corn on a hectare of land.

José needs this loan in order to buy trammel nets to fish for other types of fish.

José dreams of giving his children an education and of buying a fishing boat.

loans.use: to buy trammel nets to fish for other types of fish.

loans.name: Jonathan Joselito

texts.es:
Jonathan tiene 18 años de edad, de estado civil soltero , vive con sus padres vive en la comunidad Camaron perteneciente al Cantón Echeandia Provincia de Bolívar.

El se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado. Solicita el crédito para la compra de ganado. La compra lo realiza en el mercado de Echeandia. Su meta es mejorar su negocio y comprarse una casa. Su desafío es no tener una buena economia. En su tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Jonathan is 18 years old, single and lives with his parents in the Camaron community of the Echandia canton, Bolívar province.

Jonathan makes a living buying and selling cattle. He is applying for this loan in order to buy cattle. He buys it at the Echendia market. Jonathan's goal is to improve his business and buy a house. The challenge that he is facing is that he does not have good finances. In his spare time, Jonathan likes to play sports.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Rosas De Septiembre Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ROSAS DE SEPTIEMBRE” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Cascada, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Genara es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tejido de mano, venta de mazamorra, costura de ropa, tejido de mantas de alpaca, venta de lana de alpaca, servicio de transporte.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Genara es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de  artesanía en mantas; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió por iniciativa propia hace nueve años, al observar a varias mujeres que trabajaban con este negocio aprendió la técnica y comenzó su negocio que en la actualidad es su fuente de generación económica. 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana por mayor) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará a en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las reuniones con sus compañeras de grupo que le ofrece la institución.

En la imagen se identifica una señora de negro que acompaña al grupo.
texts.en:
The communal association “ROSAS DE SEPTIEMBRE” will begin its second loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de Cascada. It has nine members and is led by officers, of whom Genara is the president. The businesses that the communal association members carry out are varied and among them are hand weaving, selling mazamorra (rice pudding), sewing clothing, weaving blankets made of alpaca wool, selling alpaca wool, and a transportation service. 

The loan that they take out will benefit the small businesses owners, of whom Genara is one.  She says that a year ago she joined Pro Mujer, joining at the invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution.  Currently she has a business making blankets. She says that she began this business at her own initiative nine years ago after seeing several women who worked in this business, she learned the technique and began the business that is now her source of income.

The loan that she is taking out is to increase her capital (purchase wool in bulk), that she will get at the fairs in the city of El Alto and, after production, will sell it in her sales stall.  This means of work permits her to generate resources to help her family, since she is married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replies that she likes the meetings with her group members that the institution offers. In the photo, there is a woman wearing black who accompanied the group.

loans.use: to purchase wool in bulk.

loans.name: Lizeel

texts.en:
Lizeel is 39 years old and married with three children who are in school. Lizeel works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy items such as shampoo and groceries to sell.

Lizeel has been in this business for 1 year. In the future Lizeel would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a washing machine and a cart to transport her washing machines because she rents them. Her goal is to have a more dignified life.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es:
Alfredo es un joven muy entusiasta, es soltero, tiene 18 años de edad y vive en Chincha junto a su familia.
Es una persona con muchos deseos de superación, lamentablemente no puede estudiar una carrera profesional porque su familia está atravesando por algunas dificultades económicas, por eso Alfredo, para apoyarlos desde hace casi un año trabaja como ayudante de carpintería, y con los ingresos que obtiene ayuda en los gastos del hogar. Es una persona que se merece todo lo mejor del mundo, un hijo colaborador, responsable, trabajador, honesto y con muchas ganas de salir adelante.
En estos momentos Alfredo quiere comprar una cocina para su casa, para que de esta manera su madre tenga mayor seguridad al cocinar ya que la cocina que tiene está un poco desgastada, de esta manera estará mejorando poco a poco su calidad de vida y seguirá luchando incansablemente para poder abrir un negocio propio y estudiar una profesión.
texts.en:
Alfredo is a very enthusiastic young man, single, 18 years old, and lives in Chincha with his family.

He is a person with a lot of desire to improve himself.  Unfortunately, he couldn't study for a professional degree because his family is going through some economic difficulties.  For this reason, Alfredo, in order to support them, has for almost a year worked as a carpenter's assistant and with the income that he gets, he helps with the household expenses. He is a person who deserves the best in the world. He is a contributing son, responsible, hard-working, honest and wants very much to get ahead.

At this time, Alfredo wants to purchase a range for his house, so that in this way his mother has more safety while cooking since the range she has now is a bit worn out. In this way, he will be improving their quality of life little by little and will continue fighting tirelessly to be able to open his own business and study for a professional degree.

loans.use: to purchase a range for his house.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy salon hair products.

loans.name: Said

texts.en:
Said, who is in his early forties is married with two children who are still at school. He has been running two projects, a grocery store and a barber shop for six months now. He works from 8am to midnight daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be Said's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He will use this loan to buy additional stock of beer, wine, whiskey, water, soda and juice for his grocery store. He dreams of owning a bar.

Said, who belongs to a group "GODLINE", will be accountable for paying back his loan.

loans.use: to buy stock of beer, wine, whiskey, water, sodas and juice for his grocery store.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Cristina es una mujer de 62 años de edad, soltera, sin hijos y su negocio es la venta de frutas secas.
Ella es emprendedora, independiente, conversadora, perseverante, fuerte, luchadora, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su trabajo lo realiza en la Ceja de El Alto situada al oeste de Bolivia en la meseta altiplánica que forma parte del área metropolitana de La Paz, se encuentra a una altitud de 4.070 metros sobre el nivel del mar, posee una gran actividad comercial minorista.
Cristina es de tez morena, cabello negro largo trenzado, su vestimenta es típica y su lengua natal es el aymara, ella es parte de una cantidad de migrantes del norte del departamento de La Paz que vinieron a poblar la ciudad de El Alto principalmente durante los años 70’s debido a las condiciones agrícolas que imperaban en sus tierras. Su negocio es la venta de fruta seca (maní, almendras, pelón (duraznos deshidratados), semillas de girasol, etc.),  y productos derivados, (maní endulzado, maní con sal, plátano frito, etc.). en un puesto en la calle cubierto por un toldo (sombrilla) y resguardado por un pedazo de nylon azul que utiliza como pared.
Su sueño es vender por mayor todos sus productos. Ella desea mejorar su calidad de vida realizando la compra por mayor de frutas secas y con los beneficios incrementar su mercadería.
Es por esos motivos que Cristina solicita un préstamo para la compra por mayor de fruta seca y con los beneficios incrementar su mercadería.
texts.en:
Cristina is a 62-year-old woman, single, with no children, and her business is selling dried fruits.

She is enterprising, independent, talkative, persevering, strong, determined, responsible, and very hard-working. She does her work in the Ceja de El Alto, located in western Bolivia in the high plateau that is part of the metropolitan area of La Paz. It is at an altitude of 4,070 meters above sea level, and has a lot of retail businesses.  

Cristina is tanned, has long braided black hair, wears traditional clothing, and her native language is Aymara. She is part of a number of migrants from the north of the department of La Paz who came to live in the city of El Alto primarily during the 1970s, due to the farming conditions that prevailed in their lands. Her business is selling dried fruits (peanuts, almonds, dried peaches, sunflower seeds, etc.), and their derivatives (sweetened peanuts, salted peanuts, fried plantain, etc.) in a stall on the street covered by an umbrella and backed by a piece of blue nylon that she uses as a wall. 

Her dream is to sell all her products in bulk.  She wants to improve her quality of life, purchasing dried fruits in bulk and with the profits, increasing her merchandise.

For these reasons, Cristina asks for a loan to purchase dried fruits in bulk and with the profits, increase her merchandise.

loans.use: to purchase dried fruits in bulk, and with the profits will increase her merchandise.

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en:
Claudine is 34 years old. She is married with 2 children aged between 4 and 6, and all of them go to school. She has been farming for 9 years. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy more fertilizers. The profit from the business will be used to purchase a motor bicycle for the transportation of rice.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilisers for rice production.

loans.name: Maria Eva

texts.es:
Maria tiene 32 años de edad, de estado civil soltera, vive sola en la comunidad Camaron perteneciente al Cantón Echeandia Provincia de Bolívar.

Ella se dedica a la agricultura, cultivando yuca, platano, naranja y a la cria de cerdos. Solicita el crédito para la compra de abono, fertilizantes, y la compra de cerdos. La compra lo realiza en Echeandia semanalmente. Su meta es mejorar la venta de sus animales y la producción de sus sembrios. Su desafío es el clima y las plagas en sus sembríos. En su tiempo libre le gusta descansar.
texts.en:
Maria is 32 years old, single, and lives alone in the community of Camaron, which is part of the canton Echeandia, in Bolívar province.

She works in agriculture, growing yucca, plantains, oranges and also raising pigs. She asks for a loan to purchase manure, fertilizer, and pigs. She does her shopping weekly in Echeandia.  Her goal is to improve her animal sales and the production of her fields.  Her challenge is the climate and the pests in the fields. In her free time, she likes to rest.

loans.use: to purchase supplies and pigs.

loans.name: Njira

texts.en:
Njira appreciates the previous loan that helped her expand her business. She buys and sells livestock, selling at the market to neighbours. She faces the major challenges of seasonality and high transportation costs.  

With the loan that she is requesting, Njira wants to purchase transportation and goats to resell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase goats and transport.

loans.name: José Deonicio

texts.es:
José tiene como nivel académico 9º grado, no pudo seguir estudiando ya que sus padres no tenían las condiciones económicas para apoyarlo, tiene 50 años de edad y está casado, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y procrearon 6 hijos.

La agricultura es la actividad a la cual José se dedica, él siembra 3 hectáreas de maíz, esto lo ha hecho desde que estaba pequeño y lo aprendió de su padre, el lugar donde cultiva está a 1 kilómetro de su casa y tiene que madrugar para poder terminar el trabajo, además trabaja como fontanero en su comunidad de manera que realiza varias actividades obtener ingresos para salir adelante con su familia. 

Él solicita el crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas como fertilizantes, abonos y otros que sean necesarios para el cultivo. 

Su sueño es seguir trabajando, apoyarse con su esposa y darle un buen ejemplo a su hijo.
texts.en:
José went to school up to the 9th grade. He couldn't continue studying because his parents didn't have the economic conditions to support him.  He is 50 year sold and married. His wife takes care of the household tasks, and they had 6 children. 

Farming is the work that José does; he plants 3 hectares of corn, which he has done since he was young, and he learned from his father.  He grows it in a place 1 kilometer from his house and has to get up very early in order to be able to finish the work.  In addition, he works as a plumber in his community, so he does a variety of jobs to have income to get ahead with his family.

He asks for a loan to purchase agricultural supplies such as fertilizers, manure and others that are necessary for the crops.

His dream is to be able to continue working, support himself with his wife and be a good example to his children.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies such as fertilizer, manure, and others that are necessary for the crops.

loans.name: Las Señoras De Lucumo Group

texts.es: Elvira es socia del grupo “Las Señoras De Lúcumo” conformada por 10 mujeres  trabajadoras que pasan a su 10mo ciclo. Elvira de  42 años es casada con 03 hijos dependientes. Hace más de 14 años que se dedica a la venta de abarrotes. Se siente feliz pues gracias a su esfuerzo ha mejorado su calidad de vida. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de arroz, aceite, azúcar y fideos. Tiene el deseo de ampliar su negocia de mercería y plásticos. El grupo “Las Señoras De Lúcumo” están agradecidos con el crédito brindado ya que hace posible su progreso. Elvira se encuentra de pie en la parte posterior es la primera del lado izquierdo y viste casaca con rayas rojo y blanco.
texts.en: Elvira is a member of the "Las Señoras de Lúcumo" group, made up of 10 hard-working women who are entering their 10th loan cycle. Elvira is 42 years old, married, with 3 dependent children. For over 14 years, she has worked selling groceries. She is happy because, thanks to her efforts, she has improved her quality of life. She asked for the loan to purchase rice, oil, sugar, and noodles. She wants to expand her notions and plastics business.  The "Las Señoras de Lúcumo" group is thankful for the loan offered that has made their progress possible. Elvira is standing in the back of the picture and is the first on the left, wearing a jacket with red and white stripes.

loans.use: to purchase rice, oil, sugar and noodles.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
El señor Luis es un hombre muy emprendedor y creativo, desde hace mucho tiempo ha querido ser independiente y tener su propio negocio de salsamentaría y restaurante.

Actualmente puede materializar su sueño gracias su gran capacidad de trabajo y al apoyo que puede recibir de las personas que deseen que él salga adelante.

De este negocio dependerán su esposa y 3 de sus hijos a los cuales desea enseñarles del negocio y dejarles un legado.

Solicita un apoyo económico para comprar sillas, mesas y surtido de ingredientes en gran variedad, de esta forma podrá cumplir su sueño de ser independiente.

Con un préstamo podrás a poyar a un veterano lleno de vida y empuje para su familia.
texts.en:
Luis is a very enterprising and creative man, and for a long time he has wanted to be independent and have his own deli and restaurant business. 

At the moment, he can make his dream happen thanks to his great capacity for work and the support that he can get from people who want him to get ahead.  

His wife and 3 of his children, who he wants to teach the business and leave a legacy, will depend on this business.

He asks for economic support to buy chairs, tables, and a large variety of ingredients. In this way he will be able to realize his dream of being independent.

With a loan, you can support a veteran full of life and initiative for his family.

loans.use: to purchase chairs, tables and a variety of ingredients to open a restaurant.

loans.name: Jose Gildardo

texts.es:
Hace 5 meses inicio el sueño el señor José quien monto una panadería ubicado en el sector de Itagüí, se lanzó con pocos recursos produciendo poco pues no tiene la disponibilidad de un equipo óptimo para producir grandes cantidades y trabaja con lo poco que tiene pensando que tiene que ayudar financieramente a su hijo de 20 años que vive con su madre, y claro pagar sus respectivas deudas. 

Quiere solicitar un crédito para comprar una fritadora industrial para iniciar la venta de pollo, buñuelos, empanas que son muy consumidas en el sector pues lo tiene ubicado en una zona comercial donde es muy común el consumo de estos productos. 

El monto es considerable por la fritadora que tiene un precio de 750 dólares el resto del préstamo lo quiere invertir en surtido, harina, aceite, entre otros insumos que usa para hacer su panes como productos lácteos, frutas, etc. 

Es un hombre de 56 años de edad y espera operar este negocio pro un largo tiempo.
texts.en:
Five months ago, José began his dream, opening a bakery located in the sector of Itagüí.  He undertook it with limited resources, making a little because he didn't have at his disposal the best equipment to make large quantities and he works with the little he has, thinking that he has to financially support his 20-year-old son who lives with his mother and, of course, pay off his debts. 

He wants to ask for a loan to purchase an industrial fryer and supplies to begin selling chicken, buñuelos (fritters), and empanadas, that are eaten a lot in the area since it is located in a commercial zone where it is very common to eat these products. 

The amount for a fryer is considerable, which has a price of 750 dollars. The rest of the loan he wants to invest in an assortment of things such as flour, and oil, among other supplies, that he uses to make his breads such as dairy products, fruits, etc.

He is a 56-year-old man and hopes to run this business for a long time.

loans.use: to purchase an industrial fryer and supplies to begin selling breaded chicken, buñuelos (fritters), empanadas, and chicken pies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies for producing artisan ice-creams and selling them at a special event.

loans.name: Sabaly Group

texts.fr:
Sabaly est un regroupement de femmes de Hamdallaye qui se connaissent bien et qui  vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 31 anset ont au moins 2enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels que, fruit et légumes, Condiments  et divers. Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur troisième prêt de groupe.
Kadiatou est un membre du groupe Sabaly, arrêtée 3ème de droite à gauche, vendeuse de fruits et légumes et tubercules. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter de tubercules, fruit et légumes en qualité au fur et à mesure qu’elle vend en détail  à une clientèle diverse. Elle se procure au grand marché et à Sikasso. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Sabaly comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 160000CFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Mme Kadiatou compte réaliser  175 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnelles et augmenter son fonds de commerce. 
Elles souhaitent voir renforcer ce partenariat avec  Soro Yiriwaso pour que les stocks ne soient pas rares.
texts.en:
The Sabaly Group is made up of women from Hamdallaye, who know one another very well, and live in large, traditional families with their husbands, children and other relatives.  They are, on average, 31 years old and have at least two children.  The women sell fruit, vegetables and other food ingredients.

In order to expand their businesses, the group members work with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso.  This will be their third group loan.

Kadiatou (standing third from the right in the photo) sells fruit, vegetables and tubers.  She plans to use her loan to buy high quality tubers, fruit and vegetables, which she will then retail to various customers.  She buys her supplies from the large market in Sikasso.

The other members of the group expect to earn an average profit of 160,000 francs CFA over the loan period, but Kadiatou expects to earn 175,000 francs CFA.  The profits will be used to repay the loan, increase working capital and provide for personal expenses.

The women would like to continue working with Soro Yiriwaso to avoid running out of stock in the future.

loans.use: to buy fruit, vegetables and tubers for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers, plantain seeds and irrigation supplies.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.fr: MARIAM est âgée de 57 ans, mariée mère de 6 enfants et vit  avec son mari, sa coépouse et  leurs enfants  dans  la ville de Koutiala. Mme n’as pas eu la chance de faire des études,  raison pour laquelle elle s’est basée sur le commerce depuis à bas âge qu’elle apprit auprès de sa maman. Son activité est basé sur les produits saisonniers, actuellement  elle effectue l’achat vente de Tomate au grand marché de Koutiala. Elle trouve que cette activité est rentable et que ça marche bien en cette période. Pour augmenter son fonds de commerce afin d’élargir son activité, Mme  a fait recours  à l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso depuis 8 ans.   Elle a pris plusieurs prêts dans l’association (prêt solidaire) tous  remboursés correctement  et elle est à son 5ème  prêt individuel dont les précédents ont été bien remboursé. Avec ce financement, elle compte acheter  des paniers de tomate et des  sacs d’arachide pour les vendre en gros  et en détail au grand marché. Avec ce financement, elle compte sur un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA qu’elle envisage utiliser pour le  remboursement des d’intérêts de Soro Yiriwaso et contribuer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mariam is 57 years old, married and has six children.  She lives with her husband, his other wife and their children in the town of Koutiala.  Never having the opportunity to attend school, Mariam began working in retail, with her mother, at a young age.  She sells seasonal products.  At the moment, she is buying and selling tomatoes at the large market in Koutiala, and she is finding this business to be profitable.

In order to increase her working capital and expand her business, Kadiatou has been working with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso, for eight years.  She has had several individual loans which have all been fully and correctly repaid.  This will be her fifth loan, and she will use it to buy baskets of tomatoes and sacks of peanuts, which she will sell in bulk or retail, at the main market.

Mariam expects to earn a monthly profit of 100,000 francs CFA, which she will use to repay her loan to Soro Yiriwaso and contribute to the improvement of her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes and peanuts for resale.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
Jose es una persona muy colaboradora, tiene 25 años de edad, es soltero y vive en San Martin junto a su familia.
Tiene muchos deseos de superación, siempre apoya a su familia en lo que puede y desde muy joven ha aprendido sobre el rubro de la agricultura porque apoyaba a sus padres en las chacras.
Actualmente se dedica al cultivo de cacao y le va bien porque tiene muchos conocimientos, y siempre ofrece productos de excelente calidad.
Jose está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprar abono para sus cultivos, de esta manera su ingresos mejorarán porque ofrecerá mejores productos, así seguirá apoyando a su familia elevando su calidad de vida y continuará trabajando para sacarlos adelante.
texts.en:
José is a helpful person. He is 25 years old, single, and lives with his family in San Martín. José is eager to get ahead and helps his family as much as he can. When he was young, he learned to work in agriculture from his father, by helping him with his plantations. He is now growing cocoa and is good at it since he knows a lot and offers a product of excellent quality.

José appreciates the support that Kiva lenders have given him, since he will be able to buy fertilizers for his plantations. This will help him to increase his income since he will be able to offer a better product. He will be able to continue supporting his family and improving their living conditions. He will continue to work hard to help them to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his cocoa plantations.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
San Miguel de los Bancos un Cantón de clima cálido húmedo su gente es muy amable y trabajadora este Cantón cuenta con varios atractivos turísticos, en el mismo su gente es alegre y le gusta disfrutar de todas sus festividades organizando concierto y bailes populares en este Cantón vive y tiene su negocio el señor José un hombre luchador de 34 años es soltero no tiene hijos.
Se dedica al servicio de fotografía profesional, aprendió de este negocio cuando trabajaba en un estudio fotográfico, aprendió todo lo necesario y cuando ya se sintió preparado decidió iniciarse de forma independiente, a este negocio le dedica un promedio de 12 horas diarias, solicita el crédito para invertir en la compra de mercadería para el negocio.
El señor José agradece a Fundación Alternativa y a Kiva por el apoyo y la ayuda brindada.
texts.en:
San Miguel de los Bancos is a canton with a warm and humid weather. Its inhabitants are kind and hardworking people. This canton has numerous tourist attractions and locals are joyful people that like to enjoy the festivities and organize concerts and traditional dances exhibitions.

José, a hardworking man, lives and works in this canton. He is 34 years old, single and has no children. He works as a professional photographer. He learned this activity while working for a photographic studio. When he felt that he knew enough about this business and that he was ready, he decided to become independent. He works twelve hours every day, on average.

José is requesting a loan to buy supplies for his business. He wants to thank Fundación Alternativa and Kiva for the support and help they have given him.

loans.use: to buy materials and supplies for his business.

loans.name: Madres Laboriosas Group

texts.es: Este es el grupo “Madres Laboriosas” conformada por 08 socios responsables, ya que no han tenido problema con sus pagos. Guillermina de 56 años es soltera. Ella se dedica al alquiler de vehículo (auto) y así mismo se desempeña al cuidado de las personas de la 3ra edad.  Ella se siente feliz gracias a su esfuerzo a logrado mejorar su calidad de vida. El crédito que solicitó lo destinará para el mantenimiento de su vehículo ya que es su herramienta principal que le genera ingreso a su hogar. El deseo de Guillermina es de poner un negocio para venta de comida. La Alcancía Comunal “Madres Laboriosas” agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por el apoyo brindado. Guillermina se encuentra sentada es la tercera del lado izquierdo y viste casaca negra y polo morado.
texts.en: This is the “Madres Laboriosas” group. It is made up of 8 responsible members who have had no problems with their payments. Guillermina is 56 years old and single. She rents out her vehicle (a car) and she cares for elderly people. She is happy that thanks to her hard work she has been able to improve her quality of life. The loan she has asked for will be used for maintenance on her vehicle, since it is the main tool for generating income for her home. What  Guillermina wants to do is to open a business to sell food. The “Madres Laboriosas” communal bank thanks the Kiva investors for the support they have given. Guillermina is seated third from the left and is wearing a black jacket and a purple shirt.

loans.use: to do maintenance on her vehicle since it is her main tool for generating income for her home.

loans.name: Lenis Maria

texts.es:
Lenis es una mujer de campo y madre de 4 hijos por los que ha tenido que pasar por muchas adversidades en su vida, sin embargo siempre ha tenido la fortaleza para salir adelante y continuar progresando con su familia.
Desde hace tiempo ha querido montar un negocio de cría y venta de cerdos.

Es por eso que solicita un gran aliento económico para compras algunos cerdos para cría ya que tiene un corral alquilado para albergarlos allí.

Con este nuevo negocio podrá generar ingresos para su familia que es todo para ella y podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su esposo y sus hijos.

Trabajara todos los días para impulsar su negocio y hacerlo una actividad sostenible y rentable.

Apoya a una mujer trabajadora con un préstamo!
texts.en:
Lenis is a country woman and mother to 4 children, for whom she has had to face many adversities in her life. Nevertheless she has always had the strength to come out on top and continue improving with her family.

For a long time she has wanted to launch a business breeding and selling pigs. This is why she is requesting a big economic push, to buy pigs for breeding and she has already hired a pen to keep them.

This new business will allow her to generate income for her family, who mean everything to her, and improve the quality of life for her husband and children.

She will work everyday to propel her business and make it sustainable and profitable.

Support a hard-working woman with a loan!

loans.use: to buy pigs for breeding, allowing her to start a small business from home.

loans.name: Maira Alejandra

texts.es:
Maira es una bella y emprendedora mujer de 27 años de edad, madre de un hijo de 6 años, desde que era niña desarrollo una gran pasión y gusto por todo lo relacionado con la belleza  y desde que salió del colegio comenzó a realizar cursos en estética.

Inicio su etapa productiva en salones de belleza, hasta que un día se aventuró y decidió ir en busca de su propia clientela montando un negocio de salón de belleza en el municipio de Medellín 

Solicita un crédito para la compra de surtido de productos cosméticos pues también quiere vender productos para complementar sus servicios, como crema de manos, gel, productos capilares, tinturas para cabello, barnices.

El crédito para ella será muy importante pues terminara de consolidar su empresa completándola con todos los insumos necesarios para operar y ofrecer cualquier servicio que lleguen a solicitarle.

Su sueño es que su empresa progrese y tenga muchos clientes.
texts.en:
Maira is a beautiful and enterprising 27 year old woman. She is the mother of a 6 year old son. Since she was a child, she has developed a great passion and taste for everything related to beauty and when she finished high school she started to take beauty school courses.  

She began her productive phase in beauty salons, until one day took a risk and decided to seek out her own customers by opening a beauty salon business in the city of Medellín.  

She asked for a loan to buy a variety of cosmetics products because she wants to sell products to complement her services, such as hand cream, gel, hair products, hair dyes, and nail polish.  

The loan will be very important for her because she will finish consolidating her business, completing it with all of the necessary materials and offering her customers whatever service they ask of her. Her dream is for her business to progress and to have a lot of customers.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics such as creams and nail polish to display at her business and improve her income by offering a better service.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay off a debt acquired from a financial institution. She feels she is paying too much interest and has decided to pay it off in total.

loans.name: Maholis Del Socorro

texts.es:
Maholis es una mujer de 29 años de edad que junto un dinero ahorra e inicio un café internet en una zona donde el internet es un lujo pues no tiene los recursos para acceder a este. 

Trabaja con su hermana y gracias a la buena aceptación de sus clientes le ha permitido expandirse y tener ahora 4 computadores y una pequeña papelería de alguna u otra manera le apuesta a la educación.

También tiene una pequeña papelería y quiere potenciarla que haya un referente en su pueblo, el crédito lo quiere invertir en útiles estudiantiles, cuadernos, libros, lapiceros, lápices, reglas, pegantes etc. etc. etc. 

El monto es considerable pues quiere formar una gran papelería en el cual puedan comprar sus útiles a un bajo costo y que no tengan ninguna excusa para no estudiar.
texts.en:
Maholis ia a 29-year-old woman. She has saved some money and opened an internet café in an area where internet access is still a luxury and where most people do not have the means to access the internet.

She works with her sister, and thanks to the good acceptance of the café by her customers, she could expand the café and now has four computers and a small stationary shop, which, in some way or another, supports education.

She has this small stationary shop and wants to promote it and to make it a benchmark in the village. She wants to invest the loan in the purchase of school supplies, like notebooks, books, pens, pencils, rulers, glue, etc., etc., etc.

The amount is considerable because she wants to set up a big stationary shop where students can buy their school supplies at low cost, so that they do not have an excuse not study.

loans.use: to buy a complete inventory of school supplies, so that the people in the village cannot take money as an excuse not to send their children to school.

loans.name: Joan Moises

texts.es: Joan es Ing. Industrial, gracias al gran esfuerzo de sus padres pudo culminar su carrera, ahora le retribuye a sus padres brindándoles su apoyo económico, trabaja como supervisor de ventas cargo que se ha ganado con mucho empeño, actualmente a sus 24 años de edad continua preparándose profesionalmente, estudia un postgrado en finanzas lo que le ayudara a reforzar su carrera para optar a un mejor puesto laboral, Joan requiere el apoyo de crédito para poder pagar el postgrado, siendo este estudio un gran desafío para su persona ya que obtener una especialidad es un poco costosa pero que vendrá a beneficiar su futuro.
texts.en: Joan is an industrial engineer who was able to finish his studies due to the great efforts of his parents.  Now he is repaying his parents by giving them economic support.  He works as a supervisor for transported goods, a post he has won through hard work.  Currently at 24 years of age he continues to grow professionally, studying in a postgraduate program in finance which will help him in his career in order to seek a better position.  Joan needs a loan in order to pay for his postgraduate studies, since the program is a great challenge for him since obtaining the specialization is expensive, but he knows it will benefit him in the future.

loans.use: To pay for postgraduate training in finance.

loans.name: Rosa María

texts.es:
Rosa estudió hasta sexto grado de educación básica, tiene 43 años de edad, es madre soltera de 3 hijos pero solo dos viven con ella.


Rosa es empleada doméstica en una casa donde ya tiene 12 años de trabajar, decidió dedicarse a este  trabajo porque no encontró otra forma  de ayudar a su familia, anteriormente ella era comerciante de frutas y verduras. 
El lugar donde ahora trabaja está a 120 kilómetros de su casa y viaja en bus tres veces a la semana, su horario de trabajo es de 8 horas al día.


Ella necesita el préstamo para reparar parte de su casa que está dañada, comprará adobes, madera y tejas, con el préstamo se le estará ayudando a Rosa a tener un lugar más seguro para vivir. 

Sus sueños son seguir trabajando y poner una tienda ya que ha sido uno de sus propósitos desde hace muchos años.
texts.en:
Rosa had 6 years of primary education. She is 43 years old and single mother of three children, but only two of them live with her.

Rosa is a domestic worker. She has done this work for 12 years and decided to take it up because she could not find another way to help her family. Before that, she sold fruit and vegetables. The place where Rosa works is 120 kilometers from her home and she goes there by bus on three days per week. She works 8 hours per day.

She needs a loan to repair a part of her house which is damaged. She will buy adobe, wood, and tiles. The loan will help Rosa to have a safer place to live. It is her dream to continue her work and to open a store, because this has been her plan for many years.

loans.use: to repair a part of her house which is damaged and to buy adobe, wood, and tiles.

loans.name: Rita Guadalupe

texts.es:
Rita de 27 años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato, está casada y su esposo es albañil, tiene una hija que aún no va a la escuela porque está pequeña y es la única que depende de Rita.

Rita se dedica a los oficios domésticos, desde que salió de estudiar no ha podido encontrar un buen trabajo pero planea poner una granja  pollos para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos, también le ayuda a su madre a administrar una finca que su padre les dejó cuando emigró a otro país, la finca está a una distancia de 15 minutos, viaja en el carro y trabaja 5 horas diarias.


El préstamo solicitado a CrediCampo lo necesita para comprar 10 pliegos de lámina y madera para la construcción de una galera para tener los pollos, comprará 100 pollos de engorde y comprará 6 quintales de concentrado.

Ella sueña con que le vaya bien con el negocio de pollos, que crezcan sanos para vender bastante y si es posible espera distribuir pollos a las tiendas.
texts.en:
Rita is 27 years old, a high school graduate, married and her husband is a bricklayer. Rita has a daughter who has not started school as she is still young and is the only one who depends on Rita.

Rita is a housewife, since she finished school she has been unable to find a good job but she plans to start a poultry farm to help her husband with the expenses, she will also help her mother administer a plantation that her father left her when he emigrated to another country. The plantation is 15 minutes away, she travels by car and works 5 hours a day.

The loan application to CrediCampo is needed to buy 10 sheets of corrugated metal and timber for the construction of a chicken pen, Rita will also buy 100 chickens for fattening and 6 quintals of chicken feed. 

She dreams of having a successful chicken business, that the chickens grow healthy so that she can sell many and if possible, she hopes to distribute chickens to stores.

loans.use: to buy 10 sheets of corrugated metal and timber for the construction of a chicken pen, she will buy 100 chickens for fattening and 6 quintals of chicken feed.

loans.name: Isabel Cristina

texts.es:
Isabel es una madre de familia dedicada, tiene 33 años de edad, es casada y vive en Tarapoto junto a su familia.
Tiene un precioso niño de 3 años de edad quien es su mayor motivación en la vida para salir adelante y por quien lucha día a día para poder brindarle un futuro mejor.
Desde hace más de 1 año se dedica a trabaja en una empresa de Seguros como vendedora y le va muy bien porque siempre trabaja con ética, responsabilidad y es muy amable con los clientes.
Isabel está muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprar una computadora para que pueda avanzar los pendientes de su trabajo y así sus ingresos mejoren. De esta manera podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y más adelante con mucho esfuerzo podrá lograr comprarse una casa propia.
texts.en: Isabel is a devoted mother. She is 33 years old, married and lives in Tarapoto with her family. She has a beautiful 3 year old boy who is her biggest motivation to go ahead in life, and for whom she strives day by day to give a better future. For more than a year, she has been working in an insurance company as a salesperson, and she is doing very well because she is very ethical, responsible and very kind to her customers. Isabel is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because with their support she will be able to buy a computer so she can catch up with what she has pending in work, and therefore improve her income. This way she will be able to improve her family's quality of life, and later, with much effort, be able to buy her own house.

loans.use: to buy a computer for her work.

loans.name: Nigora

texts.en:
Nigora is a hardworking woman. She is not married. Nigora lives with her parents.

She is a student in her third course at Khujand State University. She studies at the faculty of foreign languages. Nigora is one of the best students. She also works in her university in a lab. Nigora is learning the English, German and Russian languages. Nigora dreams of being a translator in future. 

Nigora is asking for a loan of 500 USD to pay for tuition. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to pay for tuition.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
“Agriculture is the best employment, because nobody can sack you. You can start from any level and there are so many forms of farming you can do”, says James. He is a father of 3 and has been practicing mixed farming in Kahuhia, a remote village in the Thika area of Kenya. 

For the past four years he has been selling milk, eggs, tea and has some personal business he has been doing to supplement the meager income he earns. 

If there is one thing James is good at, it is raising farm animals! Meni, his dairy cow, is very well taken care of. She gets the best feed and medical care James can provide. 

However, his biggest challenge is raising capital. James has a sound investment plan that will push him to the next level. James is seeking a loan through Kiva to purchase a water tank. Constant availability of water at his homestead will make work very easy for him. His farm animals and poultry will have a constant flow of drinking water, his family will have water for domestic use at the doorstep, and the crops on the farm will grow green and healthy through irrigation. James wants to harvest rain water that always goes to waste and store it in the water tank for future use. With your contribution, James will seek to increase the number of animals on his farm because his animals will no longer have the challenge of no drinking water. 

This loan will improve his living conditions and he will secure the future of his children.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Valentine

texts.en:
Valentine is 37 years old. She is married with 3 children aged between 1 and 8. Two of them go to school. She has been farming for 6 years. 

With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy more fertilizer for rice. 

The profit from the business will be used to pay the school fees of her children.


The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer for rice.

loans.name: Angel  Roberto

texts.es: Don Ángel, tiene 60 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposa, reside en una aldea del municipio de Taulabe, junto a su esposa y un hijo. Siempre se a dedicado a la agricultura, cultivando hortalizas y hace 3 años decidió cultivar café. El café que produce lo vende en pergamino a los intermediarios de la zona. Don Ángel lleva 10 prestamos con los cuales a mantenido estable sus cultivos. El monto actual de su préstamo es de 7,000 lempiras para comprar abonos y para limpieza de la finca y comprar una maquina despulpadora de café. El espera mejorar el cultivo y la producción del café mediante la inversión. Su plan a futuro es cultivar 2 manzanas de café y mejorar la finca existente.
texts.en:
Ángel is 60 years old. He lives in a common-law marriage with his wife. He lives in a village in the municipality of Taulabe with his wife and one son. He has always worked in agriculture and planted vegetables, and three years ago he decided to grow coffee. He sells his coffee beans still in their parchment skins to intermediaries in the area. 

Ángel has taken out ten loans which he used to keep his plantation in good health. The amount he asks for now is 7,000 lempiras to buy manure, to clean his land, and to buy a coffee pulping machine. He hopes to improve his crop and his coffee production with this investment. His plan for the future is to cultivate two fields of coffee and by this to improve his existing plantation.

loans.use: to buy manure, to clean his land, and to buy a coffee pulping machine.

loans.name: Roberto Giovanni

texts.es:
Roberto de 35 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado de educación básica; esta acompañado, su pareja se dedica a los oficios basicos, son padres de dos hijos de los cuales solo uno estudia.

 Roberto  trabaja de albañil por mas de quince años, lo aprendio de sus patrones en ese entonces decidio emprender este trabajo para tener la oportunidad de generar un poco mas de ingreso economico al hogar, tambien se dedica a la crianza de aves de corral, antes solo era jornalero, él se transporta en bicicleta, con la crianza de animales se involucra su compañera de vida, el horario como albañil es de 7:00am a 4:00 pm.

Roberto necesita el crédito, para comprar materiales electricos para introducion de energia en su casa, con el prestamo le mejorara su calidad de vida ya que podra tener mejores condiciones en su casa, ya que no contaba con el servicio de energia electrica. La necesidad satisfecha sera la de tener los servicios básicos para su familia.

Sus sueños son seguir trabajando para ir mejorando poco a poco las condiciones de vida y poder ampliar el negocio de aves de corral, construir una habitación a sus hijos, brindarles el estudio y que se preparen academicamente.
texts.en:
Roberto is 35 years old. He has completed 3 years of primary education. He has a partner who takes care of the household, and they have two children, but only one of their children goes to school.

Roberto has worked as a bricklayer for more than 15 years. He learnt this trade from his parents and then decided to take up this work in order to earn a bit more money for his household. He also raises poultry. Before, he was only a day laborer. He goes to work by bike. His partner helps him with raising poultry, and his schedule as a bricklayer is from 7:00 a. m. to 4:00 p. m.

Roberto needs a loan to buy materials to provide his house with electricity. Thus, the loan will improve his quality of life and he will also have better living conditions in his house, because at the moment they do not have electricity. He wants to fulfill his need to provide the basic services for his family.

It is his dream to continue working and to improve his living conditions bit by bit. Also, he wants to increase his poultry business and to build a room for his children, to provide his children with an education, and that they can study a profession.

loans.use: to buy materials to provide his house with electricity.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is 44 years old, married, and has four children living in Kasese, Uganda. 

He operates a retail shop selling rice, sugar, and soap among other items. He began the business in order to look after his family.

Isaac is a hardworking person looking forward to expanding his business, although he is faced with the challenges of competition and debtors. He wants a loan to buy salt, rice, sugar, soap and other general merchandise to sell.

loans.use: to buy salt, rice, sugar, soap and general merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Nazem

texts.en:
Nazem is 21 years old and single. He is the sole earner of his family. Due to the low financial situation of his family and in order to cover the needs and expenses of his family that consists of three, a year ago he chose to work in a trading and construction company while continuing his studies at a vocational school. 

Nazem is a hard worker, full of ambitions. He wants to open his own coffee shop to increase his income and requested a youth loan from Al Majmoua, which he will use to buy a well designed signboard, hookahs, and molasses and charcoal. He also wants to purchase a motorcycle, which he will use to provide delivery services. With this loan, Nazem can become independent and increase his income to cover his family’s needs and his school fees.

loans.use: to start a hookah cafe

loans.name: Zawlbuk Group

texts.en:
Lalnunmawi, with hand raised, is the featured borrower of the group. At present, she lives with her youngest son, whose occupation is auto-rickshaw driver. Her husband left them a long time back since he was suffering from serious illness and could not be cured. Sadly, after he passed away, one of her sons also left her due to serious illness. So she lived with the remaining three sons and her mother-in-law. 

She is a strong woman who survived through hard times in life and still has the willingness to move on and make the best of life. Two among the three sons now live separately with their own families and the youngest one stays with her. 

Weaving hand bags is her main occupation to generate income, and that little amount is used for household expenses. She weaves different designs and patterns of traditional bags for selling in the market. She supplies the end products to the market and earns a little profit from those supplies. Those bags are popularly used by school- and college-going youngsters. 

Presently, she will be expanding her production by weaving more bags of different models, and therefore she is in need of capital to buy yarn with different textures and other needed materials. Fortunately, she availed a loan from WSDS and could buy the desired yarn and achieve her desire. 

She is very thankful to Kiva for helping her family to achieve her dream of expanding her weaving production. She believes that the loan will improve her production and her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy yarn and more materials used in weaving traditional bags.

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en:
Shabana is a hard working woman. She sells cattle, which she has been doing for two years. She purchases cattle from the city market at lower rates and sells it in her locality. The income is used to support her entire family. 

Shabana requested a loan for 45,000 PKR, which she will use to buy more cattle for resale purposes, so she can generate a healthier source of income. She hopes to enlarge her home in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is 41 years old and married. She operates a beauty parlor, which she has been doing for eight years. She offers many facilities to her customers such as makeup, hair styling, and facials. She is a well known beautician and hair stylist in her town. 

In order to meet with the increasing demands of her customers, Nasreen is interested in buying a variety of products for the beauty parlor. She requested a loan for 45,000 PKR, which she will use to buy makeup items, hair care products, hair styling products, skin products, etc. in large quantities. She expects to earn more income and wishes to expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase makeup items, hair care products, hair styling products, skin products, etc.

loans.name: Daphrose

texts.en:
Daphrose, age 51 years, is married and has three children between 20 and 28. All of them go to school. 

She has been farming for seven years. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy more fertilizers of rice. The profit from the business will be used to improve her welfare.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers.

loans.name: Gorretti

texts.en:
Gorretti is a 40-year-old woman with one child living in Fort Portal, Uganda. 

She has been running a drug shop but also has a motorcycle transport business. With the proceeds, she has been able to pay school fees for her child and renovate her house despite limited capital. 

Her goal is to have a well-stocked pharmacy and also set up a clinic. Gorretti intends to use the loan to buy medicinal drugs to sell.

loans.use: to buy more pharmaceutical drugs to sell.

loans.name: Zarina

texts.en:
Zarina is 44 years old and has four children. For the last 10 years, she has been providing the service of stitching in her locality. She is quite popular for her skill of stitching. Over the years, she has established a good clientele. However, due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet with the daily demands of her customers. 

Zarina requested her seventh loan for 50,000 PKR, which she will to use to buy more spools of thread, laces, and buttons. She wishes to spend part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase spools of thread, laces, and buttons.

loans.name: Sakeena

texts.en: Forty-seven-year-old Sakeena is a married woman and a mother of four children. The only source of earning in her family is from the rickshaw that her husband, also shown in the picture, drives. This rickshaw helps him provide transportation service to passengers in their city. Sakeena has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. She is in her 6th loan cycle and has shown very good repayment behavior. This loan amount will help her husband to bear the maintenance costs and change the tires of the rickshaw. She hopes for a boost in her husband’s income in the future.

loans.use: to cover the maintenance costs and change the tires of their rickshaw

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is 48 years old. She has been stitching clothes for the last 15 years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers.

Yasmeen requested her fifth loan from Kashf foundation for 40,000 PKR, which she will use to buy more spools of threads in different colors, packs of laces, zippers, and buttons. With the loan, she hopes to create a means of increasing revenues so she can generate a healthier source of income.

loans.use: to purchase spools of threads in different colors, packs of laces, zippers, and buttons

loans.name: Peace Group

texts.en:
The Peace Group is made up of three enterprising women, dedicated to working for their families’ well being. They are selling electrical gadgets, food and rubber polythene bags. 

Irene is the group representative. She is the mother of one child, who has been her inspiration for her success. She sells electrical gadgets and started this business five years ago with the help of a loan she got from her mother. Since then, she has maintained her business. She is asking for a loan to buy cables, bulbs, fuse holder, etc. to sell to customers. One of her goals is to maintain her business. 

Gladys is another one of the members. She is 53 years old, and she has been selling food (yam, cassava, rice, etc.). Rebecca is 53 years old and sells rubber polythene bags.

loans.use: To buy cables, bulbs, fuse holder, etc. to sell to customers.

loans.name: Rashida

texts.en:
At 59 years of age, Rashida is running a small general store very close to her house. She has been handling this store for many years with the assistance of her husband, who is also shown in the photo. Their shop is situated in the middle of the town and a sufficiently large number of customers visit it every day. She is doing quite well and has a number of repeat customers. 

She is in her seventh loan cycle and has successfully returned her previous loans on time. Now, she has requested a loan amount of 50,000 PKR with which she intends to purchase stock of soaps, shampoos, hair oils, toothpastes, edibles, etc. She dreams of expanding her business and improving her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase stock of soaps, shampoos, hair oils, toothpastes, edibles etc.

loans.name: Ndunda

texts.en:
Ndunda is a 34-year-old man, married to Alice, who adds additional income to support their family welfare. They are blessed with three children.  

Ndunda has been operating a garage business for a period of ten years, earning an income of KES 20,000 at the end of every month.

Ndunda was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a credit officer and is now servicing his first loan of KES 30,000. He intends to use this amount to purchase a welding machine, which he quite needs for his garage.

Ndunda plans to use the anticipated income to buy his own plot and build a permanent house for his family. He hopes to become a successful businessman.

loans.use: To buy a welding machine.

loans.name: Gabriela Milagro

texts.es:
Analizar a las personas para saber cuáles son sus problemas y al mismo tiempo brindarles ayuda, siempre han sido uno de los objetivos principales para Gabriela, razón por la que decidió estudiar Psicología. Tiene 31 años, está casada y no tiene hijos. Es una mujer dinámica, inteligente y emprendedora, cursa segundo año de Psicología en modo sabatino. Esta es la segunda carrera que cursa, la primera fue contabilidad. Para ella cada día es una oportunidad para seguir adquiriendo nuevo conocimientos. Su mayor apoyo lo han sido sus padres y su esposo. Su padre, un excelente contador la motiva siempre a cumplir sus sueños.
En la actualidad la tecnología es un factor importante en el mundo académico, es por eso que Gabriela solicita un crédito para la compra de una computadora portátil. Le será de mucha ayuda puesto que podrá realizar las investigaciones en cuanto a su carrera y al mismo tiempo logrará enviar en tiempo y forma los trabajos asignados por las diferentes asignaturas. Uno de sus sueños es culminar su carrera con éxito, de manera que pueda conseguir buenas ofertas de trabajos y así progresar en la vida. Una de sus metas es instalar un consultorio, expresa que luchará hasta lograrlo.
texts.en:
One of Gabriela's main goals has always been to analyze people, know what their problems are, and provide assistance, and this is why she decided to study Psychology. She is 31 years old, married with no children. 

She is a dynamic, intelligent, enterprising woman who is studying her second year of Psychology through Saturday courses. This is her second major, the first was Accounting. For her, every day brings an opportunity to continue acquiring new knowledge. Her main support has come from her parents and husband. Her father, an excellent accountant, motivates her to pursue her dreams. 

Nowadays, technology has a major place in the academic world, and this is why Gabriela is asking for a loan to buy a laptop. It will be of great help to her in carrying out research and submitting assignments properly and on time for the different subjects. 

One of her dreams is to successfully complete her studies, so that she may get good job offers and thus progress in life. One of her objectives is to set up a practice and she will keep striving, she says, to attain it.

loans.use: to buy a laptop.

loans.name: Jean Marie Vianney

texts.en:
