Jean Marie Vianney is 34 years old. He is married and has one child. He has been farming for seven years. 

With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy more fertilizers for rice. The profit from the business will be used to buy land for farming.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers of rice.

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa, age 37 years, is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past two years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Ana Marcela

texts.es:
Desde los 18 años de edad La joven Ana mostro gran interés por el comercio y fue en un almacén de ropa donde desarrollo todas sus facultades de vendedora. 
Mirando que tenía muy buen trato de cliente y convencimiento para vender decidió iniciar su venta de ropa ambulante donde comercializa a amigos, familiares, vecinos y en su motocicleta de desplaza a otros lugares fuera de su corregimiento a vender.

Su mayor dificultad siempre es combinar  el trabajo de vendedora con madre de familia y esposa, hoy por hoy tiene 25 años de edad y un hijo de 5 años y su meta es seguir proyectándose vender siempre innovador nunca quedarse estancada y evolucionar rápidamente.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa tanto de hombre como de dama como niño y niña. Comprando conjuntos deportivos, pijamas, camisas, camisetas, blusas, jeans, abrigos y quiere iniciar con la ropa de bebe.

Esta mujer es muy inquieta quiere meterse en todo es importante apoyarla por su proyección sus gana de trabajar, ímpetu que pone en todas sus actividades y pro que tiene un sueño y trabaja incasablemente pro  el cual es comprar su casa propia
texts.en:
Since 18 the young Ana showed great interest in commerce and, at a clothing store, developed her skills as a saleswoman. Seeing that she had great customer service and selling persuasion she decided to start her traveling, clothing sales business. She sells to friends, family members, neighbors and on her motorcycle she travels to places outside of her district to sell.
Her biggest difficulty was always combining work as a saleswoman with her role as mother of a family and wife. She is now 25 years old and had a child who is 5 years old.
Her goal is to continue presenting herself selling creatively, never becoming stagnant and evolving rapidly.
She is requesting a loan for the purchase of clothing for both men and women as well as boys and girls. She will purchase sportswear, pajamas, shirts, t-shirts, blouses, jeans, outerwear and wants to start selling baby's clothes. 
This woman is dynamic and wants to get involved in everything, it is important to help her due to how she presents herself and her will to work. She puts this vigor into all her activities because she has a dream and works tirelessly for it which is to purchase her own home.

loans.use: purchase an assortment including sportswear, pajamas, shirts, t-shirts, blouses, jeans, outerwear and wants to add baby clothes. She is gathering money for her own home.

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Safia works hard to support her family. She is 50 years of age and married. She has 5 children. 

She assists her husband in running a general store at their house. They have been running this store for the past 5 years. Most of their income is spent on the well-being of their children. 

She is in her 5th loan cycle. She has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. This loan will be used to purchase soaps, shampoo and edible items like buns, tea, packed milk etc. 

She wants to earn more income by expanding the business. She will spend it on providing a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to purchase soaps, shampoo and edible items like buns, tea, packed milk etc.

loans.name: Ahlam Group

texts.en:
Ensaf is the featured borrower for the Ahlam Group. She got together with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua youth loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and living at the same time.

Ensaf is a 28-year-old Jordanian citizen and a married mother of two children. Her husband has a limited salary that is not enough to cover the expenses and needs of his family; thus, she decided two years ago to start working in selling women's accessories from her house to help her husband. 

Today, Ensaf wants to open her own women's accessories shop in an attempt to increase the income of her family and provide her two kids with suitable social and financial living conditions; that’s why she acquired the current youth loan.

Ensaf is the lady covering her hair with a veil at the far left side of the photo. As for the other group members, Wafaa, the second one, is 22 years old, and Amani, the first from the right, is 26 years old.

loans.use: To open her own women's accessories shop

loans.name: Dzhiparkul

texts.ru: Джипаргул, 49 лет, замужем, есть 1 сын, который с радостью помогает по хозяйству. У Джипаргул среднее образование и большой трудовой бухгалтерский стаж. В 1993 году Джипаргул стала заниматься животноводством и полеводством, накопив на старт сумму в 20,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Джипаргул на сегодняшний день у нее есть 2 коровы, 2 лошади и 16 овец. Ежедневно Джипаргул продает до 12 литров молока, у нее есть мини птицефабрика, с весны Джипаргул выращивает цыплят и перепродает их, на данный момент на продажу есть 158 цыплят. На земельном участке мерою 4,20 ГА Джипаргул выращивает картофель и эспарцет, реализуя картофель на местном рынке, а сено заготавливая на зиму для скота. Также на приусадебном участке Джипаргул выращивает груши, яблони и смородину. Всю экологически чистую, вкусную продукцию она реализует на местном рынке или оптовым покупателям. Джипаргул обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку строительных материалов для постройки сарая для скота. Она уже залила фундамент для будущей постройки, и купила кирпичи, но не хватает средств на приобретение шифера и балок. Кредит поможет Джипаргул построить сарай без снижения поголовья скота. Также в будущем Джипаргул планирует расширить ее бизнес и накопить средства на свадьбу дочери.
texts.en:
Dzhiparkul is 49 and married with one son who helps happily around the house. She has a high school education and a large amount of work experience in accounting. In 1993 she started working in animal husbandry and agriculture, a business she began with 20,000 KGS. Thanks to her hard work she now has two cows, two horses and 16 sheep, and sells up to 12 litres of milk every day. She has a little poultry farm where she raises chickens and sells them; she currently has 158 chickens. On a 4.2 hectare piece of land she grows potatoes, which she sells at the local market, and hay, which she keeps to feed her livestock in the winter. In addition, she grows organic and flavourful pears, apples and currants, which she sells at the local market or to wholesale buyers.

Dzhiparkul has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 30,000 KGS to buy building supplies so she can build a barn for her livestock. She has already laid the foundation for the future building and bought bricks, but she doesn't have enough for slate and beams. The loan will help her to build a barn without having to sell any livestock. In the future she also plans to expand her business and save toward her daughter's wedding.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to build a new barn for her livestock

loans.name: Altynbubu

texts.ru: Алтынбюбю 63 года, вдова, мать 4 детей. В 1987 году, начала бизнес по разведению скота, закупив 5 овец. Алтынбюбю пенсионер, на сегодняшний день у нее в хозяйстве есть 6 овец. Совокупный среднемесячный доход в том числе от пенсии составляет 7,000 сом (KGS). Этих средств катастрофически не хватает на жизнь. Старшие дети работают, но у них у всех есть свои семьи, а младший - живет с матерью и помогает по хозяйству. Алтынбюбю обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец. Доходы от кредита позволят Алтынбюбю улучшить ее благосостояние, развить бизнес и отремонтировать дом.
texts.en: Altynbubu is 63 and a widow with four children. In 1987 she started a business raising livestock with the purchase of five sheep. She is on a pension and now has six sheep, with a total monthly average income of 7,000 KGS, which isn't close to enough to cover the cost of living. Her older children work, but they have their own families, and the younger live with their mother and help around the house. Altynbubu has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 20,000 KGS to buy sheep. Profits from the loan will allow her to improve her living conditions, develop her business and renovate her home.

loans.use: to purchase additional sheep in order to increase her family's income

loans.name: Ghazala

texts.en:
Ghazala, a 33-year-old woman, is a mother of three children. About six years ago, she started a business of cloth trade. Over the years, her business has flourished. Today, she has a strong customer base and is famous around her locality for good quality cloth. 

In her seventh loan cycle, Ghazala has requested a loan amount of 40,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees). With this loan amount, she wants to purchase more stock of cloth in different varieties and colors. She is thankful to Kashf Foundation for its help, which enabled her to have her own business today.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of cloth in different varieties and colors.

loans.name: Edgar De Jesus

texts.es:
El señor Edgar un hombre luchador de 53 años es casado de esta larga y hermosa relación tienen 3 hijos el mayor tiene 27 años y la última tiene 14 años, la esposa no trabaja ella le ayuda en el negocio, de sus 3 hijos solo la última depende y vive con ellos, el se dedica al servicio de transporte de leche cruda, aprendió de esta actividad por iniciativa propia ala este negocio le dedica un promedio de 4 horas diarias. 
Él vive y tiene el negocio en el Recinto Ganadero Orense el mismo que esta ubicado en el Cantón los Bancos un lugar hermoso y tranquilo de clima cálido húmedo al que muchos turistas nacionales y extranjeros les gusta ir a pasar vacaciones o feriados disfrutando de sus maravillosas cascadas y hosterías. 
Solicita el crédito para invertir en el negocio, comprará llantas para el camión en el que realiza la recolección, con esta inversión mejorará y tendrá mayor seguridad al realizar su trabajo diario, el señor Edgar agradece a Fundación Alternativa y a Kiva por el apoyo y las oportunidades brindadas.
texts.en:
Mr. Edgar a hard working 53 year old man, he is marred and this long, beautiful relationship has resulted in three children, the oldest is 27 years old and the youngest is 14. The wife does not work, but helps him with the business. Of their children, only the youngest depends and lives with them. 
He makes a living transporting raw milk, a trade he learned through his own initiative. He spends about four hours a day on this business. 
He lives and has his business in the ranching precinct of Orense, located in the corner of Los Bancos. A beautiful and calm place with humid weather where many national and foreign tourists like to go to pass their vacations and holidays enjoying its marvelous waterfalls and inns. 
He is requesting a loan to invest in the business, he will purchase tires for the truck which he uses to perform his collection. With this investment he will improve and have better security while performing his daily job. 
Mr. Edgar thanks Fundacion Alternativa and Kiva for the support and the opportunities afforded.

loans.use: purchase tires for the truck he uses to perform his collection.

loans.name: Surya

texts.en:
Surya is 46-year-old married woman who has been running a business of milk selling for many years. She sells the milk in her neighborhood. Her business is doing well enough to give her a decent life. She has four children. She is very motivated to provide them with good education, food and clothing. 

It’s her fourth year with Kashf Foundation. Now, she has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees) to purchase another buffalo. She is hopeful that her business will expand with the help of this loan, and she will be able to fulfill her dream of providing higher living standards to her children.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en: Sakina is a 44-year-old married mother of 5 children. She has been running a small general store for the past four years. Over time, the customer base of her store has greatly increased. With the help of income from this store, Sakina has been able to provide her family with good quality food and clothing. She is in her 4th loan cycle with Kashf Foundation and has a good repayment history. She has now requested a loan of 40000 PKR. With this loan, she wants to buy oil, spices, tea, jams, packed juices and other items to meet the increasing demand in her store. She has high hopes of increasing her income, which she wants to spend on the health of her children.

loans.use: to buy oil, spices, tea, jams, packed juices and other items to sell.

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en: Kousar is a 50-year-old married woman. She has 3 children. Kousar is a very dedicated mother. She started providing tailoring services to her community a few years ago, with the aim of providing a better living standard of living to her children. She is known for her good quality sewing skills around her locality. Her main customers are her neighbors and the people living nearby. In her 4th loan cycle, she has requested a loan amount of 45,000 PKR to purchase more reels of threads and packs of buttons, zippers and laces in various colors. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good life to her children through all her hard work.

loans.use: to purchase more reels of thread and packs of buttons, zippers and laces in various colors.

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.ru: Эту опытную швею зовут Насиба, ей 30 лет. Она в таком молодом возрасте уже имеет пятерых детей. У нее четверо сыновей в возрасте 13, 12, 6 и 1 года, и 10-летняя дочь. Трое старших детей учатся в школе, а двое еще маленькие. Муж Насибы работает мастером сточных труб. Он умелый в своем деле. Насиба имеет свой бизнес. Она на протяжении 8 лет занимается швейным делом. Она шьет красивые женские таджикские платья и делает на них вышивку. Она научилась этому делу у своей матери. Насиба просит кредит, чтобы купить необходимые ткани для шитья. Благодаря кредиту она сможет продолжить свое дело. Этот кредит ей важен.
texts.en: This experienced seamstress is called Nasiba. She is 30 and at such a young age already has five children, four sons aged 13, 12, 6 and 1 and a 10-year-old daughter. The three older children are in school and the other two are not yet old enough. Nasiba's husband works as a plumber. He is very good at his job. Nasiba has her own business; she has been earning a living sewing for eight years. She sews beautiful women's dresses in the Tajik style and embroiders them, a skill she learned from her mother. Nasiba is requesting a loan to buy necessary fabric for sewing. Thanks to this loan she will be able to continue her business. This loan is important to her.

loans.use: to buy the fabric she needs for sewing

loans.name: Mahrambi

texts.ru:
Жительнице района Вахш - Махрамби 33 года. Она работает преподавателем в образовательном учреждении. Ее муж фермер. У них двое детей. Дочери 10 лет, а сыну 5 лет.
Махрамби возле дома имеет новопостроенное помещение. Она хочет использовать его в качестве продуктового магазина. Ее начальный капитал составляет около 300 долларов. Махрамби в кредит берет еще 1000 долларов США. На эти суммы она собирается привезти качественные продукты питания и начать торговлю. Начав новый бизнес, Махрамби принесет в семью дополнительный источник дохода и таким образом улучшится их экономическое положение.
texts.en:
Mahrambi is 33 and a resident of the Vakhsh region. She works as a teacher in an educational institution. Her husband is a farmer and they have two children, a 10-year-old daughter and a five-year-old son.

Mahrambi has a new building next to her house. She wants to use it as a grocery store. Her starting capital is about $300 USD. She wants to borrow another $1,000 USD to purchase inventory and start sales. With the new business she will bring an additional source of income to her family and improve their financial situation.

loans.use: to buy food products to open a grocery store

loans.name: Kelly Goselyn

texts.es:
Kelly es una joven emprendedora, tiene 22 años de edad, es soltera y vive en Tate junto a su familia. Es madre soltera de un maravilloso niño de 3 años de edad, ella quiere darle todo lo mejor del mundo para que pueda vivir con todas las comodidades que su pequeño se merece. Con mucho esfuerzo y con ayuda de sus padres que la apoyan de manera incondicional está estudiando la carrera de Enfermería, porque tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante, y para poder cubrir algunos gastos trabaja como Obrera en los campos agrícolas. Es una persona muy responsable, trabajadora, honesta y entusiasta.
Kelly está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá pagar la matrícula del Instituto y comprar algunos materiales para hacer sus prácticas, de esta manera mejorará su desempeño en sus estudios y seguirá esforzándose para convertirse en una gran profesional y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Kelly, age 22, is a young entrepreneur.  She is single and lives with her family in Tate.  She is the single mother of a marvelous three year old.  She wants to give him all the best of the world so that he is able to live with all of the comforts that the little one deserves.  

With great effort, and with unconditional support from her parents, she is studying nursing.  She does this because she has a great desire to get ahead.  In order to be able to cover some expenses, she works as a worker in the agricultural fields.  She is a very responsible, hard-working, honest, and enthusiastic person.

Kelly is grateful to the Kiva lenders.  With the support they have provided, she will be able to pay the registration fee for the institution.  She will also buy some materials for her internship.  This way she will improve her educational performance, and she will continue putting forth great effort into becoming a great professional.  She will also improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to pay her registration fee and to buy materials for her nursing studies.

loans.name: Benkady Group

texts.fr:
Benkady est un regroupement de femmes de Hamdallaye qui se connaissent bien et qui  vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 38 ans et ont au moins 4enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels que, d’Habillement, Produits cosmétiques et divers. Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur troisième prêt de groupe.
Djenebou est un membre du groupe Benkady, 2ème personne debout de gauche à droite, vendeuse de Pagnes. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter de pièces de pagnes en qualité qu’elle vend en détail  à une clientèle diverse. Elle se procure au grand marché. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Benkady comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 156.000CFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Mme Djenebou compte réaliser  185 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnelles et augmenter son fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
Benkady is a group of women from Hamdallaye who know each other well and who live in large traditional families with their husbands, their children and other relatives. On average they are 38 years old with four children.
This group of women sells various articles such as clothing, cosmetics and other products. To expand their activities, the members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution. This is their third group loan.
Djenebou is a member of the Benkady group. She is the second person from the left standing in the photo and sells traditional pagne dresses. She plans to use her loan to buy quality textiles that she will sell retail to a diverse clientele. She buys her stock at the big market.
While the other members of the Benkady group, hope to make an average monthly profit of 156.000CFA each during this rotation, Mrs. Djenebou plans to make 185 000FCFA. 
In addition to reimbursing the loans, she will use some of the revenue to cope with her personal expenses and to increase her business assets

loans.use: To buy traditional pagne dresses.

loans.name: Ghazala

texts.en:
Ghazala is a 30-year-old married woman. She has four children. She is very skilled in the art of hand embroidery and has been using this skill for the last seven years to earn a living. She can make beautiful designs and patterns with her hand. Her skill is known throughout the town. 

She is in her sixth loan cycle and has requested a loan amount of 50,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees). This loan will enable her to purchase more beads, threads, frames and needles, etc. This monetary help can take Ghazala closer to her dream of providing a quality education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase more beads, threads, frames and needles, etc.

loans.name: Karambi Tutungukye Group

texts.en:
Josephine is a 45 year old single lady who lost her husband in 2008. She has five children and also takes care of her 2 two grand-children.

Josephine runs a small retail shop that sells daily household use items. She has applied for a loan through the group to help her add more stocks of flour, sugar, salt, soap, and tomatoes, among other items, in her business. She will use the rest of the money to pay school fees for her grand-children.


She thanks UGAFODE and Kiva lenders for the financial support. 

The sixth person on the extreme left is a group member who is saving but is not taking a loan this cycle - he has signed the client waiver though.

loans.use: to buy retail items for sale.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is a 31 year old man. He is married with 2 children aged 5 and 3 of which 1 attends school. 

He has a retail shop but faces the challenge of limited capital; however he hopes to expand the business to hardware. He needs a loan to add stock to the business.

loans.use: to add stock of mattresses, cement, iron sheets and phones for sale.

loans.name: Azra

texts.en:
Azra, is a 32-year-old married woman. She has 3 children. 

For the past 2 years, she has been running a business of cattle sale and purchase, along with her husband. She looks after the cattle and is responsible for feeding them, while her husband sells them to different markets in the city. 

Their business is providing them with enough income to support their family. However, they need to earn much more to meet their everyday expenditures including food, health and clothing. In order to expand her earnings, Azra has requested a loan amount of 40,000 PKR to buy more cattle for resale purposes. 

She is hopeful that expanding the business will help in improving her family’s living standards.

loans.use: to buy more cattle.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 21,000 through NWTF in order to buy a  new engine for her fishing boat.

Josephine successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. NWTF is re-listing Josephine's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy new engine for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Tasleem

texts.en:
Tasleem is a 50 year old married woman. She has 4 children. 

She has been running a milk selling business for many years. She has 5 calves and 2 cows for milking. She looks after the cattle, feeds them and performs the task of collecting milk from them. She earns enough income to meet the expenses of her family. 

In order to make more profits, she requested a loan of 40000 PKR to purchase another cow for milking. She is hopeful that another cow will help to increase her milk sales.  She is in her 7th loan cycle with a good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase another cow.

loans.name: Rached

texts.en:
Rached is a 20-year-old single young man. The sole breadwinner of his family which consists of three, he was forced to quit school during the intermediate level and started working in a cell phone shop to cover the expenses and needs of his beloved family.
Throughout the years he succeeded with his ambitions and persistence to save some profit from his limited salary and open his own cell phone business. Rached is a hard worker who always tries to improve his social and financial living conditions. 
Today, he is acquiring a YOUTH Loan from Kiva’s field, Al Majmoua, to expand his business by buying new fashionable phone accessories, prepaid mobile phone cards, and necessary spare parts.
This loan will help Rached prove himself, increase his income, and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: To expand his business by buying new fashionable phone accessories, prepaid mobile phone cards, and necessary spare parts

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is a 35-year-old woman married to Muli, who adds additional income to support their family welfare. They are blessed with five children.  

Jackline has been operating a charcoal sales business for a period of two years, earning an income of KES 8,000 at the end of every month.

Jackline was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a credit office and is now servicing her first loan of KES 10,000. She intends to buy some additional charcoal stock to add to the current stock, which is running out.

Jackline plans to use the anticipated income to open up a grocery stall as a secondary business, and she hopes to become a successful business woman.

loans.use: to buy additional charcoal stock to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Jessilyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Jessilyn works hard to support her family.  She has a fishing business in the Philippines. Jessilyn is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her fishing business.

Jessilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past twelve loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Deo

texts.en:
Deo is a 42-year-old married man with five children living in Fort Portal- Uganda.  He used his previous loan to pay school fees for his children. After realizing that farming alone could not meet the day-to-day needs of his family, he decided to venture into the motorcycle transport business. 

High fuel prices and a poor network of roads limit Deo's profits. His dreams are to educate his children to university and buy at least five motorcycles, which he intends to hire out to riders who will be remitting 80% of their daily earnings. 

Deo is requesting another loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay his children's school fees.

loans.name: Ritah

texts.en:
Ritah is a 27 year old lady married with 1 child aged 5 who attends school. 

She operates a retail shop dealing in ladies wear. She faces a problem of limited capital but hopes to expand the business.
She needs a loan to buy new clothes for sale.

loans.use: to buy new clothes for sale.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en: Samina is a 30 year-old married woman.  She is a mother of two children. In order to support her husband in taking care of the family, she began the business of milk selling. She is known in her town for providing good quality milk. She owns three buffaloes for milking purposes. She is happily supporting her family with the income generated. She is in her fourth loan cycle. She has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo. She is hopeful that increase in milk production will help her in generating more income.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to connect to Haiti's first solar hybrid smart electricity grid.

loans.name: Mwajuma

texts.en:
Mwajuma is a 50 year-old married woman who has six children, all of whom still attend school. She lives at a house that has neither electricity not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Mwajuma operates a fruits and vegetables stall.  She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of competition and seasonality in her business. 

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase sacks of fruits, of oranges, bananas and green vegetables for resale. She dreams of expanding and establishing a retail shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits, of oranges, bananas and green vegetables for resale

loans.name: Lor

texts.en:
Lor is a 40-year-old married mother of four children. Twenty years ago, she got a job to help her husband in covering their family’s living expenses and needs. Throughout these years, she has worked really hard to provide her children with a better life. She is well known among her neighbors and friends as a friendly and hardworking woman, who puts so much effort into providing her family with everything they might need.

A year ago, Lor decided, in addition to her job, to open her own small restaurant (since she has professional and very creative cooking skills) in an attempt to increase her income and improve her life. Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua to buy necessary cooking materials, goods, and other requirements for her restaurant to increase production, attract more customers, and provide them with a quick service.

This loan will help Lor achieve her dream and improve her social and financial conditions, as well as providing her beloved kids with a better future.

loans.use: To buy necessary cooking materials, goods, and other requirements for her restaurant.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 53-year-old man, married to Lucy, who adds additional income to support their family. They are blessed with three children. David has been operating a retail shop for a period of six years, earning an income of KES 15,000 at the end of every month.

David is now servicing his second loan of KES 20,000 with VisionFund Kenya and intends to use this amount to purchase more stock of soft drinks, sugar, detergents, milk, bread, wheat and maize flour, which are quite in demand at the moment.

David plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees for his children. He hopes to become a successful businessman with a bright future.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, sugar, detergents, cooking fat, milk, bread, wheat and maize flour to sell to his customers daily.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Mary, an ever-smiling young farmer from Kapsowar County in Kenya who has defied the common thinking of most Kenyans about agriculture.

She is a proud owner of a small parcel of land on which she has been practicing mixed farming for the past 5 years. Her primary sources of income are selling eggs and milk, and through this venture she has earned a decent income. She also engages in personal business in order to make ends meet. 

Mary passionately loves dairy farming, and taking care of her cows gives her great joy. She is an early riser and wakes up every day in the morning to go and milk her cow. Although this humble mum has been making profits by selling milk to her neighbors and the local market, she is faced with the challenge of meeting the demand. She is known for having the best quality milk. Through word of mouth, customers have been flocking to her farm for milk. 

Mary is seeking a loan to buy a quality dairy cow that will produce milk that is high in nutrients and will be able to satisfy the demand. Through the loan she will buy a dairy cow that will produce between 10 and 20 litres of milk a day. This will help fully satisfy the demand. Through Juhudi Kilimo, which is a field partner, she attended training sessions and was taught the best financial management skills. This will help her save more money to repay the loan fully and to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a quality dairy cow

loans.name: Alina

texts.en:
Alina appreciates the previous loan.

Alina operates a stall selling fruits and vegetables. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces the challenges of competition and seasonality in her business. 

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase sacks of fruits (including oranges and bananas) and green vegetables for resale. She dreams of expanding and establishing a retail shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits (including oranges and bananas) and green vegetables for resale

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 50 years old and married.  She has two children, both of whom are in school. Josephine works very hard to provide for them. Josephine runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Josephine has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods and other groceries.  In the future, Josephine would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Bint

texts.en:
Bint appreciates her previous loan that improved her living standards. Bint operates a fruits and vegetables stall.   She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of competition and seasonality in her business. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of fruits, of oranges, bananas and green vegetables for resale. She dreams of expanding and establishing a retail shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits, of oranges, bananas and green vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Aysel

texts.en:
Aysel is a married mother with three children. She makes women’s outerwear. After she got married, she did not work and raised her kids. Later on, she started to work in the accounting department of her husband’s workplace. She quit after facing problems with being at the same workplace as her husband. She did not work for one and a half years. She got really bored at home. She wanted to be busy and do something. She used to dream of having her own boutique. She remembered her dream and said, “Why not?” and started to work on that dream. First she rented a store and then borrowed money from a friend to buy materials. This way she opened her shop with limited resources, and has been working for one year. She constantly is trying to improve and do better for the business. With the loan she is planning to buy new clothes for the boutique.
Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Aysel hanım evli üç çocuk annesi.Kadın kıyafetleri satışı yapıyor.Aysel hanım evlendikden sonra çalışmıyor ve çocuklarını büyütüyor.  Daha sonra eşinin iş yerinde muhasebe de çalışmaya başlıyor.  Eşiyle aynı iş yerinde olmak aralarında sorunlara yol açınca Aysel hanım işi bırakıyor.  Bir buçuk sene çalışmıyor , evde çok sıkılıyor bir şeylerle uğraşmak ve çalışmak isteği hiç içinden kaybolmuyor.  Eskilerde hep butiği olmasını hayal  edermiş.  Bu hayali aklına geliyor ve neden olmasın diyerek işe koyuluyor.  Önce dükkan tutuyor sonra bir arkadaşından borç alarak İstanbul’dan mal alıyor.  Böylelikle ufak bir malzeme ile dükkanını açıyor,bir senedir de işinin başında.  Sürekli işini ilerletmek için yeniliklerin peşinde.  Aldığı kredi ile dükkanına elbise ve bluzlar alacak.

loans.use: to buy new clothes for the boutique

loans.name: Nurşen

texts.en:
Nurşen is a married mother with one child. She is selling women’s clothes. She worked in marketing for many years. She quit that job and stayed home for a while. She constantly talked with her husband about having an aim in life, and how much that would make her feel better to have a job to go each morning. Her husband rented a store, bought some cloth and prepared a boutique without letting her know. One morning he surprised her saying, “Come, I will take you somewhere.” He took her to the boutique and handed her the key to the store and told her this was new goal for her. Nurşen was very surprised and happy to open her store every morning. With the loan she will get she is planning to enrich her product variety.
Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Nurşen Hanım evli bir çocuk annesi.  Kadın kıyafetleri satışı yapıyor.Uzun yıllar pazarlamacılık yapıyor.  Sonra bu işi bırakıyor.  İşi bırakdıkdan sonra uzun yıllar çalışmıyor.  Evde oturmak da kendisini sıkıyor ve eşiyle  sürekli insanın bir amacı olmalı bu şekilde sıkılıyorum.  İşim olsa her gün güne  başlamak için amacım ,hevesim olacak diye sohbetlerde bulunuyor.  Eşi kendisinden habersiz bir dükkan tutuyor içine kıyafetler alarak bir butik dükkanı hazırlıyor.  Ve bir sabah seni bir yere götüreceğim benimle gelirmisin diyip dükkana kadar götürüyor ,anahtarı eline vererek bursı senin artık bir amacın var diyerek dükkanı kendisine teslim ediyor.  Nurşen Hanım hem çok şaşırıyor hem de çok seviniyor.  Üç aydır her sabah zevkle dükkanını açıyor.  Aldığı kredi ile ürün çeşidini arttıracak.

loans.use: to buy products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise such a sandals, snacks and beverages to sell.

loans.name: José Agapito

texts.es:
José de 61 años de edad, estudió hasta segundo grado por las tardes, ya que en las mañanas tenía que trabajar, está acompañado y con su pareja procreó 6 hijos de los cuales tres de ellos viven en los Estados Unidos.


José se dedica a la agricultura y los fines de semana realiza destazo de cerdos, esto lo aprendió gracias a sus padres y le ha servido para sostener a su familia, además los fines de semana vende golosinas, helados y bebidas a la afición que llega a ver partidos a la cancha, además de que posee una tienda en su casa negocio que nació por motivación propia.


Él necesita el crédito para  comprar una refrigeradora para guardar sus productos de carnicería, también invertirá en la ampliación de la tienda,  de esta forma podrá  vender más helados y ofrecer bebidas frías a sus clientes.

Las proyecciones que él tiene a futuro son tener un negocio más fuerte que le permita dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes y sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Jose is 61 years old, he studied until the second grade in the evenings as he had to work in the mornings. He lives with his partner and they have borne 6 children together, three of whom reside in the United States.

Jose works in agriculture and on the weekends butchers pigs. He learnt this thanks to his parents and it has helped to support his family. On weekends he also sells candy, ice-creams and beverages to the fans who go to watch matches at the local field. He also runs a store from his home, a business that was created through his own volition.

He needs a loan to buy a refrigerator to store his butchery products and to invest in the expansion of the store. This will permit him to sell more ice-creams and to offer cold beverages to his customers.

His plans for the future are to have a stronger business that allows him to offer a better service to his customers and to support his family.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator to store his butchery products and expand his store, allowing him to sell more ice-creams and be able to offer his customers cold beverages.

loans.name: Tecla

texts.en:
Hello lenders, the above picture presents Tecla, 36 years of age, a hardworking, honest, and dedicated farmer. She is based in Kapsowar. It is a remote town with harsh living conditions because of the bad terrain in the region. She is happily married and, together with her husband, has four lovely children. Her primary sources of income are milk and some personal business she engages in to make ends meet. Tecla is a tough woman with tough skin and she has managed to take care of her family with her income from milk selling.

The Kapsowar area has conditions that favor dairy farming and Tecla has always wanted to take care of another dairy cow but the lack of capital has prevented her. She is seeking a loan to buy an additional dairy cow. The dairy cow she intends to buy is not just an ordinary cow. It’s a breed that produces between 10-20 liters of milk a day. With this cow, she will produce more milk which will translate to more income. Demand for milk in the Kapsowar area is high but the supply is low. So, through this loan, Tecla is going to reap more and comfortably meet the demand.

Her increased income will allow Tecla to provide a secure future for her school-going children by paying their tuition fees. She believes that education is the gateway to success. Her vision is to keep even more dairy cows so that she will be able to build a biogas digester, which would help her to save more energy.

loans.use: to buy a quality exotic breed of dairy cow

loans.name: Valery

texts.ru:
Валерий женат. У него есть маленький сын. Валерий имеет свой бизнес.

Валерий занимается выращиванием овощей на протяжении 9 лет. Он имеет пять больших теплиц и теплицу для рассады. Валерий трудолюбивый и предприимчивый. Он работает по 10-12 часов в день без выходных.  Валерий приобрел участок земли и в будущем хочет построить новые теплицы и дом для своей семьи.

Валерий   просит предоставить ему кредит в сумме 15 000 гривен на закупку удобрений и пленки.
texts.en:
Valery is married. He has a young son. Valery has his own business.

For the past 9 years, Valery has been growing vegetables. He has five large hothouses and greenhouses. Valery is hardworking and entrepreneurial. He works between 10 and 12 hours per day without any weekends off. Valery bought a plot of land and in the future, he would like to build a new greenhouse there and a home for his family.

Valery is requesting a loan for 15,000 hryvnia (UAH) to buy fertilizer and plastic covers for his greenhouses.

loans.use: to buy to buy fertilizer and plastic covers for his greenhouses.

loans.name: Edson

texts.en: Edson is a 42-year-old married man with six children living in Kasese, Uganda. He operates a retail shop. He has been in that business since 2010. He practices coffee farming for additional income. His motive for this business is to cater to his family's needs. Edson is a hardworking person who desires to expand business in spite of price fluctuations and weather changes which affect his profitability level and crops, respectively. He wants money to buy salt, rice, sugar, soap and general merchandise to sell.

loans.use: to buy salt, rice, sugar, soap and general merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Derya

texts.en:
Derya is a married woman and has two children. She first began working at home then set up her own business in advertising. She prints companies’ logos on T-shirts with the help of her husband. With the second loan she will receive, she is planning to buy fabric from Denizli, Turkey to produce the T-shirt orders that she has.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Derya hanım evli ve iki çocuk annesi.Evde başladığı işini ilerleterek kendine reklam işleri yapan dükkanını açmış.Burada çeşitli reklam ve firmaların baskı işlerini yapıyor.Eşi de kendisine yardım ediyor.Derya Hanım aldığı ikinci kredi ile Denizli’den kumaş alacak .Siparişleri için bu kumaşları kullanacak.Kumaşların üzerine benzin istasyonlarının amblemlerini baskısını yapıyor.

loans.use: to buy different types and colors of fabric wholesale.

loans.name: Mwanamkuu

texts.en:
Mwanamkuu is a married woman aged 50 years. She has six children,  all of whom still attend school. She lives at a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Mwanamkuu operates a fruits and vegetables selling stall. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of competition and seasonality in her business. 

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of fruits, oranges, bananas and green vegetables for resale. She dreams of expanding and establishing a retail shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits, oranges, bananas and green vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Almas

texts.en: Almas is 44 years of age. Her great skill in machine embroidery and an experience of 5 years in this field has given her a very good reputation in her community. Her daughters also help in embroidery work. Over the years, the demand for her hand embroidered cloth has grown and she uses the income generated to pay for the expenses of her 2 children. Almas is in her 5th loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior. She has now requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase spools of threads, a measuring tape, embroidery scissors, frames and tracing paper. She hopes that her skill will help in providing for her family’s health expenses.

loans.use: to purchase spools of threads, a measuring tape, embroidery scissors, frames and tracing paper.

loans.name: Tabasum

texts.en: Tabasum is a 33-year-old, married woman and a mother of 5 children. She has been running a business selling embroidered cloth for many years. She purchases a variety of cloth from the main city and then sells it to the people of her vicinity. She has become famous for selling good quality cloth in her community. She requested a loan of PKR 45,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy a variety of embroidered cloth for the summer season by taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she will be able to earn more income through her greater sales. She is in her 4th loan cycle with good credit history. She hopes to have a good experience with this loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard efforts in her business.

loans.use: to buy a variety of embroidered cloth for the summer season.

loans.name: Asima

texts.en: Asima is a 30-year-old married woman and a mother of 2 children. She has been successfully running a general store business for the past 5 years. She offers various goods for daily use. She is in her 4th loan cycle and has shown good repayment history. The loan amount that she has requested is 40,000 PKR. She wants to grow her business and wants to buy stock from the market such as oil, rice, spices, biscuits, beverages etc. at lower rates with the loan amount. She, then, would be able to meet the increasing demand of her customers consistently. She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to deal with the expenses of her children.

loans.use: to buy stock from the market such as oil, rice, spices, biscuits, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Maqsoodan

texts.en: Maqsoodan is a 57-year-old married woman. She has been running a business of a beauty parlor for 2 years. She offers many services to her customers such as makeup, hair styling and facials. She is happy to be working hard in support of her husband by bringing income to the home. Slowly, her customer base is expanding and her income is rising. In order to meet with the increasing demands of her customers, she is interested in buying more variety of products for the parlor. For this reason she has requested a loan amount of 45,000 PKR to buy makeup items, hair care products, hair styling products, skin products, etc. in large quantities. With the help of the loan, she will be able to increase her income to meet her household expenditures.

loans.use: to buy makeup items, hair care products, hair styling products, skin products, etc. in large quantities.

loans.name: Hafeezn

texts.en: Hafeezn is a 42-year-old married woman running a business of milk selling for many years with the help of her husband. She has 2 cows and 1 buffalo for milking purposes. She sells the milk in her area. Her business is doing well enough to pay for her family’s expenses. She has two children. She is a dedicated mother and wants the best for her children. She uses most of the income to pay for her children’s health and education. She is in her 3rd loan cycle. Now, she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase one more buffalo for milking. She is hopeful that her business will expand with the help of this loan and she will be able to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions for her children.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo.

loans.name: Reginah

texts.en:
Reginah is a 41-year-old woman married to Duncan who adds additional income to support their family welfare. They are blessed with five children.

Reginah has been operating a poultry business alongside a grocery as a secondary business for a period of ten years earning herself an income of KES 10,000 at the end of every month.

Reginah was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a credit officer and is now servicing her first loan of KES 15,000. She intends to use this amount to buy additional hens to add to her current stock of poultry.

Reginah plans to use the anticipated income to pay for school for her children and hopes to have a bright future full of success.

loans.use: to buy additional hens to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys used a previous loan to buy iron sheets to roof her house. Gladys has been running a produce business to earn additional income and supplement her work as a small scale farmer for six years. 

She wishes to complete a permanent house, which she has already started building, and educate her children so that they can attain degrees. She supplies maize flour and beans to schools on credit and faces hardships due to their delayed payments. 

Her goal is to own a food store that can sustainably supply her customers year-round. Gladys needs a loan to buy iron sheets to roof her house.

loans.use: to buy iron sheets to roof her house.

loans.name: Mimve

texts.en:
Mimve is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Mimve is 43 years old and has two children who are in school.

Mimve has a fishing business in the Philippines. Mimve requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment. Mimve has been in this business for 14 years. 

In the future, Mimve would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Nanet

texts.en:
Nanet is 32 years old and married with three children. Two of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

Nanet has a fishing business in the Philippines. Nanet requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other fishing equipment. Nanet has been in this business for seven years. 

In the future, Nanet would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other fishing equipment.

loans.name: Elevi Antonio

texts.es:
Elevi de 32 años de edad, es bachiller y su apreja trabaja cuidando a su abuelita; tiene un hijo que esta estudiando parvularia, la abuelita de la esposa vive con él. 

Elevi es empleado por más de nueve años, tambien tiene otras actividades economicas como es la agricultura y ganado bovino y lo aprendio de sus padres y decidio hacerlo para obtener un ingreso economico extra para su familia.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar semilla de maíz, pesticidas, herbicidas y ganado de doble proposito, le mejorara mucho ya que podra tener granos básicos para la alimentación de su familia y ademas alimento para el ganado y por lo tanto su calidad de vida sera mejor, con el prestmao se siente satisfecho porque tiene la oportunidad de trabajar sin tener limitantes.

Sus sueños son poder seguir trabajando de la mejor manera para darles un mejor futuro a su familia. En cuanto a su hijo que estudia y se prepara academicamente.
texts.en:
Elevi is 32 years old, he is a graduate and his partner takes care of her grandmother. He has a son who is studying kindergarten teaching, and his wife's grandmother lives with them.

Elevi has been employed for over nine years, he also has other financial ventures like agriculture and cattle, which he learnt from his parents and decided to do for an extra source of income for his family.

The loan he is applying for is to buy corn seeds, pesticides, herbicides and cattle (for milk and meat). This will provide a big advantage as he will have basic grains to be able to feed his family and feed the cattle, resulting in a better quality of life. The loan will give him the opportunity to work without limits.

His dream is to continue working in the best way to give his family a better future, by providing for his son and allowing him to prepare academically.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, pesticides, herbicides and cattle (for milk and meat)

loans.name: Emmah

texts.en:
Emmah is 31 years old, married to Erick and blessed with three children aged 10, 18 and two years. For the past three years Emmah  has been operating a retail shop and also sells bed sheets to her customers. She earns a monthly income of KES.30,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES).
	 
Emmah is requesting her first loan of 30,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya to buy more stock of goods such as tea leaves, cooking fat, and sweets to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to provide for her family's basic needs and purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as tea leaves, cooking fat and sweets

loans.name: Justiner

texts.en:
Justiner, a 56-year-old mother of six, is married to David, who earns additional income to support their family. Justiner has been operating a clothing sales business for a period of 10 years, earning a monthly income of KES.8,000.

Justiner, who was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a credit officer, is requesting her first loan of KES. 10,000 to buy trousers, shirts, jeans, dresses, blouses and shorts to sell. She plans to use the anticipated income to pay for her children's school fees and hopes to have a bright and successful future.

loans.use: To buy trousers, shirts, jeans, dresses, blouses and shorts to sell

loans.name: Lidia Dinora

texts.es:
Lidia tiene 40 años de edad, ella se crió con su abuela, ahora está casada y tiene 3 hijos.


Lidia tiene 20 años de experiencia en la venta de ropa, trabajó durante muchos años en un negocio parecido pero después se independizó, además realiza oficios domésticos y lo aprendió de su abuela.


Ella necesita el crédito para surtir su negocio de ropa, también para diversificarlo comprará nuevos productos como calzados y bolsos para ponerlos a la venta, de forma que podrá atraer clientes nuevos al incorporar otro tipo de productos en su negocio.

Sus planes son apoyar en la educación de su hijo hasta que sean unos profesionales, además desea ampliar su negocio y abrir uno nuevo en otro lugar.
texts.en:
Lidia is 40 years old. She was raised by her grandmother. She is now married and has 3 children. Lidia has been selling clothes for 20 years.


 For a long time she worked in a similar business, but after that, she became independent. She also does household chores, she learnt it from her grandmother.

She needs the loan to supply her clothing business. She also wants to have a bigger diversity and she'll buy new products such as shoes and handbags to sell them. That way, she'll be able to attract more clients having other products in her shop.

Her goal is to support her children with their education until they become professionals. She also wishes to expand her business and to open another one in a different location.

loans.use: to supply her business with clothes and to buy new products  such as shoes and handbags to sell.

loans.name: Binti

texts.en:
Binti is 46 years of age, married and with three kids, all of whom attend school, which is the reason for her hard work. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. 

Binti has operated a kiosk business from home for the past six years, selling to passersby and neighbours. She cited seasonality and theft as her business challenges. 

With the KSh 30,000 loan, she wants to purchase iron sheets for construction of her house. Her dream is to see her children get a better education and become important people in the society.

loans.use: to purchase iron sheets for construction of her house

loans.name: Rosevilla

texts.en:
Rosevilla is 61 years old and married with four children. Rosevilla works very hard to provide for them.

Rosevilla runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell. Rosevilla has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods, and other groceries. 

In the future Rosevilla would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Santos Noel

texts.es:
Santos tiene 45 años de edad, está acompañado y tiene 3 hijos,


Santos se dedica al trabajo de carpintería ya que tiene su propio taller en casa obteniendo así su trabajo estable, luego los fines de semana dedica su tiempo a sus cultivos de maíz y frijol  y el tiempo libre lo dedica a su descanso junto con su esposa y demás familia.


Este crédito lo necesita para comprar fertilizantes y otros insumos agrícolas ya que es época de siembra y él quiere estar preparado para obtener una buena cosecha.


Sus planes a futuro son inculcar buenos principios morales a sus hijos servir en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Santos is 45 years old, married and has 3 children. Santos is a carpenter and has his own workshop at home, keeping this as his stable job. On weekends he tends his corn and bean crops and spends his spare time resting together with his wife and family.

He needs this loan to buy fertilisers and other agricultural supplies as it is the planting season and he wants to be prepare to yield a good harvest.

His plans for the future are to instil good moral principles in his children, serving his community.

loans.use: to buy fertilisers and other agricultural supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her brother's university tuition

loans.name: Farangis

texts.ru: Фарангис энергичная женщина. Она живет вместе с бабушкой и ребенком. Фарангис разведенная и сама воспитывает своего ребенка. Она учится на 5 курсе Таджикского Государственного Университета Коммерции. Фарангис хочет после окончания университета поступить на работу и обеспечить своего ребенка и бабушку со всеми не обходимыми средствами. Пенсия бабушки маленькая и поэтому ее отец помогает ей по домохозяйству. Фарангис должна оплатить за учебный договор и поэтому она запрашивает займ на сумму 600 долларов США. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Farangis is an energetic woman. She lives with her grandmother and child. Farangis is divorced and raising her child on her own. She is a fifth-year student at the Tajikistan State Commerce University. Farangis wants to get a job after graduating from the university and provide her child and grandmother with all of the necessities. Her grandmother's pension is small, and this is why Farangis's father helps her with the household. Farangis has to pay for her tuition and is requesting a loan in the amount of 600 US dollars for this purpose. She awaits your kindness and hopes for your mercy.

loans.use: to pay for her university tuition

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for kitchen tools, food packaging (boxes, bags, plastic wrap, foil, etc.), various stocks of ingredients, cooling racks, baking dishes and other materials needed in baking.

loans.name: Min Ma Kone Village

texts.en:
Located in Central Myanmar’s Yaysagyo township, this community currently has 52 village customers, including 6 CBO (Community Based Organization) committee members who help to lead the loan program in the area. This village is located in Myanmar's dry zone, where insufficient rainfall is very common. Most villagers are Buddhist and struggle finding access to affordable credit, as the state-owned agricultural bank is not active in the area.

Most farmers in this village grow sesame and cotton, and some grow chili.  Farmers in this village spend, on average, $150 each season on farming expenses, such as seeds, compost, and labor fees.  Labor, in particular, is expensive, given that most young people are migrating to urban centers in search of jobs.  The new loan will help these smallholder farmers cover their farming expenses, which are necessary to enrich and efficiently harvest their crops.   

Pictured above are the committee members from the Min Ma Kone Village CBO: U Aung, U Sein, U Phoe, Daw Thin, Daw Ye, and U Zaw. Also included in photo are two non-committee member borrowers.  U Aung, third from the left, is 57 years old with a family of six. He grows sesame, rice paddy, and chick peas.  For supplementary income, he sells fermented soybeans to other farmers. Last season, he used his loan to buy three bags of fertilizer for his farm.  This season, he also hopes to invest in fertilizer to boost crop yields and, therefore, crop sales.

loans.use: to help 52 villagers purchase farming inputs that will increase crop yields.

loans.name: Yin Mar Taw Village

texts.en:
Located in Central Myanmar’s Magway township, this community currently has 45 village customers, including 6 CBO (Community Based Organization) committee members who help to lead the loan program in the area. Due to irregular and infrequent rainfall, farmers are struggling to sustain sufficient crop yields and some failed crops have to be replanted. As most villagers are Buddhist, they must save money for cultural ceremonies, such as offering provisions to monks.

The new loan will help village members raise livestock, such as cows and pigs. The price for one small pig is about $40 and can be sold for about $150 after raising it for about seven months. The profits from raising livestock will be used to purchase farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer, which usually cost about $200 each planting season. As a longer-term investment, they would like to buy a tractor, which can increase crop production, ease the harvesting process, and save on labor costs. There are other income generating businesses in the village, such as growing palm trees, selling groceries, and tailoring.

Pictured above are the committee members from Yin Mar Taw Village CBO: U Myint, U Zaw, U Win, U Min, Daw Lei, and Daw Khin (photo also includes one additional non-CBO village member).  Included in the photo (first from the left) is U Myint, who is 45 years old and has 6 family members. He is planning to raise livestock because he has historically had to hire bulls to use on his farm.  These leased bulls are quite expensive, costing $15 an hour.

loans.use: to help 45 villagers raise livestock such as cows, pigs, and bulls

loans.name: Tei Pin San Village

texts.en:
Located in Central Myanmar’s Magway township, this community currently has 29 village customers, including six CBO (Community Based Organization) committee members who help to lead the loan program in the area. This community of farming households cultivates sesame, groundnuts, millet and pigeon pea. As most villagers are Buddhist, they must routinely contribute to monasteries and save money for community ceremonies.

The new loan will be very helpful for village clients to hire labor and purchase farming inputs such as various seeds and fertilizer. As higher quality inputs drive higher yields in future seasons, clients hope to use increased revenues to make larger investments, such as a tractor. Without a tractor, farmers have to rely on using bulls or renting equipment from neighboring villages at very high rates. 

Pictured above are the committee members from the Tei Pin San village CBO: U Aung, U Khin, U Aye, Daw War, Daw Ei, U Pyay, and U Kan. Included in the photo (second from the left) is U Khin, who is 35 years old and the father of three children. Not only does he farm, but he also works on a construction site. He has to support his childrens' education expenses because they are students. He purchased farming inputs such as fertilizers and seeds with his past loan. For this season, he still has to invest in buying new seeds such as sesame and groundnuts, fertilizer, and topsoil.

loans.use: to help 63 villagers buy high quality farming inputs

loans.name: Myauk Min Village

texts.en:
Located in Central Myanmar’s Magway township, this community currently has 39 village customers, including 6 CBO (Community Based Organization) committee members who help to lead the loan program in the area. Access to credit is difficult in this region, as the largest provider, the state-owned agricultural bank, is inactive in this region.  Additionally, farming is difficult due to erratic and insufficient rainfall, and, as most villagers are Buddhist, large sums of money must be spent on cultural ceremonies, such as providing provisions to monks.

The new loan will support the borrowers in raising livestock, such as cows, goat, pigs, and chickens. Raising livestock is very important for farmers, as the profits generally cover farming expenses. The easiest way to animals to raise are pigs and goats, as one piglet or goat is worth about $50. Moreover, there are some people doing chicken farming in the village. It costs about $1,000 for one chicken farm, where 600 small chicks will be raised. Many young people prefer to migrate to nearby cities,  where they can find formal employment opportunities.  Villagers' additional income will be contributed to build village roads, as the road network is still weak. 

Pictured above are the committee members from the Min Ywar Village CBO: U Myo, U Aung, U Han, Daw Myint, Daw Yee, and Daw Thin. Included in the photo (third from the right) is U Myo, who is the 31-year-old father of two children. His main business is farming peanuts and groundnuts and raising chickens. After raising chicks for one month, he sells them back for profit. However, feeding the chickens is quite expensive, as one bag of feed is $40.  He will therefore invest his loan in buying chicken feed.

loans.use: to help 39 villagers raise livestock, such as pigs, goats, and chickens.

loans.name: Rhea Group

texts.en:
Lileth is the featured borrower for Rhea's group. She came from the Philippines to Lebanon with her other group members to work as housekeepers in order to improve the poor living conditions of their families.  

Lileth (in the red t-shirt) is 33 years old, single, and has one child. She left her hometown in an attempt to improve the poor living conditions of her family there and to provide her daughter with a better life and education. She requested a loan, which she will use to pay for her daughter’s increasing school tuition fees.
 
Hannah (in the black t-shirt) is 40 years old and single. She wants to renovate her old house in the Philippines and make it a healthy place for her family. 

Rhea (in the white t-shirt) is 35 years old and single. She wants to improve her rice cultivation business in the Philippines.

loans.use: to pay her daughter's school fees

loans.name: Sokhom

texts.en:
Sokhom is 36 years old, lives in Phnom Penh suburb. She has been married since 2001 and has three children-2 attend school and another one is still young.   
Sokhom sells grocery items from home, while her husband is a Tuk Tuk taxi driver. She wants to expand her grocery inventory by buying additional grocery items; hence she decided to apply for a loan. 
In the past, they were commonly known as "tuk tuks" (a three wheeled motorcycle taxi), but they are now officially called "moto kangbei" by government authorities.
Photo: Sokhom is pictured in her little grocery store.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items for resale.

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.ru: Дилбар живет и работает в районе Хуросон, который расположен у предгорья. У нее четверо детей. Ее муж каждый год ездит в Россию на заработки, так как в районе трудно найти хорошо-оплачиваемую работу. Сама Дилбар учительница. Она работает в местной школе. Ей 40 лет. В настоящий момент один ее сын студент. Его зовут Шарифчон, ему 18 лет. Он учится в Финансово-экономическом институте Таджикистана по специальности "Финансы и кредит в экономической деятельности". В этом году Шарифчон перешел на второй курс, однако за годовой контракт его семья еще не внесла оплату. У Дилбар сейчас нет сбережения, поэтому она единственный выход видит в получении кредита. Ей не хватает 600 долларов США и эту сумму она просит в кредит. Дилбар очень надеется, что ее поддержат в таком трудном положении, ведь ее сын прилежно учится и очень хочет получить высшее финансовое образование.
texts.en: Dilbar lives and works in the Khuroson District, which is located in the foothills. She has four children. Every year, her husband travels to Russia for work as it is difficult to find good paying jobs in their District. Dilbar is a teacher. She works in a local school. She is 40 years old. Currently, one of her sons is a student. His name is Sharifjon and he is 18 years old. He studies at the Financial-Economic Institute of Tajikistan in the Department of Finances and Loans in Business. This year, Sharifjon has started his second year of studies, however his family have not yet paid for his tuition. Dilbar does not currently have any savings, which is why the only option she sees is getting a loan. She is in need of 600 USD, which is the amount she is requesting for her loan. Dilbar really hopes that you will support her in this difficult situation, as her son studies diligently and really wants to receive a higher education in finance.

loans.use: to pay for her son's university tuition.

loans.name: Boroen

texts.en:
Boroen, 34 year old, is a single man who lives in a rural area of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. To make a living, he manages and operates a farming business on a small farmland which is located near his house. On his farmland, he grows rice and sells his agricultural product to the local dealers. So far he has been involved with this career for around four years. 

Boroen would like to keep his rice growing well by using natural fertilizer on his farmland. Because there is insufficient money, he has applied for a loan to buy fertilizer to use in his farming process. 

With the support from this loan, he hopes his rice will grow well and produce more crops for him. He would like to thank all lenders for their financial support toward poor people.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Sokvai

texts.en:
Sokvai is 24 years old and is a married man, who has two dependent children. He lives in a community of Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. He is a construction worker in a private company. So far, he has been involved in this career for four years with an average income of around USD 3.00 per day. 

Sokvai wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in his house now. Therefore, he is borrowing a KIVA loan to build a latrine. By doing this, he can help his family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. 

He is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than those of other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Maria Theresa

texts.en:
Maria Theresa owns and operates an ornamental plant business to earn a living. She has been successful in this business for years, and she was able to repay her previous loan. She also found ways to boost her income so that she could provide more for her family's needs.

Maria Theresa would like to take out a new loan to buy additional gardening materials and supplies. She is requesting an amount of 16,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy greater quantities and varieties of ornamental plants such as ylang-ylang, golden shower, dahlias and various hanging plants.

In the future, Maria Theresa wants to grow her ornamental business. She also dreams of a well-to-do life and good health for her family. She meets up with her co-fellowship members every week, to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy more varieties of ornamental plants and various hanging plant needed in her business.

loans.name: Leocadio

texts.es:
Leocadio tiene 57 años, es conviviente, conocido en el medio, por la labor de crianza y venta de animales menores. Vive en casa propia solo con su conyuge, sus hijos viven disipados. Leocadio cuenta con buenas referencias. Vive en una comunidad habitada por gente respetuosa, que se dedicadan a la agricultura y ganaderia; y esta ubicada en el distrito de Lagunas, provincia de Chiclayo, región de Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Leocadio se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como cuyes, desde hace más de 05 años, adicionalmente trabaja como acopiador de leche por zona de residencia, él necesita préstamo para invertir en compra de animales y comida para estos, lo que le permitirá tener animales en mejores condiciones lo que le permitirá venderlos a un mejor precio, para que así obtener mayores ingresos, mejores ganancias y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Leocadio is 57 years old and lives with his wife. He is well known for his work in raising and selling small farm animals.

Leocadio and his wife live in their own house. Their children reside in diverse locations. He comes with good references. Leocadio lives in a community inhabited by respectable people who are dedicated to agriculture and livestock raising. He lives in Lagunas district, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, along Peru's north coast.

Leocadio has been dedicated to raising and selling small animals, like guinea pigs, for more than 5 years. In addition, he delivers milk in a residential zone. 

Leocadio needs the loan to purchase more animals as well as their feed. This will allow him to raise animals in better condition that he can sell at a higher price, earning more income. These better earnings will improve his quality of life.

loans.use: buy guinea pigs to raise and food to feed them.

loans.name: Anabelle

texts.en:
Anabelle is a  49 year old married woman and a mother of eight children from Dulag, Leyte. Anabelle earns a living through selling of coconut wine and soft drinks. Coconut wine can be fermented into vinegar, which is used in cooking. This is the source of her income. Her husband works as a carpenter. 

Anabelle's business was damaged when a typhoon hit the country several months ago. As of now, she is starting to rebuild again. 

Anabelle is now requesting a loan to buy more coconut wine and soft drinks. With this, she will be able to sell again to her customers, thus augmenting her income. 

In the future, Anabelle hopes of improving her business. Moreover, she wants to save money for the school expenses of her children.

loans.use: to buy more coconut wine and soft drinks

loans.name: Airene

texts.en:
Airene is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She has used her previous loan to buy more quantities of products like meat, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in her personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 18,000 PHP loan to purchase raw ingredients and supplies needed in her business. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Airene hopes to be able to have her own restaurant and send her children to the best schools, all through her hard work in business. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buy ingredients for her food stall.

loans.name: Oyshakhon

texts.ru: Ойшахон родилась в 1993 году. Она трудолюбивая и энергичная девушка. Ойшахон не замужем и живет с родителями. Она после окончания средней школы не имела возможность поступить в университет. Ойшахон научилась у портнихи шитью женской и мужской одежды. Итак, более 3 лет она занимается предоставлением услуги портнихи. Ойшахон шьет как женскую одежду, так и мужскую одежду. Ойшахон постепенно развевает свой бизнес. Она нуждается новой швейной машинке и поэтому она запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 сомони для покупки швейной машинке. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Oyshakhon was born in 1993. She is a hardworking and energetic young woman. Oyshakhon is not married and lives with her parents. After graduating from high school, she did not have the opportunity to go to university. Oyshakhon learned from a dressmaker to sew women's and men's clothing. And so, for more than three years, she has been providing services as a clothing maker. Oyshakhon sews both women's and men's clothes. Oyshakhon is developing her business step by step. She needs a new sewing machine and therefore she is requesting a loan of 2,000 somoni to purchase a sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a 50-year-old widow who is blessed with four children and has been operating a farming business for ten years earning an income of 15,000 KES at the end of every month.

Josephine was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a Credit Officer and is now servicing her first loan of 30,000 KES and intends to use this amount to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for her farm plantation.

Josephine plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees for her children and hopes to become a successful business woman.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seedlings.
